			Most "light" that is created by any means isn't...Dark?

Like, it can be made to look "dark" by putting a filter over it, such as an LED having a dark blue casing that makes the light cast from it appear to be "dark", but the light itself is still bright.

Most "light" that is created by any means isn't...Dark?

Like, it can be made to look "dark" by putting a filter over it, such as an LED having a dark blue casing that makes the light cast from it appear to be "dark", but the light itself is still bright.

[url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=367673][i][/url]
								[url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=367673]Punslinger[/url]

		[b]Posts:[/b] [url=./search.php?author_id=367673&sr=posts]5602[/url]		[b]Joined:[/b] Wed Dec 17, 2008 6:00 pm

											[b]Location:[/b] Texas

				[b]Contact:[/b]

					[url=#]

					[/url]

																	[url=./ucp.php?i=pm&mode=compose&action=quotepost&p=1613750]
										Send private message
									[/url]

						[url=#p1613750][Resolved]Meiton [Darkness Release][/url]

									[url=./viewtopic.php?p=1613750#p1613750]
						[/i]Post
					[/url]
								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=367673]Punslinger[/url][/b] » Sat Sep 21, 2013 12:29 pm

			I really wish we could've gone another 6 months without someone trying to go British Imperialist on this subject so I could come up with a better solution, but thus far my best suggestion is dismantling the f3ck out of the Awai. Not that I'm saying we should, only that it's overreaching its bounds by a large enough stretch that I could trim some fat and there'd still be a clan left over.

The Nara are very, very relevant, Si. The Awai clan split off from the Nara because back in the day someone thought it'd be cute to have an angellic looking Konoha nin and the needed an excuse. And while the Awai do mostly hard constructs, their element is LIGHT. Yes, I realize that scientifically there is no such thing as darkness, only an absence of light, and as Jesse pointed out, your bloodline covers the absence of light. But if you're going to argue that you're entitled to darkness because it's the absence of light, then I'm going to have to point out that the absence of something has no physical presence.

You can't make a wall of nothing. It makes no sense. Yes, you SHOULD be able to make hard constructs with some inky black thing and call it darkness, but not on the grounds that you're doing it with an Awai.

I would point out that the largest and most persistent gripe I have with the Heat clan and Awai monopoly on bright lights is their lack of foundation in both logic and human ingenuity; control over a single thematic element may mean you can create the conditions for its absence, but it doesn't mean you can control those conditions as well. The Awai can control light. It doesn't make them the only ones who can make it. The heat clan controls heat. It doesn't make them the only ones who can use a mythological energy source (i.e. chakra) to create conditions that remove heat from the surrounding area without using ice.

Yes, I realize there's a slippery slope argument coming, that with that logic standard ninpou can do anything. But it's pretty clear that being a ninja lightbulb doesn't make you a ninja shadow bender when you turn yourself off. Doton users can't branch out into crystal release any more than a Kouton user could pull a Magneto and bloodbend with the iron in your blood. There is a fundamental difference between having a power and controlling its source. Ability slots are the former.

I like darkness as an element, it's a basic fantasy archetype and one that deserves to be done right. This isn't the way to do it right.

			[i]CharactersShow [color=peru][b][Rank] Genin • Iwagakure no Sato • [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=4805348/1/]Shin[/url]

Missions Accomplished:[/b] [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=4866128/1/#new]Shinfo Mission[/url]

[b][Rank] Jounin • Konohagakure no Sato • [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=4944096/1/#new]Tsutomu[/url]

Missions Accomplished:[/b]

[/color]

Author: Post

I really wish we could've gone another 6 months without someone trying to go British Imperialist on this subject so I could come up with a better solution, but thus far my best suggestion is dismantling the f3ck out of the Awai. Not that I'm saying we should, only that it's overreaching its bounds by a large enough stretch that I could trim some fat and there'd still be a clan left over.

The Nara are very, very relevant, Si. The Awai clan split off from the Nara because back in the day someone thought it'd be cute to have an angellic looking Konoha nin and the needed an excuse. And while the Awai do mostly hard constructs, their element is LIGHT. Yes, I realize that scientifically there is no such thing as darkness, only an absence of light, and as Jesse pointed out, your bloodline covers the absence of light. But if you're going to argue that you're entitled to darkness because it's the absence of light, then I'm going to have to point out that the absence of something has no physical presence.

You can't make a wall of nothing. It makes no sense. Yes, you SHOULD be able to make hard constructs with some inky black thing and call it darkness, but not on the grounds that you're doing it with an Awai.

I would point out that the largest and most persistent gripe I have with the Heat clan and Awai monopoly on bright lights is their lack of foundation in both logic and human ingenuity; control over a single thematic element may mean you can create the conditions for its absence, but it doesn't mean you can control those conditions as well. The Awai can control light. It doesn't make them the only ones who can make it. The heat clan controls heat. It doesn't make them the only ones who can use a mythological energy source (i.e. chakra) to create conditions that remove heat from the surrounding area without using ice.

Yes, I realize there's a slippery slope argument coming, that with that logic standard ninpou can do anything. But it's pretty clear that being a ninja lightbulb doesn't make you a ninja shadow bender when you turn yourself off. Doton users can't branch out into crystal release any more than a Kouton user could pull a Magneto and bloodbend with the iron in your blood. There is a fundamental difference between having a power and controlling its source. Ability slots are the former.

I like darkness as an element, it's a basic fantasy archetype and one that deserves to be done right. This isn't the way to do it right.

------------------------------------------------------------
Author:

=== THREAD: Some Friendly Sparring [Training] - Naruto Saigen Roleplay ===
Forum: Home Board index Role Play Fire Country Konohagakure no Sato > Home Board index

------------------------------------------------------------
Author: (unknown)

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/][/url]
				Naruto Saigen Roleplay
				Naruto Saigen RP is a text-based roleplay forum set in an alternate universe of the Naruto series.
				[url=#start_here]Skip to content[/url]

------------------------------------------------------------

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Tue Sep 17, 2013 9:54 am

			It was a bright and early morning in the Land of Fire, the sun just breaking over the large treeline of the training grounds that Tenchu was currently at. He was doing what he always did: hammering into his training. Tenchu was always an early riser, up and out the door before sunrise every morning. The sound of his blows against a training dummy could be heard ringing out to anyone within a good range, as Tenchu punched and kicked the dummy until it was nothing but broken wood and stuffing. [color=#5a70b3][i]"No good... Training dummies are all but useless to me now. I need a real challenge, perhaps a spar..."[/i][/color] Tenchu loved to spar with people, he felt it was the best way to get to know someone as your true personality would show from how you fought. Win or lose, all he wanted was someone to practice against, someone that could handle his blows and deliver some of their own.

Tenchu sat on the ground and began meditating to clear his mind. Perhaps someone would join him in the training grounds sometime soon, as the sun was now up and he could see in the distance that people were beginning their hustle and bustle in the village.

			[i]

			It was a bright and early morning in the Land of Fire, the sun just breaking over the large treeline of the training grounds that Tenchu was currently at. He was doing what he always did: hammering into his training. Tenchu was always an early riser, up and out the door before sunrise every morning. The sound of his blows against a training dummy could be heard ringing out to anyone within a good range, as Tenchu punched and kicked the dummy until it was nothing but broken wood and stuffing. [color=#5a70b3][i]"No good... Training dummies are all but useless to me now. I need a real challenge, perhaps a spar..."[/i][/color] Tenchu loved to spar with people, he felt it was the best way to get to know someone as your true personality would show from how you fought. Win or lose, all he wanted was someone to practice against, someone that could handle his blows and deliver some of their own.

Tenchu sat on the ground and began meditating to clear his mind. Perhaps someone would join him in the training grounds sometime soon, as the sun was now up and he could see in the distance that people were beginning their hustle and bustle in the village.

Author: Post

It was a bright and early morning in the Land of Fire, the sun just breaking over the large treeline of the training grounds that Tenchu was currently at. He was doing what he always did: hammering into his training. Tenchu was always an early riser, up and out the door before sunrise every morning. The sound of his blows against a training dummy could be heard ringing out to anyone within a good range, as Tenchu punched and kicked the dummy until it was nothing but broken wood and stuffing. [color=#5a70b3][i]"No good... Training dummies are all but useless to me now. I need a real challenge, perhaps a spar..."[/i][/color] Tenchu loved to spar with people, he felt it was the best way to get to know someone as your true personality would show from how you fought. Win or lose, all he wanted was someone to practice against, someone that could handle his blows and deliver some of their own.

Tenchu sat on the ground and began meditating to clear his mind. Perhaps someone would join him in the training grounds sometime soon, as the sun was now up and he could see in the distance that people were beginning their hustle and bustle in the village.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1471985]Jeff[/url][/b] » Tue Sep 17, 2013 11:04 am

			Akki was ready for a long day of training. He had recently just been given a secret unlike any other and was not ready to yet explore into it. He knew that he would have to get stronger in order to tame such a creature as he walked calmly through the village training grounds, catching glimpse of another ninja training against what seemed to be a dummy. No ordinarily, Akki wouldn't really care to help the boy, but the circumstances were different and he needed to be stronger as he walked up.

[b]"Looks like you got no one to train with."[/b] he would speak with a smile as an uneasy feeling started to creep up through his stomach, his hand grasping it somewhat tightly. [b]"I'm trying to get a lot stronger, and I thought it would benefit us both if we had a little bit of a fight."[/b] he would speak once more.

			[i]

Author: Post

Akki was ready for a long day of training. He had recently just been given a secret unlike any other and was not ready to yet explore into it. He knew that he would have to get stronger in order to tame such a creature as he walked calmly through the village training grounds, catching glimpse of another ninja training against what seemed to be a dummy. No ordinarily, Akki wouldn't really care to help the boy, but the circumstances were different and he needed to be stronger as he walked up.

[b]"Looks like you got no one to train with."[/b] he would speak with a smile as an uneasy feeling started to creep up through his stomach, his hand grasping it somewhat tightly. [b]"I'm trying to get a lot stronger, and I thought it would benefit us both if we had a little bit of a fight."[/b] he would speak once more.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Tue Sep 17, 2013 11:35 am

			Tenchu rose from the ground when he heard a male voice from behind him. As he checked to see who it was, he found a black haired boy about the same size as him. Of course, this observation came second to the fact that he had some weird masses coming from behind his ears and what looked to be two tails. [color=#5a70b3]"Uhh, are you okay? you seem to have... growths of some sort."[/color] Tenchu wasn't one to beat around the bush, if something was strange to him he would harshly point it out. [color=#5a70b3]Uh, that aside however, sure, I was just thinking that I needed a partner to train with, these dummies don't put up much of a fight."[/color] Tenchu said as he pointed to the dummy he had pulverized.

[color=#5a70b3]"Why don't you go first, I'd love to see what you're capable of."[/color] Tenchu's face changed to a serious expression as he took a battle ready stance and motioned for his current sparring partner to come at him.

			[i]

Author: Post

Tenchu rose from the ground when he heard a male voice from behind him. As he checked to see who it was, he found a black haired boy about the same size as him. Of course, this observation came second to the fact that he had some weird masses coming from behind his ears and what looked to be two tails. [color=#5a70b3]"Uhh, are you okay? you seem to have... growths of some sort."[/color] Tenchu wasn't one to beat around the bush, if something was strange to him he would harshly point it out. [color=#5a70b3]Uh, that aside however, sure, I was just thinking that I needed a partner to train with, these dummies don't put up much of a fight."[/color] Tenchu said as he pointed to the dummy he had pulverized.

[color=#5a70b3]"Why don't you go first, I'd love to see what you're capable of."[/color] Tenchu's face changed to a serious expression as he took a battle ready stance and motioned for his current sparring partner to come at him.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1471985]Jeff[/url][/b] » Tue Sep 17, 2013 11:50 am

			[b]"Well I can't really explain it myself but let's get started instead."[/b] Akki would speak with a smile as he quickly took a stance before charging in toward his new found opponent. The aim of today would rely all on akki's ability to change his strength into something that would be more formidable to other people. The only way he was going to do that is by getting a few good punches and kicks in as his feet would move, one step after the other.

[i]I have my speed down but I really need strength to match.[/i] he would think to himself before bending his right knee and jumping up at his opponent with a side kick. The kick would aim for the stomach of his opponent, to see what it was that his opponent was really able to take in as well as dish out back. [i]Nothing like finding out if this is a quick waste of time or might prove to be something better.[/i] he would continue to think.

If the kick were to not become successful, Akki would use his hands to push off of the ground and flip backwards back onto his two feet. He mained in the art of Taijutsu and was quick and pretty agile for his age and ninja class.

Words: 217/1000

			[i]

Author: Post

[b]"Well I can't really explain it myself but let's get started instead."[/b] Akki would speak with a smile as he quickly took a stance before charging in toward his new found opponent. The aim of today would rely all on akki's ability to change his strength into something that would be more formidable to other people. The only way he was going to do that is by getting a few good punches and kicks in as his feet would move, one step after the other.

[i]I have my speed down but I really need strength to match.[/i] he would think to himself before bending his right knee and jumping up at his opponent with a side kick. The kick would aim for the stomach of his opponent, to see what it was that his opponent was really able to take in as well as dish out back. [i]Nothing like finding out if this is a quick waste of time or might prove to be something better.[/i] he would continue to think.

If the kick were to not become successful, Akki would use his hands to push off of the ground and flip backwards back onto his two feet. He mained in the art of Taijutsu and was quick and pretty agile for his age and ninja class.

Words: 217/1000

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Tue Sep 17, 2013 12:20 pm

			Tenchu was ready for whatever attack his new found partner decided to throw at him. He had been practicing a counter that was aimed at throwing someone off balance by taking the brunt of an enemies strike on their arm. This was what he intended for his new partner, and the reason why he wanted him to go first. The boy flew at him, quicker than he had anticipated, and went to snap kick him in the stomach, leaping into the air. [color=#5a70b3][i]"Now!"[/i][/color] Tenchu thought as his right arm took the blow, feeling a bit of pressure, but not much pain, as the kick had great form but lacked power. Tenchu's arms then went upwards, crossing at the wrist, using his right elbow in an attempt to throw the boy off balance by bringing his leg up with his arm. To finish the attempt, he took a step forward on his left foot while attempting to bring down his left arm onto the boy's shoulder or head, ending in a sideways position to the boy. However, He had evaded his strike by essentially falling onto the ground and hand springing back to his feet. [color=#5a70b3]"Your pretty agile, I like that. You need some more strength behind your strikes though, that kick had good form, but was overall pretty weak."[/color] Being up front about things like that are what made someone stronger, so Tenchu had no problem pointing out the boy's flaws so that he might improve upon them. [color=#5a70b3]"So now what, is it my turn?"[/color]

OOC: 255/800 words for counter move.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

Author: Post

Tenchu was ready for whatever attack his new found partner decided to throw at him. He had been practicing a counter that was aimed at throwing someone off balance by taking the brunt of an enemies strike on their arm. This was what he intended for his new partner, and the reason why he wanted him to go first. The boy flew at him, quicker than he had anticipated, and went to snap kick him in the stomach, leaping into the air. [color=#5a70b3][i]"Now!"[/i][/color] Tenchu thought as his right arm took the blow, feeling a bit of pressure, but not much pain, as the kick had great form but lacked power. Tenchu's arms then went upwards, crossing at the wrist, using his right elbow in an attempt to throw the boy off balance by bringing his leg up with his arm. To finish the attempt, he took a step forward on his left foot while attempting to bring down his left arm onto the boy's shoulder or head, ending in a sideways position to the boy. However, He had evaded his strike by essentially falling onto the ground and hand springing back to his feet. [color=#5a70b3]"Your pretty agile, I like that. You need some more strength behind your strikes though, that kick had good form, but was overall pretty weak."[/color] Being up front about things like that are what made someone stronger, so Tenchu had no problem pointing out the boy's flaws so that he might improve upon them. [color=#5a70b3]"So now what, is it my turn?"[/color]

OOC: 255/800 words for counter move.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1471985]Jeff[/url][/b] » Wed Sep 18, 2013 12:19 pm

			His opponent was very blunt with the critique about Akki's lack of strength within his attacks. [i]He just pointed out the obvious, but I guess that only means that I am going to have to come in even stronger.[/i] he would start to think to himself as he balanced out onto his feet, thinking back on the type of counter that was being used against him. [i]He tried to grab a hold of my body and either attack or throw me down... Not really sure, but I know I gotta be careful.[/i] he would continue to think before stretching out his right leg a bit.

[b]"You know, counters are always good to have under pocket, but maybe you should keep a better footing and place your hands in a better position so that your opponent won't escape."[/b] he would speak before speeding toward his sparring partner once more.

One step after another he would run forward, arms behind him as his body would leap into the air. [i]Momentum will bring strength.[/i] a quick though would cross his mind as he performed a straight kick toward his opponent. Luckily for the Jinchuuriki, he had trained in different styles of Taijutsu and using the high style was surely one that would help both his speed and strength.

The kick would aim, just about near the right shoulder of his sparring partner, and if his opponent was able to dodge or even block, he would try to use his right leg (the other one) to pull back and try to kick his opponent once more. The goal, to just force power into his attacks.

Words: 488/1000
jutsShow
*[High Kick]

D-Ranked Taijutsu

This simple technique begins with the user approaching the opponent and leaping soon before overlapping. The moment the legs come off of the ground, one of the user's legs will stretch straight out to form a simple flying kick. Because the user of this technique is suddenly at a higher position in the air, this attack may surprise the opponent and go past his/her defenses.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Wed Sep 18, 2013 2:22 pm

			Tenchu again readied himself for the assault his sparring partner was about to dish out, as the genin darted towards him. Apparently the boy thought he was attempting a grapple, when in reality the move in question was a simple hammer fist style counter, aimed at the opponents shoulder or head to knock them to the ground. He did however take the boy's advice to heart, and plant his feet more firmly to the ground. The boy leapt from the ground and performed a straight kick into his shoulder, which Tench allowed to hit, feeling the force on his shoulder as the pain began coursing through his arm. This of course was intentional, as he intended to counter the next attack. As the second kick came in, he blocked the blow with his left elbow, and once more, bringing his arms and his opponents leg above his head. Then, taking a swift step forward on his right leg and putting his right side to the boy, he brought his right arm down in a hammerfist aimed at his opponent's left shoulder. Whether the counter hit or not mattered little, Tenchu's form was flawless, but he lacked his full strength on this maneuver. He still wasn't satisfied with the result, and his right arm was in a good amount of pain.

-----------------Training end------------------

Tenchu backed up a bit, and dropped his stance. [color=#5a70b3]"That kick was a lot better, my arm is still in pain from the blow. I still don't feel good about that counter though, I can do better. Okay, what next?"[/color]

OOC: 462/800 for strong fist Counter attack.

			[i]

Author: Post

Tenchu again readied himself for the assault his sparring partner was about to dish out, as the genin darted towards him. Apparently the boy thought he was attempting a grapple, when in reality the move in question was a simple hammer fist style counter, aimed at the opponents shoulder or head to knock them to the ground. He did however take the boy's advice to heart, and plant his feet more firmly to the ground. The boy leapt from the ground and performed a straight kick into his shoulder, which Tench allowed to hit, feeling the force on his shoulder as the pain began coursing through his arm. This of course was intentional, as he intended to counter the next attack. As the second kick came in, he blocked the blow with his left elbow, and once more, bringing his arms and his opponents leg above his head. Then, taking a swift step forward on his right leg and putting his right side to the boy, he brought his right arm down in a hammerfist aimed at his opponent's left shoulder. Whether the counter hit or not mattered little, Tenchu's form was flawless, but he lacked his full strength on this maneuver. He still wasn't satisfied with the result, and his right arm was in a good amount of pain.

-----------------Training end------------------

Tenchu backed up a bit, and dropped his stance. [color=#5a70b3]"That kick was a lot better, my arm is still in pain from the blow. I still don't feel good about that counter though, I can do better. Okay, what next?"[/color]

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1471985]Jeff[/url][/b] » Wed Sep 18, 2013 8:45 pm

			His kicks were becoming more and more of a success as he could feel the force through the expressions from his training partner. This was by far one of the greatest feelings in the world for Akki to know that he was actually getting better at certain things as the next set of moves by his sparring partner would seem to catch him off guard, not to mention that the uneasy feeling in his stomach was once more coming back to him.

[i]Now is not the time.[/i] he would think to himself as the presence of the Genma would overtake his mind, the current actions of being countered and punched to the ground now as if everything slowed in time. [i]Why do you keep trying to fight your way out of my body?[/i] he would continue to think as a fist would meet directly at his shoulder hitting him toward the ground as he fell back before rolling off of his back and back up onto his two feet. It was not as agile as any other recovery would have been but he managed to stagger to his feet after a strong blow.

[b]"Was not expecting that kind of counter."[/b] Akki would chuckle with a smile as he realized that his partner was already perfecting his owns sets of skills. [i]Time for my strength to conquer more as well![/i] he would think to himself before looking up at his opponent and speaking, [b]"Get ready. This time I'm not gonna hold back and you'll get the full force of my new found strength."[/b] he would speak with a smile before stretching his leg out once more and using full speed to run forward.

[i]Just gotta push through the pain and into the glory![/i] he would think to himself as he would quickly leap forward with a somersault, followed by a kick onto the shoulder, aiming to hit down with his right leg, before jumping right back off in a back flip and running forward with a series of small jabs to both arms and over the stomach.

At first sight and feel, the jabs were nothing more but annoying pokes, but if Akki was successfully able to get more than four off, the strength from them would increase as the muscles and his joints would contract and react to fulfill the goal it was that he had in mind. The goal to become a stronger shinobi of the hidden leaf. After all, the jinchuuriki of the Siphon Genma should have no less of a requirement than to be the best of the best.

Whether or not akki would be countered or whether he would just back off from his pure onslaught of attacks, he would sit back and take a breather before looking up at his opponent for what seemed to be a bit of approval. The only way to know that he was actually doing better and becoming stronger would be if Tenchu were to tell him. It was as iff Akki did not even need words but used the curious stare he gave at the ninja instead.

word: 1006/1000

			[i]
CharactersShow
[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=8113987/1/]Aburame, Akki[/url]Village: [color=green]Konohagakure no Sato[/color]Rank: GeninThread: [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=8114828/1/]Insects Guide Me[/url] [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=8122165/1/]Genkouyoushi, Koutaishi[/url]Village: [color=tan]Iwagakure no Sato[/color]Rank: C-RankThread: [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=4702738/1/#new]Paper Guide the Way[/url]

Author: Post

His kicks were becoming more and more of a success as he could feel the force through the expressions from his training partner. This was by far one of the greatest feelings in the world for Akki to know that he was actually getting better at certain things as the next set of moves by his sparring partner would seem to catch him off guard, not to mention that the uneasy feeling in his stomach was once more coming back to him.

[i]Now is not the time.[/i] he would think to himself as the presence of the Genma would overtake his mind, the current actions of being countered and punched to the ground now as if everything slowed in time. [i]Why do you keep trying to fight your way out of my body?[/i] he would continue to think as a fist would meet directly at his shoulder hitting him toward the ground as he fell back before rolling off of his back and back up onto his two feet. It was not as agile as any other recovery would have been but he managed to stagger to his feet after a strong blow.

[b]"Was not expecting that kind of counter."[/b] Akki would chuckle with a smile as he realized that his partner was already perfecting his owns sets of skills. [i]Time for my strength to conquer more as well![/i] he would think to himself before looking up at his opponent and speaking, [b]"Get ready. This time I'm not gonna hold back and you'll get the full force of my new found strength."[/b] he would speak with a smile before stretching his leg out once more and using full speed to run forward.

[i]Just gotta push through the pain and into the glory![/i] he would think to himself as he would quickly leap forward with a somersault, followed by a kick onto the shoulder, aiming to hit down with his right leg, before jumping right back off in a back flip and running forward with a series of small jabs to both arms and over the stomach.

At first sight and feel, the jabs were nothing more but annoying pokes, but if Akki was successfully able to get more than four off, the strength from them would increase as the muscles and his joints would contract and react to fulfill the goal it was that he had in mind. The goal to become a stronger shinobi of the hidden leaf. After all, the jinchuuriki of the Siphon Genma should have no less of a requirement than to be the best of the best.

Whether or not akki would be countered or whether he would just back off from his pure onslaught of attacks, he would sit back and take a breather before looking up at his opponent for what seemed to be a bit of approval. The only way to know that he was actually doing better and becoming stronger would be if Tenchu were to tell him. It was as iff Akki did not even need words but used the curious stare he gave at the ninja instead.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Thu Sep 19, 2013 9:46 am

			Tenchu still wanted to work on perfecting his counterattack, and it seemed his partner was still raring to go at it. Tenchu once more took a battle ready stance, with his legs spread a bit for better balance, left arm by his hip, and right elbow curved back with his hand by his face, in the form of a straight punch. The boy came at him with incredible speed, but Tenchu still tried to catch him with the counter attack, As he tried to block an oncoming kick with his arm, to once more lift his leg up and bring his arm down onto the boy's shoulder, but this time with more power, as he knew he was capable of a stronger blow than the last one. Tenchu's attack had missed completely however, as the boy flipped and delivered a strong heel drop onto his shoulder, causing intense pain in his arm once more. [color=#5a70b3]"I've never seen a style like this, he's in the air doing some of the fastest flips i've ever seen."[/color]

He had to take a step back from the genin to regain his composure, as his right arm was almost limp at this point, exhausted from the two powerful hits he had already taken. [color=#5a70b3][i]"Oh man, this kid is a bit stronger than i thought, my arm is killing me. I just need to find an opening to get him off of me."[/i][/color] He had barely enough time to shake his arm out as Akki was again on him, stepping forward with a series of light jabs aiming at Tenchu's midsection. Tenchu blocked a good amount of them with his arms, but as his right arm had already taken so much he couldn't use it much more, and he took a few to his stomach and chest as well. He took a series of steps back from the genin's assault, watching his every step. Finally, he noticed the boy took a wide step forward to continue attacking him. [color=#5a70b3][i]"Now!"[/i][/color] Tenchu thought to himself as he blocked a right jab with his left elbow, almost like a parry, bringing the arm up with his elbow as he stepped forward and brought his left arm onto the boy once more, in one of Tenchu's strongest blows. The counter was flawless this time, and whether it hit or not, the boy's onslaught was complete. Tenchu relaxed his arm a bit and checked for damages to his shoulder before meeting eyes with Akki, seeing that he wanted input on the damage he had caused him.

-------Training end------------------

[color=#5a70b3]"That was much better, your second kick to my shoulder caused it to go limp for a good while, and the jabs to my stomach began hurting after the third strike. Keep working on it your strength if you aim to be a fighter though, your form and speed is incredible, but I still have a bit more muscle."[/color] Tenchu wasn't normally one to brag, but in this scenario he just wanted to get the point across that strength is the driving point of damage when it came to fist fighting.

OOC: 875/800 words for strong fist counterattack

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

				[/i]
				Top
			[/url]

Author: Post

Tenchu still wanted to work on perfecting his counterattack, and it seemed his partner was still raring to go at it. Tenchu once more took a battle ready stance, with his legs spread a bit for better balance, left arm by his hip, and right elbow curved back with his hand by his face, in the form of a straight punch. The boy came at him with incredible speed, but Tenchu still tried to catch him with the counter attack, As he tried to block an oncoming kick with his arm, to once more lift his leg up and bring his arm down onto the boy's shoulder, but this time with more power, as he knew he was capable of a stronger blow than the last one. Tenchu's attack had missed completely however, as the boy flipped and delivered a strong heel drop onto his shoulder, causing intense pain in his arm once more. [color=#5a70b3]"I've never seen a style like this, he's in the air doing some of the fastest flips i've ever seen."[/color]

He had to take a step back from the genin to regain his composure, as his right arm was almost limp at this point, exhausted from the two powerful hits he had already taken. [color=#5a70b3][i]"Oh man, this kid is a bit stronger than i thought, my arm is killing me. I just need to find an opening to get him off of me."[/i][/color] He had barely enough time to shake his arm out as Akki was again on him, stepping forward with a series of light jabs aiming at Tenchu's midsection. Tenchu blocked a good amount of them with his arms, but as his right arm had already taken so much he couldn't use it much more, and he took a few to his stomach and chest as well. He took a series of steps back from the genin's assault, watching his every step. Finally, he noticed the boy took a wide step forward to continue attacking him. [color=#5a70b3][i]"Now!"[/i][/color] Tenchu thought to himself as he blocked a right jab with his left elbow, almost like a parry, bringing the arm up with his elbow as he stepped forward and brought his left arm onto the boy once more, in one of Tenchu's strongest blows. The counter was flawless this time, and whether it hit or not, the boy's onslaught was complete. Tenchu relaxed his arm a bit and checked for damages to his shoulder before meeting eyes with Akki, seeing that he wanted input on the damage he had caused him.

-------Training end------------------

[color=#5a70b3]"That was much better, your second kick to my shoulder caused it to go limp for a good while, and the jabs to my stomach began hurting after the third strike. Keep working on it your strength if you aim to be a fighter though, your form and speed is incredible, but I still have a bit more muscle."[/color] Tenchu wasn't normally one to brag, but in this scenario he just wanted to get the point across that strength is the driving point of damage when it came to fist fighting.

OOC: 875/800 words for strong fist counterattack

------------------------------------------------------------

			Akki was done getting ruffed a bit for the day and was surely enjoying the new found strength that came with his new found training.

[b]"Well then, that was enough for today I believe. If you want we can pick up again tomorrow on some more new tricks and trainings."[/b] he would speak before fixing his clothing and walking out toward the exit. [b]"Dawn okay?"[/b]

			[color=#5a70b3]"So you want to be sparring partners? That makes things better for the both of us, alright. I'll be here tomorrow at dawn, I normally am anyways. I'll see you then."[/color] And with that, Tenchu began going about the rest of his day. It wasn't until he was long gone that he realized he never caught the boy's name, but honestly, it didn't matter. He could fight, and that was enough for him.

						[url=#p1611553][Accepted]Kiri training[/url]

									[url=./viewtopic.php?p=1611553#p1611553]
						[/i]Post
					[/url]
								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Mon Sep 16, 2013 9:37 pm

			[b]Username:[/b] [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325/]TyDie[/url]

[b]Application:[/b] [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5171323/1/#new]Ryoga Kazuki[/url]

[b]Change:[/b] please add the following Jutsu to their respective Spoilers.
IaidoShow [color=#8B658B]*Iaido • Clash Draw[/color]

D-Rank Kenjutsu

Prerequisite: 4 Speed

In this technique, the user assumes a firm stance and then draws their weapon in an upward arc. This sort of draw makes it easy to bat away projectiles moving at a Speed and Strength equal to or lower than the user's Speed and Strength. This also enables the user to cut through advancing techniques or to clash with an opponent's weapon. This movement, however, may leave the user without the ability to sheath his weapon for some time, limiting the effectiveness of their techniques until they can.

[color=#8B658B]*Iaido • Snap Draw[/color]

C-Rank Kenjutsu

Prerequisite: 6 Taijutsu, 6 Speed

With a honed body capable of producing torque within the user's muscles, the user is capable of achieving a 'Blurred Sword' effect in an attack. The user draws their sword with such speed and power, the strike itself goes undetected by opponents lacking Taijutsu greater than a third of the user's Taijutsu stat. While essentially similar to the basic Iaido technique this one is literally beyond the normal capability of the user and as such, it can only be used a number of times per thread equal to the user's stamina and taijutsu divided by 2.

[color=#8B658B]*Iaido • Reverse Beheading Draw[/color]

B-Rank Kenjutsu

Prerequisite: Iaido • Beheading Draw

By building tension in two places in their body, the user unleashes a spin and then draws their katana in a swift motion without pause until returning to face their original direction, sword sheathing in the process. The attack has incredible destructive power, though lacks the visual blur in speed. The attack is still fast enough, however, to disorient opponents greatly.
TaijutsuShow [b]*Skillful Wield[/b]

D-Ranked Taijutsu

Prerequisite: 3 wit

With a solid foundation of knowledge on their choice of weaponry, those with the Skillful Wield technique are able to utilize their weapon more fully. By knowing the weapon's weakest points, the user is able to avoid presenting these areas to damage during combat, thus making their weapon less likely to break by means of recklessness.

[b]*Seamless Skill[/b]

D-Ranked Taijutsu

Prerequisite: 3 wit

A skill utilized by those on the path to mastery of their weapon, users of Seamless Skill are actively able to transition between offensive and defensive usage of the aforementioned weapon. By transitioning so seamlessly, the user is able to save a marginal amount of energy while attacking.
Chiton EmpathyShow [color=#DC143C]Affinity Pulse[/color]

D-Rank Ninjutsu

Prerequisite: Singled Out

After having located an individual through the use of the Singled Out technique, the user will focus on the individual in question and be able to determine what elemental affinities the individual has. This only works for elements that the user has seen before, normally being limited to those represented in Kirigakure no Sato until he is able to read and learn about others.
ChitonShow [color=#DC143C]Sanguine Reach[/color]

A-rank Ninjutsu

Utilizing a large preexisting blood source while weilding his sword, Ryoga begins performing a string of one handed seals. After finishing the final seal, A 20 meter long arm of blood emerges from the source. The arm is 1.5 meters in diameter, And it holds a 10 meter long sharpened sword of blood. As long as Ryoga holds the final seal, the arm mimics his sword arms movements, moving with a speed equal to his control to a max of 12, and hitting with a strength equal to the average of his Ninjutsu and Control, to a max of of 10. He can manifest this arm up to 15 meters away from his body, but once the arm is made it is set in that area. Ryoga is immobile as long as he holds this jutsu, save for his sword arm. Any break in his concentration ends the jutsu immediately
[b]Payment:[/b] [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=?p=1609082&t=5229000]Skillful Wield[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=?p=1609082&t=5229000]Seamless Skill[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=?p=1609305&t=5229000]Affinity Pulse[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=?p=1609743&t=5229000]Iaido - Clash Draw[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=?p=1610019&t=5229000]Iaido - Snap Draw[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=?p=1610300&t=5229000]Iaido - Reverse Beheading Draw - Part 1[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=?p=1610411&t=5229000]Iaido - Reverse Beheading Draw - Part 2[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=?p=1611233&t=5229000]Sanguine Reach - Part 1[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=?p=1611537&t=5229000]Sanguine Reach - Part 2[/url]

Prerequisite: 3 wit

With a solid foundation of knowledge on their choice of weaponry, those with the Skillful Wield technique are able to utilize their weapon more fully. By knowing the weapon's weakest points, the user is able to avoid presenting these areas to damage during combat, thus making their weapon less likely to break by means of recklessness.

[b]*Seamless Skill[/b]

D-Ranked Taijutsu

Prerequisite: 3 wit

A skill utilized by those on the path to mastery of their weapon, users of Seamless Skill are actively able to transition between offensive and defensive usage of the aforementioned weapon. By transitioning so seamlessly, the user is able to save a marginal amount of energy while attacking.
Chiton EmpathyShow [color=#DC143C]Affinity Pulse[/color]

D-Rank Ninjutsu

Prerequisite: Singled Out

After having located an individual through the use of the Singled Out technique, the user will focus on the individual in question and be able to determine what elemental affinities the individual has. This only works for elements that the user has seen before, normally being limited to those represented in Kirigakure no Sato until he is able to read and learn about others.
ChitonShow [color=#DC143C]Sanguine Reach[/color]

A-rank Ninjutsu

Utilizing a large preexisting blood source while weilding his sword, Ryoga begins performing a string of one handed seals. After finishing the final seal, A 20 meter long arm of blood emerges from the source. The arm is 1.5 meters in diameter, And it holds a 10 meter long sharpened sword of blood. As long as Ryoga holds the final seal, the arm mimics his sword arms movements, moving with a speed equal to his control to a max of 12, and hitting with a strength equal to the average of his Ninjutsu and Control, to a max of of 10. He can manifest this arm up to 15 meters away from his body, but once the arm is made it is set in that area. Ryoga is immobile as long as he holds this jutsu, save for his sword arm. Any break in his concentration ends the jutsu immediately
[b]Payment:[/b] [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=?p=1609082&t=5229000]Skillful Wield[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=?p=1609082&t=5229000]Seamless Skill[/url]

			The trainings are fine but because they weren't really training 'together' it might not count towards the event. The point of social training is to train together. Not separately side by side. It should be give and take between the parties.

[quote]
Quote:Sanguine Reach

A-rank Ninjutsu

Utilizing a large preexisting blood source while weilding his sword, Ryoga begins performing a string of one handed seals. After finishing the final seal, A 20 meter long arm of blood emerges from the source. The arm is 1.5 meters in diameter, And it holds a 10 meter long sword of blood. Author: Post

The trainings are fine but because they weren't really training 'together' it might not count towards the event. The point of social training is to train together. Not separately side by side. It should be give and take between the parties.

[quote]
Quote:Sanguine Reach

A-rank Ninjutsu

Utilizing a large preexisting blood source while weilding his sword, Ryoga begins performing a string of one handed seals. After finishing the final seal, A 20 meter long arm of blood emerges from the source. The arm is 1.5 meters in diameter, And it holds a 10 meter long sword of blood. As long as Ryoga holds the final seal, the arm mimics his sword arms movements, moving with a speed equal to his control to a max of 12, and hitting with a strength equal to the average of his Ninjutsu and Control, to a max of of 10. He can manifest this arm up to 15 meters away from his body, but once the arm is made it is set in that area.
[/quote]Needs to mention that while using it Ryoga cannot move aside from his arm and if his concentration is broken the jutsu fades. He also needs to describe if the blood sword is sharp or not.

					[/url]

									[/url]

						[url=#p1609486]Passing the Torch[/url]

							[url=./posting.php?mode=edit&f=58&p=1609486]
								EDIT
							[/url]

							[url=/forums/app.php/post/1609486/report]
								REPORT
							[/url]

									[url=./viewtopic.php?p=1609486#p1609486]
						[/i]Post
					[/url]
								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Thu Sep 12, 2013 8:19 am

			Ryoga was in an uproar at his superiors today. [color=#DC143C]"Why should I teach my signature sensory capabilities to someone else!?[/color] It was obvious that he wasn't happy with the situation, but unfortunately, he was a loyal ninja of Kirigakure, and would begrudgingly do what was asked of him. He had sent a letter to the jounin known as Takeshi Muramasa's house telling him to meet Ryoga at the training ground he had picked out. Deep in a misty forest, following a river, there was a clearing with a stream flowing through the middle, about 50 meters in diameter. This was the area Ryoga picked for their training exercises. If nothing else he could probably practice some chiton of his own, he still had some work to do on the easier techniques. But everyone had to start somewhere.

Ryoga sat in a tree, using the very sensing abilities he was to teach to Takeshi to locate him long before he reached the clearing. He probably wouldn't act on anything, for now he just wanted to know that he was coming. He would hold this jutsu until he felt his pulse.

			[i]

Author: Post

Ryoga was in an uproar at his superiors today. [color=#DC143C]"Why should I teach my signature sensory capabilities to someone else!?[/color] It was obvious that he wasn't happy with the situation, but unfortunately, he was a loyal ninja of Kirigakure, and would begrudgingly do what was asked of him. He had sent a letter to the jounin known as Takeshi Muramasa's house telling him to meet Ryoga at the training ground he had picked out. Deep in a misty forest, following a river, there was a clearing with a stream flowing through the middle, about 50 meters in diameter. This was the area Ryoga picked for their training exercises. If nothing else he could probably practice some chiton of his own, he still had some work to do on the easier techniques. But everyone had to start somewhere.

Ryoga sat in a tree, using the very sensing abilities he was to teach to Takeshi to locate him long before he reached the clearing. He probably wouldn't act on anything, for now he just wanted to know that he was coming. He would hold this jutsu until he felt his pulse.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1658377]Octopus Garden[/url][/b] » Thu Sep 12, 2013 9:57 am

			Today had been designated for Takeshi to begin his sensory training. He himself would have rather learned on his own if he could, but it had been suggested and then even ordered that he would be taught by someone with similar techniques to his own. And so Takeshi found himself travelling towards a training grounds which had been designated to him via a letter from whom he supposed would be his mentor. The spot was not too hard to get to and when he arrived he saw no one else waiting for him. Either he was early, they were late, or they were hiding. He made himself comfortable by the stream while he waited.

Author: Post

Today had been designated for Takeshi to begin his sensory training. He himself would have rather learned on his own if he could, but it had been suggested and then even ordered that he would be taught by someone with similar techniques to his own. And so Takeshi found himself travelling towards a training grounds which had been designated to him via a letter from whom he supposed would be his mentor. The spot was not too hard to get to and when he arrived he saw no one else waiting for him. Either he was early, they were late, or they were hiding. He made himself comfortable by the stream while he waited.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Fri Sep 13, 2013 7:50 am

			Ryoga noticed the Jounin the moment he was within the 30 meter range of his technique. He proceeded to single him out, focusing specifically on him and him alone. He was high enough in a tree that he probably wouldn't see him immediately, if at all, but Ryoga's chiton sensing was pretty accurate, as he watched the man go and wait by the stream. Ryoga quickly leapt towards the stream, landing about 10 feet away from Takeshi. [color=#DC143C]"So, your the jounin that i've been instructed to teach Chiton Empathy to? I hope you have the ability to control it."[/color] There was a hint of displeasure in Ryoga's voice, but it wasn't directly aimed at Takeshi, more towards his superiors who felt that this man learning how to sense was important enough to make Ryoga practically give away his personal sensory capabilities. [color=#DC143C]"I'm Ryoga Kazuki. Is there anything that you need to do to prepare yourself, or can we just get started?"[/color]

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

Author: Post

Ryoga noticed the Jounin the moment he was within the 30 meter range of his technique. He proceeded to single him out, focusing specifically on him and him alone. He was high enough in a tree that he probably wouldn't see him immediately, if at all, but Ryoga's chiton sensing was pretty accurate, as he watched the man go and wait by the stream. Ryoga quickly leapt towards the stream, landing about 10 feet away from Takeshi. [color=#DC143C]"So, your the jounin that i've been instructed to teach Chiton Empathy to? I hope you have the ability to control it."[/color] There was a hint of displeasure in Ryoga's voice, but it wasn't directly aimed at Takeshi, more towards his superiors who felt that this man learning how to sense was important enough to make Ryoga practically give away his personal sensory capabilities. [color=#DC143C]"I'm Ryoga Kazuki. Is there anything that you need to do to prepare yourself, or can we just get started?"[/color]

			[color=#DC143C][b]"Honestly I'm not sure. I had been asking one of my usual teammates if he knew someone that could help teach me sensory techniques...next thing I know I've received orders to come here and learn them."[/b][/color] He paused for a moment. [color=#DC143C][b]"I've been told that sensory requires rather intense chakra control. I'll admit I'm not very good at it. So I suppose that's a start." [/b][/color]

He extended his hand. [color=#DC143C][b]"I can tell you're annoyed. I hope we can overcome that and work together some time. For now though, I have no idea what to do first."[/b][/color]

[color=#DC143C][b]"Honestly I'm not sure. I had been asking one of my usual teammates if he knew someone that could help teach me sensory techniques...next thing I know I've received orders to come here and learn them."[/b][/color] He paused for a moment. [color=#DC143C][b]"I've been told that sensory requires rather intense chakra control. I'll admit I'm not very good at it. So I suppose that's a start." [/b][/color]

He extended his hand. [color=#DC143C][b]"I can tell you're annoyed. I hope we can overcome that and work together some time. For now though, I have no idea what to do first."[/b][/color]

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Fri Sep 13, 2013 11:54 am

			Ryoga was surprised that there was a ninja in Kiri with humility. He crossed his arms and closed his eyes, taking on more of a teacher-like appearance for once. [color=#DC143C]"Your willing to admit that you aren't yet skilled enough to handle my techniques, that's good. Overestimating yourself is the easiest way to make you look like a fool. I'm willing to help you provided you listen to what I tell you."[/color]

Ryoga placed his hands together, and built up a large amount of chiton chakra within him. After a brief delay, The chakra pulsed out from his body, reaching through the air and across the ground, almost like a hound looking for prey. It eventually found it's way toward Takeshi, and if he had any knack for the affinity he would feel it pulse over him, before returning to Ryoga. [color=#DC143C]"I want you to practice building your Chiton chakra up and releasing it in a pulse first, then once you get the hang of it, we'll continue."[/color]

Jutsu usedShow Feel the Pulse

C-Ranked Ninjutsu

Prerequisite: Control 6

After doing the needed hand seals, the user channels their chakra into the surrounding area, travelling at a speed equal to the user's control, up to 30 yards away. This allows the user to sense nearby blood pulses. At this level, it doesn't allow for pinpoint movements, but it does allow for the user to sense direction and distance.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

Author: Post

Ryoga was surprised that there was a ninja in Kiri with humility. He crossed his arms and closed his eyes, taking on more of a teacher-like appearance for once. [color=#DC143C]"Your willing to admit that you aren't yet skilled enough to handle my techniques, that's good. Overestimating yourself is the easiest way to make you look like a fool. I'm willing to help you provided you listen to what I tell you."[/color]

Ryoga placed his hands together, and built up a large amount of chiton chakra within him. After a brief delay, The chakra pulsed out from his body, reaching through the air and across the ground, almost like a hound looking for prey. It eventually found it's way toward Takeshi, and if he had any knack for the affinity he would feel it pulse over him, before returning to Ryoga. [color=#DC143C]"I want you to practice building your Chiton chakra up and releasing it in a pulse first, then once you get the hang of it, we'll continue."[/color]

Jutsu usedShow Feel the Pulse

C-Ranked Ninjutsu

Prerequisite: Control 6

After doing the needed hand seals, the user channels their chakra into the surrounding area, travelling at a speed equal to the user's control, up to 30 yards away. This allows the user to sense nearby blood pulses. At this level, it doesn't allow for pinpoint movements, but it does allow for the user to sense direction and distance.

		[b]Posts:[/b] [url=./search.php?author_id=1658377&sr=posts]5833[/url]		[b]Joined:[/b] Wed Oct 05, 2011 6:00 pm

					[/url]
								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1658377]Octopus Garden[/url][/b] » Sun Sep 15, 2013 1:13 pm

			Takeshi could feel the pulse of chiton chakra as it touched his body. An odd sensation. After listening to Ryoga's instruction, Takeshi nodded in acknowledgement. Takeshi was not entirely sure how to begin. He knew only the very basics of chakra control and manipulation. He stood there in silence for a moment or so, thinking of what to do. Most of his techniques involved manipulating blood through chiton chakra, not sending raw chiton chakra through the air. Takeshi placed his hands in front of him, willing his chakra to gather there. A buildup of chiton chakra accumulated into a blob. Takeshi got too far ahead of himself and tried to fire it off immediately. It did anything but what it was supposed to. As it left his hands the chiton chakra completely lost its shape. The blob became gaseous and dissipated into the air. [color=#DC143C][b]"Too soon, I suppose."[/b][/color]

Placing his hands back in front of himself, Takeshi once more began to amass a buildup of chiton chakra. He more carefully shaped it this time, forming it into a more perfect sphere. A sphere was not a pulse though and so Takeshi knew he was not yet done. Concentrating even more, he asserted his will to form the chakra into the shape of a disc. A hole began to appear in the sphere as it spread outwards and became a ring. Takeshi pushed his chakra outwards in an attempt to send the ring of chiton into the near distance. It didn't get very far at all. In fact, it only got about two feet from his hands before it collapsed in on itself and dissipated like the previous attempt.

Takeshi was struggling. He was not sure what it was he was doing wrong. He thought back to just a few moments ago, when Ryoga had performed a demonstration for him. Ryoga's pulse was more solid, without the hole in the middle. That had to be it. Takeshi placed his hands in front of him and sent another surge of chiton chakra. This time he more easily shaped it into a sphere. Instead of turning it into a ring though, Takeshi attempted to turn it into a flat disc, mustering his might to keep the chakra in the correct shape. He did not relax his grip in the slightest as he eventually formed the chakra into the desired shape. He held it for a moment or so before sending it forwards from his body. It traveled a ways further than the previous attempts, but it too dissipated after going only roughly four yards.

He looked towards Ryoga. [color=#DC143C][b]"Any suggestions?"[/b][/color]

437 towards Control training.

Takeshi could feel the pulse of chiton chakra as it touched his body. An odd sensation. After listening to Ryoga's instruction, Takeshi nodded in acknowledgement. Takeshi was not entirely sure how to begin. He knew only the very basics of chakra control and manipulation. He stood there in silence for a moment or so, thinking of what to do. Most of his techniques involved manipulating blood through chiton chakra, not sending raw chiton chakra through the air. Takeshi placed his hands in front of him, willing his chakra to gather there. A buildup of chiton chakra accumulated into a blob. Takeshi got too far ahead of himself and tried to fire it off immediately. It did anything but what it was supposed to. As it left his hands the chiton chakra completely lost its shape. The blob became gaseous and dissipated into the air. [color=#DC143C][b]"Too soon, I suppose."[/b][/color]

A sphere was not a pulse though and so Takeshi knew he was not yet done. Concentrating even more, he asserted his will to form the chakra into the shape of a disc. It didn't get very far at all. In fact, it only got about two feet from his hands before it collapsed in on itself and dissipated like the previous attempt.

Takeshi was struggling. He was not sure what it was he was doing wrong. He thought back to just a few moments ago, when Ryoga had performed a demonstration for him. Ryoga's pulse was more solid, without the hole in the middle. That had to be it. Takeshi placed his hands in front of him and sent another surge of chiton chakra. 								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Sun Sep 15, 2013 4:24 pm

			Ryoga watched patiently as the jounin began trying to form a pulse of chiton chakra. He didn't expect him to succeed on the first few attempts as chiton was not usually utilized in this manner. As Takeshi formed the ball of chiton and released it in a pulse, albeit a weak one that barely went a few yards, he was honestly quite impressed. [color=#DC143C][i]"Maybe he has some potential."[/i][/color] Takeshi had finished his pulse, but Ryoga didn't think he was quite good enough yet, perhaps another exercise was in order. [color=#DC143C]"Alright, this is an exercise that I do whenever I try to make new sensing techniques. Take a good amount of blood, around a pint or so, and practice forming it into a perfect sphere. Once you get a grasp on maintaining that sphere, we can practice molding it into something to give you a feel for controlling the blood and sending it into the air. That's the basics of chiton empathy sensing."[/color] Ryoga wouldn't demonstrate this technique, as he didn't want to slice into himself just yet, plus it was easier for the Jounin to try it himself. He stood patiently waiting to see how well Takeshi maintained control of his chakra.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

Author: Post

Ryoga watched patiently as the jounin began trying to form a pulse of chiton chakra. He didn't expect him to succeed on the first few attempts as chiton was not usually utilized in this manner. As Takeshi formed the ball of chiton and released it in a pulse, albeit a weak one that barely went a few yards, he was honestly quite impressed. [color=#DC143C][i]"Maybe he has some potential."[/i][/color] Takeshi had finished his pulse, but Ryoga didn't think he was quite good enough yet, perhaps another exercise was in order. [color=#DC143C]"Alright, this is an exercise that I do whenever I try to make new sensing techniques. Take a good amount of blood, around a pint or so, and practice forming it into a perfect sphere. Once you get a grasp on maintaining that sphere, we can practice molding it into something to give you a feel for controlling the blood and sending it into the air. That's the basics of chiton empathy sensing."[/color] Ryoga wouldn't demonstrate this technique, as he didn't want to slice into himself just yet, plus it was easier for the Jounin to try it himself. He stood patiently waiting to see how well Takeshi maintained control of his chakra.

					[/url]
								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1658377]Octopus Garden[/url][/b] » Tue Sep 17, 2013 11:59 am

			Takeshi listened intently to Ryoga's instructions. He nodded in acknowledgement and took a few steps back. He began to remove his shirt, revealing his arrangement of crimson tattoos. He lazily tossed his shirt over to his right side, watching as it fell to the ground in a crumbled heap. Takeshi performed a set of hand seals and brough his right hand to the end of the tiger tattoo on his left hand. Almost instantaneously, a gallon of blood flew forth from the tattoo on Takeshi's arm. As the blood fell to the ground, the tattoo on his left arm turned from red to black. Takeshi noted to himself that it now only contained half the amount of blood it was capable of holding.

Sitting himself cross-legged in front of the small pool of blood, Takeshi inhaled deeply before letting it back out. He reached out with is right arm, his palm facing towards the blood before him. He closed his eyes and began to amass a bit of chiton chakra into his hand. It began to surge between his hand and the blood. The pool of blood began to rise up and float just off the ground. It was definitely more than a pint, he had accidentally moved the entire gallon. In a split moment of frustration over his own carelessness, Takeshi's grip on the pool weakened and the whole gallon dropped to the ground. He breathed in deeply again.

Exhale. Takeshi calmed his nerves after a few deep breathes, and tried again. This time he was exceptionally more careful about it. He sent the chiton chakra into a pint or so of the blood before him. It lifted up from the ground, and became level with his chest. Takeshi had trouble getting it into form into a sphere however, the blood instead forming into a glob with some lumpy protrusions. He concentrated even harder, willing his chakra to control and shape the blood floating before him. Slowly, it began to condense itself tighter together. It still was not exactly a sphere though. While he had succeeded in removing the lumps, he had failed to get the shape he needed. The blood before him had been shaped into a prolate spheroid. It was too tall and rather skinny.

He continued to attempt to shape the blood through the use of chiton chakra. He applied more chakra to blood, pushing the top and bottom of the shape in an attempt to make it more sphere-like. It worked, or so it did at first. The orb was a sphere for only a moment, before becoming squished. It had become an oblate spheroid. It was too wide and not tall enough. Inhaling deeply while maintaining the current shape, Takeshi took a moment to pause before exhaling. Now he let up on some of the chakra he used to push on the top and bottom of the spheroid, attempting to even it back out into the the desired shape he had seen only just a moment ago.

Success! For now, Takeshi had managed to manipulate and shape the pint of blood into a nearly flawless sphere. He was not having all that much trouble maintaining the shape itself afterwards, but rather had to keep it from falling to the ground. He pushed more chakra into the bottom of the sphere, raising it up to his eye level. While he did so, he pushed a relatively small amount of chakra onto the rest of the surface of the sphere, so as not to break the shape. As far as he could tell, he had made a bit of progress.

He looked towards Ryoga.

608 towards control

Varian:If you want to speed up the process you can just talk to one of the other staff members about it.

Most of them have been around longer than Director and can actually read.
[/quote]
[quote]
The Best Fucking Chuunin Exam Ever:[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=58&t=8339502]By Onu.[/url]
[/quote]

My CharactersShow
[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8347120]Jinrai, Akistar: Kumo Genin[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=83&t=8344466]Nakazawa, Shuichi: Iwa Genin[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=83&t=8340688]Yukari, Rei: Iwa Genin [/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8344249]Hotaka, Kirari: Kumo Genin [/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8175637]Ishiguro, Cros: Kumo Jounin[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=5965312]Hyuuga, Rei: Konoha Genin[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8344619]Hyuuga, Keriku: Konoha Jounin[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=6145595]Muramasa, Hisayo: Kiri Sp Jounin[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344160]Ikanbi, Liivuduntiz: Suna Jounin[/url]

						[url=#top]
				[/i]
				Top
			[/url]

------------------------------------------------------------
Author: Post

Takeshi listened intently to Ryoga's instructions. He nodded in acknowledgement and took a few steps back. He began to remove his shirt, revealing his arrangement of crimson tattoos. He lazily tossed his shirt over to his right side, watching as it fell to the ground in a crumbled heap. Takeshi performed a set of hand seals and brough his right hand to the end of the tiger tattoo on his left hand. Almost instantaneously, a gallon of blood flew forth from the tattoo on Takeshi's arm. As the blood fell to the ground, the tattoo on his left arm turned from red to black. Takeshi noted to himself that it now only contained half the amount of blood it was capable of holding.

Sitting himself cross-legged in front of the small pool of blood, Takeshi inhaled deeply before letting it back out. He reached out with is right arm, his palm facing towards the blood before him. He closed his eyes and began to amass a bit of chiton chakra into his hand. It began to surge between his hand and the blood. The pool of blood began to rise up and float just off the ground. It was definitely more than a pint, he had accidentally moved the entire gallon. In a split moment of frustration over his own carelessness, Takeshi's grip on the pool weakened and the whole gallon dropped to the ground. He breathed in deeply again.

Exhale. Takeshi calmed his nerves after a few deep breathes, and tried again. This time he was exceptionally more careful about it. He sent the chiton chakra into a pint or so of the blood before him. It lifted up from the ground, and became level with his chest. Takeshi had trouble getting it into form into a sphere however, the blood instead forming into a glob with some lumpy protrusions. He concentrated even harder, willing his chakra to control and shape the blood floating before him. Slowly, it began to condense itself tighter together. It still was not exactly a sphere though. While he had succeeded in removing the lumps, he had failed to get the shape he needed. The blood before him had been shaped into a prolate spheroid. It was too tall and rather skinny.

He continued to attempt to shape the blood through the use of chiton chakra. He applied more chakra to blood, pushing the top and bottom of the shape in an attempt to make it more sphere-like. It worked, or so it did at first. The orb was a sphere for only a moment, before becoming squished. It had become an oblate spheroid. It was too wide and not tall enough. Inhaling deeply while maintaining the current shape, Takeshi took a moment to pause before exhaling. Now he let up on some of the chakra he used to push on the top and bottom of the spheroid, attempting to even it back out into the the desired shape he had seen only just a moment ago.

Success! For now, Takeshi had managed to manipulate and shape the pint of blood into a nearly flawless sphere. He was not having all that much trouble maintaining the shape itself afterwards, but rather had to keep it from falling to the ground. He pushed more chakra into the bottom of the sphere, raising it up to his eye level. While he did so, he pushed a relatively small amount of chakra onto the rest of the surface of the sphere, so as not to break the shape. As far as he could tell, he had made a bit of progress.

He looked towards Ryoga.

608 towards control

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Tue Sep 17, 2013 3:11 pm

			Ryoga watched silently as Takeshi attempted to do the exercise he had told him about, though he was slightly caught off guard by his strange tattoo of blood. Taking it for a Fuuin tattoo, he thought nothing of it, and continued to watch him fail time and again at regulating his control over blood. It wasn't an easy exercise to perform, but Ryoga had never had an issue performing it, and expected better of this man if he was to take on his empathy style. [color=#DC143C]"You can do better than that, regulate your chakra, form the overall shape and go from there."[/color] Ryoga then saw that his student had gotten the hang of the exercise, as a perfectly shaped orb of blood now floated in front of his face, which was now staring at him as Takeshi awaited his next instruction.

[color=#DC143C]"Alright, alright, you did okay. You can drop that orb now Takeshi. Perhaps you aren't as weak willed as I initially thought. But this is still going to be difficult for you to perform, even with your newfound control. We'll start with the basic location jutsu, Feel the Pulse."[/color] Ryoga took a deep breath and began performing his hand seals, bringing forth a large amount of chiton chakra. Once more, Takeshi would watch as the pulse of Chiton left Ryoga's body and washed over him, feeling the blood pulse within his body before returning to Ryoga. [color=#DC143C]"I just utilized the chiton chakra within me to send out a wave of chakra, which begins searching for something with a pulse. Once that wave washed over you, I felt your pulse and knew generally where you were. This basic technique is effective up to 30 yards, but of course as you get better you can make better versions yourself. Now, do what I did, and send a wave of chiton towards me. Use it to feel my pulse."[/color] With Ryoga's long instruction now complete, he took a seat by a nearby tree to give Takeshi some peace and quiet, and watched as his student practiced searching for him.

Jutsu usedShow Feel the Pulse

C-Ranked Ninjutsu

Prerequisite: Control 6

After doing the needed hand seals, the user channels their chakra into the surrounding area, travelling at a speed equal to the user's control, up to 30 yards away. This allows the user to sense nearby blood pulses. At this level, it doesn't allow for pinpoint movements, but it does allow for the user to sense direction and distance.

			[i]
