			The new day's sun rose over the hazy clouds that sheltered the Village Hidden in the Mist. Today was to be the first time that Tadataka would training with a fellow Jounin. Considering he was the younger of the two; Tadataka was allowed to choose the spot where they were to meet--for they had never met before. Tadataka was the most recently promoted Jounin within the Village Hidden in the Mist, and as such, he was paired to train with a veteran Missing Ninja hunter in order to further along his skills. It was hoped; that he too would pass along a different perspective to the one known as Kazuki Ryoga.

Breakfast had come and passed by the time Tadataka had arrived at a swath of forest that he had determined would make a fine training ground. It had a stream running through the middle of a medium-sized clearing that was surrounded by a wall of trees. Tadataka figured that this area would give enough room for the two to practice--while at the same time not be too large that the space wouldn't be taken proper advantage of. For now, however, Tadataka would wait in the center of the clearing for his new training partner--left to imagine what might take place when they begun to show their abilities to learn.

						[/i]Post
					[/url]
								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Wed Sep 11, 2013 1:53 pm

			[color=#DC143C]"Ugh."[/color] Was the only thing Ryoga was able to force out of himself as he walked along the path to the training area picked out by this "Tadataka" person he was to meet today. It seemed any time Ryoga was given orders to meet someone new, it ended in disaster, as could be seen by his new "partner" Kirio. Yet again, Ryoga was given instructions by his superiors to meet with a specific jounin today. It didn't help that the Jounin in question had recently been promoted, causing Ryoga to already feel as though he were a bit beneath him.

As he trekked into the forest, following the paths deeper in, he began to hear a stream trickling by. No sooner had he took notice of this stream, the trees suddenly opened up into a clearing surrounded by a thick wall of trees. Ryoga quickly surveyed the area, taking note of the stream travelling through the middle of the clearing, and more importantly, who he assumed was the Jounin in question. As Ryoga approached the man, he took note of the wakizashi on his back, and the scars running up his right hand, taking him for a swordsman of sorts. When he was about 5 feet from the man, he would stop and introduce himself in about the only way he knew how. [color=#DC143C]"So, I assume it's you i'm supposed to be meeting today, Tadataka, is it? I'm Ryoga, I believe you already know, but I've been commanded to train with you, and I suppose assess your skills while also seeing what you could improve on. Is there anything you want to say before we get started? Anything in particular you want me to know?"[/color]

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

Author: Post

[color=#DC143C]"Ugh."[/color] Was the only thing Ryoga was able to force out of himself as he walked along the path to the training area picked out by this "Tadataka" person he was to meet today. It seemed any time Ryoga was given orders to meet someone new, it ended in disaster, as could be seen by his new "partner" Kirio. Yet again, Ryoga was given instructions by his superiors to meet with a specific jounin today. It didn't help that the Jounin in question had recently been promoted, causing Ryoga to already feel as though he were a bit beneath him.

As he trekked into the forest, following the paths deeper in, he began to hear a stream trickling by. No sooner had he took notice of this stream, the trees suddenly opened up into a clearing surrounded by a thick wall of trees. Ryoga quickly surveyed the area, taking note of the stream travelling through the middle of the clearing, and more importantly, who he assumed was the Jounin in question. As Ryoga approached the man, he took note of the wakizashi on his back, and the scars running up his right hand, taking him for a swordsman of sorts. When he was about 5 feet from the man, he would stop and introduce himself in about the only way he knew how. [color=#DC143C]"So, I assume it's you i'm supposed to be meeting today, Tadataka, is it? I'm Ryoga, I believe you already know, but I've been commanded to train with you, and I suppose assess your skills while also seeing what you could improve on. Is there anything you want to say before we get started? Anything in particular you want me to know?"[/color]

			"[b]I expected you to be... taller[/b]," Tadataka said as he began stretching his arms and legs--looking the man before him in the eye as he lowered himself to Ryoga's level. "[b]So, what shall we begin with? Taijutsu? Kenjutsu? Ninjutsu? Such a variety of options[/b]," He questioned as he rose back up to his full height. Tadataka was a good two inches taller than the older man that stood before him--not to mention he had about 50 pounds on him as well. Tadataka was more of a physical specimen than Ryoga, but it was obvious--with his advancement in years and experience--that Ryoga would be quicker and more likely to have better technique than Tadataka has. Perhaps he was poking the bear a little bit, but it seemed to Tadataka that perhaps the frank tone that he lended would be more to Ryoga's liking.

"[b]I expected you to be... taller[/b]," Tadataka said as he began stretching his arms and legs--looking the man before him in the eye as he lowered himself to Ryoga's level. "[b]So, what shall we begin with? Taijutsu? Kenjutsu? Ninjutsu? Such a variety of options[/b]," He questioned as he rose back up to his full height. Tadataka was a good two inches taller than the older man that stood before him--not to mention he had about 50 pounds on him as well. Tadataka was more of a physical specimen than Ryoga, but it was obvious--with his advancement in years and experience--that Ryoga would be quicker and more likely to have better technique than Tadataka has. Perhaps he was poking the bear a little bit, but it seemed to Tadataka that perhaps the frank tone that he lended would be more to Ryoga's liking.

			Heh. Ryoga liked the tone this man was taking with him, it almost reminded him of himself honestly. The man seemed a bit more brutish than him though, as he easily had more muscle than he did, and as Tadataka pointed out he had a few inches on him. [color=#DC143C]"A quick draw of my sword could fix that really easily. You look a bit better than I thought you would, i'll admit, but unless you can properly wield that sword, I've still got quite a bit on you. In any case, word's are cheap, how about we get started with some basic taijutsu. I have a few thing i've been meaning to catch up on."[/color]

As Ryoga said this, He placed his right hand on his sword, ready to block whatever slashes Tadataka would throw at him. [color=#DC143C]"Now, let me see that sword arm, give me something to block."[/color] Ryoga would be prepared at this point to react to whatever the man did next.

			[i]

The man seemed a bit more brutish than him though, as he easily had more muscle than he did, and as Tadataka pointed out he had a few inches on him. [color=#DC143C]"A quick draw of my sword could fix that really easily. In any case, word's are cheap, how about we get started with some basic taijutsu. I have a few thing i've been meaning to catch up on."[/color]

Author: 

[url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1900753][i][/url]
								[url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1900753]Philosophical Discord[/url]

		[b]Posts:[/b] [url=./search.php?author_id=1900753&sr=posts]430[/url]		[b]Joined:[/b] Wed Sep 04, 2013 6:00 pm

						[url=#p1609059][Social Training] Power is Everything[/url]

							[url=/forums/app.php/post/1609059/report]
								REPORT

							[url=./posting.php?mode=quote&f=58&p=1609059]

									[url=./viewtopic.php?p=1609059#p1609059]
						[/i]Post
					[/url]
								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1900753]Philosophical Discord[/url][/b] » Wed Sep 11, 2013 3:00 pm

			"[b]If you insist[/b]," Tadataka said as he reached to his back to grab the hilt of his Wakizashi and withdraw it from its sheathe. When it was fully drawn--as he brought it down in front of him--he spun it in the palm of his hand. Tadataka had good control of his weapon, but yet he did not have a style he could rely upon in an open confrontation. Perhaps Ryoga could show him a thing or two, but for now it was Tadataka's turn to show what he had--perhaps even gaining something for himself in the process. Maybe his gains would be a new taijutsu to add to his repertoire.

New JutsuShow[b]*Ambidexterity[/b]

D - Ranked Taijutsu

Requires: 5 Taijutsu

After extensive practice and training the character has gained equal strength and skill between their two hands. This allows them to perform any action with either hand at exactly the same skill level and strength.

He held his Wakizashi in front of himself in a one-handed grip before slowly moving his left hand to the grip as well. In that motion he brought his arms back to feign a stab at Ryoga, but instead he contorted his arms in a way to bring his blade across his body and then back down in an overhead slash at Ryoga from right to left (Ryoga's left to right). Usually he would wait for his opponent's reaction to his attack, but Ryoga had told him to give him something to block, and so he would. After the slash, Tadataka would release the hilt with his right hand, and in the continued motion he would sweep his left arm back enough to give enough space for Tadataka to reverse his hand (pointing the Wakizashi backwards) so that his palm would be facing the sky. With that motion completed, Tadataka would send a side slash from left to right (Ryoga's right to left) using his underdeveloped left hand.  After the second slash, following in the continued motion, Tadataka would then grab the hilt with his right hand--so now both hands were on the hilt--before pushing his body forwards in a lunging stab aimed at Ryoga's mid-section.

"[b]How's that[/b]," asked Tadataka in a strained tone. The blows that he had sent forth were not of the lightest variety, but he had a feeling that Ryoga would be unimpressed at his brute strength. It was a shame though, for Tadataka was also trying something new, for a first impression of skill it was likely that Ryoga would also be unimpressed with his technique--especially from the left-handed strike. Perhaps Tadataka would be able to improve on his off-hand to allow himself to be ambidextrous.

(407/400)

"[b]If you insist[/b]," Tadataka said as he reached to his back to grab the hilt of his Wakizashi and withdraw it from its sheathe. When it was fully drawn--as he brought it down in front of him--he spun it in the palm of his hand. Perhaps Ryoga could show him a thing or two, but for now it was Tadataka's turn to show what he had--perhaps even gaining something for himself in the process. Maybe his gains would be a new taijutsu to add to his repertoire.

D - Ranked Taijutsu

Requires: 5 Taijutsu

Author: 

[url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325][i][/url]
								[url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url]

		[b]Posts:[/b] [url=./search.php?author_id=1869325&sr=posts]7571[/url]		[b]Joined:[/b] Sat Apr 27, 2013 6:00 pm

											[b]Location:[/b] Moline, IL
												[b]Grading Tier:[/b] Seinen

				[b]Contact:[/b]

					[url=#]
						PM
					[/url]

																	[url=./ucp.php?i=pm&mode=compose&action=quotepost&p=1609082]
										Send private message
									[/url]

						[url=#p1609082][Social Training] Power is Everything[/url]

							[url=./posting.php?mode=edit&f=58&p=1609082]
								EDIT
							[/url]

							[url=/forums/app.php/post/1609082/report]
								REPORT
							[/url]

							[url=./posting.php?mode=quote&f=58&p=1609082]
								QUOTE
							[/url]

									[url=./viewtopic.php?p=1609082#p1609082]
						[/i]Post
					[/url]
								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Wed Sep 11, 2013 3:50 pm

			Ryoga tensed up as Tadataka drew his wakizashi from it's hilt. From the moment he touched his blade he could immediately tell he had no sense of technique, though at least he had decent control of his weapon as he watched him spin it in the palm of his hand. Ryoga on the other hand, Having trained in Iaido since he was young, was easily fast enough to deal with whatever the man threw at him. But Ryoga was trying to better utilize his weapon for defense, he had an issue with using the wrong areas to block with his weapon, which could potentially break it. His exercise today would be to block Tadataka's powerful strikes without breaking his sword.

Tadataka was surprisingly fast for such a brutish looking man, As it appeared he would attempt to stab him. Ryoga let the blade get as close as possible, then as he was about to draw his blade and block, he realized the feint as the man brought the blade around in a circle, to come at left side of Ryoga's head. He had just made it even easier to block, as with a flash Ryoga drew his sword with his right hand straight up and out of his sheath, sword tip down, and blocked the strike to his head with the side of his blade, trying not to damage the slicing edge of his signature weapon. No sooner had he drawn his sword, Tadataka released his weapon and grabbed it with his left hand, to circle around and catch his other side. Normally Ryoga would have resheathed, but instead he pulled his sword completely out of his sheath, across his body to his right side, and once more blocked the base of his katana against the edge of the jounin's wakizashi. Ryoga felt his blade vibrate a bit with that strike, but the blade did not crack thankfully.

Ryoga watched once more as Tadataka switched sword hands and attempted another stab at his mid section. Ryoga's blade was already out, he wouldn't let this one get nearly as close. As the blade came in, Ryoga switched his stance to a dagger facing grip, sword pointed downward, and swung his arm horizontally from right to left, effectively redirecting the attack to his left, away from him completely. As Tadataka asked him how he did, Ryoga inspected his blade for any damage, and was relieved to find that it was completely safe. [color=#DC143C]"Well, luckily my blade isn't damaged. It's obvious you have no training in an actual style, but you do have good weapon control, and for a moment i was worried my weapon wouldn't hold. With some work perhaps you could learn some Kenjutsu, perhaps i can teach you some basic Iaido, or you could go learn a style more based on strength from a dojo." [/color]

OOC: 475/400 for Below Jutsu
Jutsu learnedShow [b]*Skillful Wield[/b]

D-Ranked Taijutsu

Prerequisite: 3 wit

With a solid foundation of knowledge on their choice of weaponry, those with the Skillful Wield technique are able to utilize their weapon more fully. By knowing the weapon's weakest points, the user is able to avoid presenting these areas to damage during combat, thus making their weapon less likely to break by means of recklessness.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

						[url=#top]
				[/i]
				Top
			[/url]

------------------------------------------------------------
Author: Post

Ryoga tensed up as Tadataka drew his wakizashi from it's hilt. From the moment he touched his blade he could immediately tell he had no sense of technique, though at least he had decent control of his weapon as he watched him spin it in the palm of his hand. Ryoga on the other hand, Having trained in Iaido since he was young, was easily fast enough to deal with whatever the man threw at him. But Ryoga was trying to better utilize his weapon for defense, he had an issue with using the wrong areas to block with his weapon, which could potentially break it. His exercise today would be to block Tadataka's powerful strikes without breaking his sword.

Tadataka was surprisingly fast for such a brutish looking man, As it appeared he would attempt to stab him. Ryoga let the blade get as close as possible, then as he was about to draw his blade and block, he realized the feint as the man brought the blade around in a circle, to come at left side of Ryoga's head. He had just made it even easier to block, as with a flash Ryoga drew his sword with his right hand straight up and out of his sheath, sword tip down, and blocked the strike to his head with the side of his blade, trying not to damage the slicing edge of his signature weapon. No sooner had he drawn his sword, Tadataka released his weapon and grabbed it with his left hand, to circle around and catch his other side. Normally Ryoga would have resheathed, but instead he pulled his sword completely out of his sheath, across his body to his right side, and once more blocked the base of his katana against the edge of the jounin's wakizashi. Ryoga felt his blade vibrate a bit with that strike, but the blade did not crack thankfully.

Ryoga watched once more as Tadataka switched sword hands and attempted another stab at his mid section. Ryoga's blade was already out, he wouldn't let this one get nearly as close. As the blade came in, Ryoga switched his stance to a dagger facing grip, sword pointed downward, and swung his arm horizontally from right to left, effectively redirecting the attack to his left, away from him completely. As Tadataka asked him how he did, Ryoga inspected his blade for any damage, and was relieved to find that it was completely safe. [color=#DC143C]"Well, luckily my blade isn't damaged. It's obvious you have no training in an actual style, but you do have good weapon control, and for a moment i was worried my weapon wouldn't hold. With some work perhaps you could learn some Kenjutsu, perhaps i can teach you some basic Iaido, or you could go learn a style more based on strength from a dojo." [/color]

OOC: 475/400 for Below Jutsu
Jutsu learnedShow [b]*Skillful Wield[/b]

D-Ranked Taijutsu

Prerequisite: 3 wit

With a solid foundation of knowledge on their choice of weaponry, those with the Skillful Wield technique are able to utilize their weapon more fully. By knowing the weapon's weakest points, the user is able to avoid presenting these areas to damage during combat, thus making their weapon less likely to break by means of recklessness.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1900753]Philosophical Discord[/url][/b] » Wed Sep 11, 2013 4:14 pm

			"[b]Let's not get too far ahead of ourselves. Eventually a kenjutsu style may be useful, but for now my strengths lie in stealth and deception. Why not try your hand at attacking me,[/b]" Tadataka inquired as he sheathed his Wakizashi before forming a few hand signs that finished with a puff of smoke and a Shadow Clone appearing next to him. It was then when both Tadataka, and his clone, drew their Wakizashi and held them in one-handed grips in front of themselves. The Clone and Tadataka both stood in front of Ryoga  with enough space in between them to maneuver against Ryoga's would-be attacks.

"[b]It's only fair. By myself I am no match for your technique. With two of me I stand a far better chance of not getting killed in this training exercise[/b]," remarked Tadataka as he flashed a 'come on' motion with his free hand. Give and take would be what defined this training session. What would be next would be decided by the rate of improvement from both men.

Author: Post

"[b]Let's not get too far ahead of ourselves. Eventually a kenjutsu style may be useful, but for now my strengths lie in stealth and deception. Why not try your hand at attacking me,[/b]" Tadataka inquired as he sheathed his Wakizashi before forming a few hand signs that finished with a puff of smoke and a Shadow Clone appearing next to him. It was then when both Tadataka, and his clone, drew their Wakizashi and held them in one-handed grips in front of themselves. The Clone and Tadataka both stood in front of Ryoga  with enough space in between them to maneuver against Ryoga's would-be attacks.

"[b]It's only fair. By myself I am no match for your technique. With two of me I stand a far better chance of not getting killed in this training exercise[/b]," remarked Tadataka as he flashed a 'come on' motion with his free hand. Give and take would be what defined this training session. What would be next would be decided by the rate of improvement from both men.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Wed Sep 11, 2013 4:52 pm

			[color=#DC143C]"If you say so, I'm just saying you have potential, whether you realize it or not is your choice. In any case, Make one of your clones attack me, while the other defends itself. Then you do what you want."[/color] Ryoga needed to practice switching from offense to defense and back again now. Normally, this was one of the few things he wasn't incredibly fast at. Ryoga found it hard to change it up on the fly. However, he would have to get used to it eventually, and what better time than with 3 opponents to practice against? Ryoga would have fun fighting these clones, despite them being semi weak, at least it would feel like he could really slice something without holding back.

Ryoga approached the first clone, which began a barrage of attacks against Ryoga. Though the clone had a weapon just like Tadataka, they were much slower than him, and since Ryoga had no trouble reading his movements, the clones were child's play. As the clone swung at Ryoga, he quick drew his sword while parrying the blade away. He let the clone recover after a brief moment, then as the clone came at him again, in one swift motion he parried the blade upwards, past Ryoga's head, then doubled back around, amputating the clone at the knees as it vanished.

Next Ryoga went at the second clone, which was prepared to defend itself, holding the wakizashi in a reverse grip. Ryoga slid his sword back into his sheath, as this was the basic principle of Iaido style. As Ryoga approached the clone, in one swift draw maneuver, slashed at the clone's midsection. The clone had actually gotten lucky and managed to put his blade in the way just in time, but it was no issue, as Ryoga once again sheathed his sword with blinding speed. Deciding enough was enough, Ryoga decided to use one of his favorite techniques to finish this fight, the Iai Beheading Draw. In one lightning fast motion, Ryoga snapped the blade from its sheath in a vertical slash from groin to skull, then just as quickly resheathed it. The clone, having no real perception, didn't even see Ryoga draw his blade, as the slice made itself clear a moment later, and the clone poofed away. With that, Ryoga began to walk towards Tadataka, but released his hand from his sheath, as he was done practicing this transition for the time being. [color=#DC143C]"It's almost embarrassing to admit I had such an issue with a seamless transition, it's so basic. How about some ninjutsu next, got anything you need to work on?"[/color]

OOC: 438/400 words for below jutsu
Jutsu learnedShow [b]*Seamless Skill[/b]

D-Ranked Taijutsu

Prerequisite: 3 wit

A skill utilized by those on the path to mastery of their weapon, users of Seamless Skill are actively able to transition between offensive and defensive usage of the aforementioned weapon. By transitioning so seamlessly, the user is able to save a marginal amount of energy while attacking.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

Author: Post

[color=#DC143C]"If you say so, I'm just saying you have potential, whether you realize it or not is your choice. In any case, Make one of your clones attack me, while the other defends itself. Then you do what you want."[/color] Ryoga needed to practice switching from offense to defense and back again now. Normally, this was one of the few things he wasn't incredibly fast at. Ryoga found it hard to change it up on the fly. However, he would have to get used to it eventually, and what better time than with 3 opponents to practice against? Ryoga would have fun fighting these clones, despite them being semi weak, at least it would feel like he could really slice something without holding back.

Ryoga approached the first clone, which began a barrage of attacks against Ryoga. Though the clone had a weapon just like Tadataka, they were much slower than him, and since Ryoga had no trouble reading his movements, the clones were child's play. As the clone swung at Ryoga, he quick drew his sword while parrying the blade away. He let the clone recover after a brief moment, then as the clone came at him again, in one swift motion he parried the blade upwards, past Ryoga's head, then doubled back around, amputating the clone at the knees as it vanished.

Next Ryoga went at the second clone, which was prepared to defend itself, holding the wakizashi in a reverse grip. Ryoga slid his sword back into his sheath, as this was the basic principle of Iaido style. As Ryoga approached the clone, in one swift draw maneuver, slashed at the clone's midsection. The clone had actually gotten lucky and managed to put his blade in the way just in time, but it was no issue, as Ryoga once again sheathed his sword with blinding speed. Deciding enough was enough, Ryoga decided to use one of his favorite techniques to finish this fight, the Iai Beheading Draw. In one lightning fast motion, Ryoga snapped the blade from its sheath in a vertical slash from groin to skull, then just as quickly resheathed it. The clone, having no real perception, didn't even see Ryoga draw his blade, as the slice made itself clear a moment later, and the clone poofed away. With that, Ryoga began to walk towards Tadataka, but released his hand from his sheath, as he was done practicing this transition for the time being. [color=#DC143C]"It's almost embarrassing to admit I had such an issue with a seamless transition, it's so basic. How about some ninjutsu next, got anything you need to work on?"[/color]

OOC: 438/400 words for below jutsu
Jutsu learnedShow [b]*Seamless Skill[/b]

D-Ranked Taijutsu

Prerequisite: 3 wit

A skill utilized by those on the path to mastery of their weapon, users of Seamless Skill are actively able to transition between offensive and defensive usage of the aforementioned weapon. By transitioning so seamlessly, the user is able to save a marginal amount of energy while attacking.

								[url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1900753]Philosophical Discord[/url]

		[b]Posts:[/b] [url=./search.php?author_id=1900753&sr=posts]430[/url]		[b]Joined:[/b] Wed Sep 04, 2013 6:00 pm

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1900753]Philosophical Discord[/url][/b] » Wed Sep 11, 2013 7:27 pm

			"[b]Actually, I was thinking of working on my Fuuton and Suiton jutsu. They are my specialties so I think it would be good to improve upon my knowledge of them[/b]," Tadataka said as he sheathed his Wakizashi and began to make hand signs. By the time he was finished with the signs; six Shadow Clones appeared next to Tadataka. Since the Shadow Clones could use jutsu and their experience was shared with Tadataka when they were dispersed--they were perfect for learning new jutsu. The jutsu that Tadataka was trying to learn were very similar in nature. Both allowed the user to coat their Fuuton chakra on projectiles but the difference between them were their control abilities. The more basic of the two--Wind Screw--would be the first technique that the clones--as well as Tadataka himself--would practice.

Each Tadataka removed a kunai from their leg pouches, and each of them held it in their right hands as they concentrated on the object with their chakra. None of them seemed to be able to channel their chakra to it at first. The kunai seemed non-responsive to the wills of the Tadataka's. It was something that eluded Takataka himself--that even though it was such a low-rank jutsu it was still difficult to begin from scratch. Slowly, however, swirls of chakra began to form. At first they were only translucent shimmers that seemed to be trying to find their way to the object that they were centered upon. It was as if the object itself was repelling them. Then the pattern became tighter around the kunai. When the pattern began to tighten one, Tadataka dismissed two of the clones to gain their insights on the problem. It had seemed that he acted too soon. The ones that he had dismissed were the least farthest along in the process, but at least now he could put more chakra into the creation of this jutsu.

With only five Tadataka's left, the pattern began to shape in a spiral and it became more and more solid on the kunai that they all held. It was then that Tadataka dismissed two more clones. Their insight was actually useful and it allowed the rest to create more stable forms on their kunai. Lastly, they began to throw the projectiles. The remaining clones threw at each other--with the real Tadataka not throwing his kunai--and their all disappeared. They gave all of their experience to Tadataka. By the time all of this had come to pass, Tadataka was able to form his Fuuton chakra around the kunai and throw it at a tree twenty yards away. The kunai cut nicely into the tree before Tadataka recovered it--satisfied.

New JutsuShow[color=lightgreen]*Wind Element • Wind Screw[/color]

D-ranked Ninjutsu

After doing the needed hand seals, the user creates a small vortex of Fuuton chakra around a projectile in their hand. This creates a small drill bit which can be used to “drill” into whatever the object hits. It lasts for three posts or if the projectile is thrown, twenty yards from the user before dissipating. This doesn't make the projectile any faster, only increases its ability to cut.

(454/400)

"[b]Why don't you go next while I recover a little. Then you can help me out by playing a game of... tag[/b]," Tadataka said as he walked back to Ryoga after retrieving his kunai.

Author: Post

"[b]Actually, I was thinking of working on my Fuuton and Suiton jutsu. They are my specialties so I think it would be good to improve upon my knowledge of them[/b]," Tadataka said as he sheathed his Wakizashi and began to make hand signs. By the time he was finished with the signs; six Shadow Clones appeared next to Tadataka. Since the Shadow Clones could use jutsu and their experience was shared with Tadataka when they were dispersed--they were perfect for learning new jutsu. The jutsu that Tadataka was trying to learn were very similar in nature. Both allowed the user to coat their Fuuton chakra on projectiles but the difference between them were their control abilities. The more basic of the two--Wind Screw--would be the first technique that the clones--as well as Tadataka himself--would practice.

Each Tadataka removed a kunai from their leg pouches, and each of them held it in their right hands as they concentrated on the object with their chakra. None of them seemed to be able to channel their chakra to it at first. The kunai seemed non-responsive to the wills of the Tadataka's. It was something that eluded Takataka himself--that even though it was such a low-rank jutsu it was still difficult to begin from scratch. Slowly, however, swirls of chakra began to form. At first they were only translucent shimmers that seemed to be trying to find their way to the object that they were centered upon. It was as if the object itself was repelling them. Then the pattern became tighter around the kunai. When the pattern began to tighten one, Tadataka dismissed two of the clones to gain their insights on the problem. It had seemed that he acted too soon. The ones that he had dismissed were the least farthest along in the process, but at least now he could put more chakra into the creation of this jutsu.

With only five Tadataka's left, the pattern began to shape in a spiral and it became more and more solid on the kunai that they all held. It was then that Tadataka dismissed two more clones. Their insight was actually useful and it allowed the rest to create more stable forms on their kunai. Lastly, they began to throw the projectiles. The remaining clones threw at each other--with the real Tadataka not throwing his kunai--and their all disappeared. They gave all of their experience to Tadataka. By the time all of this had come to pass, Tadataka was able to form his Fuuton chakra around the kunai and throw it at a tree twenty yards away. The kunai cut nicely into the tree before Tadataka recovered it--satisfied.

New JutsuShow[color=lightgreen]*Wind Element • Wind Screw[/color]

D-ranked Ninjutsu

After doing the needed hand seals, the user creates a small vortex of Fuuton chakra around a projectile in their hand. This creates a small drill bit which can be used to “drill” into whatever the object hits. It lasts for three posts or if the projectile is thrown, twenty yards from the user before dissipating. This doesn't make the projectile any faster, only increases its ability to cut.

(454/400)

"[b]Why don't you go next while I recover a little. Then you can help me out by playing a game of... tag[/b]," Tadataka said as he walked back to Ryoga after retrieving his kunai.

------------------------------------------------------------

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Thu Sep 12, 2013 4:38 am

			[color=#DC143C]"Okay, i'll take this time to practice my sensing, I want to see if i can see your affinities."[/color] Ryoga was a skilled sensor, Pioneering his own method of sensing people's blood and pulse. He still had much to work on however, and a full list of Empathy techniques to create. He would start today with one that was simple in its application, but could prove useful in many different situations, as knowing an enemies affinities beforehand could prove to be a vital piece of information during a fight.

Ryoga put his hands together, building up Chiton chakra within his body to send out towards Tadataka and his clones. After he had a decent amount of chakra built up, Ryoga performed his hand seals as normal for his Feel the Pulse technique. Starting with tiger and ending with the ram seal. As he held this seal, his chakra flew from his body at an incredible speed, as Ryoga had great control over his chakra. It quickly passed over Tadataka and his clones, allowing Ryoga to easily tell which one was the real Tadataka, as only one of the bodies had a pulse. Next, Ryoga would perform a few additional seals, starting with the ram he left off on, and going through to the dragon seal. Once he finished these seals, Ryoga would focus in on the only pulse in the group of Tadatakas, using his Singled Out technique. This was usually more of a technique used to locate a target across great distance, but he needed to focus on tadataka in order to discern his affinities.

Finally Ryoga could try his new technique now. Ryoga would again begin to build up chakra inside his body. The technique in question was a D rank at best, and incredibly easy for someone like Ryoga to perform, it was all about being able to actually discern affinities for him. He suspected that due to his power over Suiton, that would be the only thing he was capable of seeing. However, as he saw Tadataka perform the Fuuton technique he desired, perhaps he would be able to see his fuuton affinity as well. Ryoga performed a few more hand seals, and after landing on the rat seal, Ryoga focused hard on Tadataka's body. As he felt the blood pulse within him, it became clear that Tadataka's affinities were indeed showing, as Ryoga could see a pale green aura as well as a blue aura similar to his own suiton affinity. As he released the jutsu, Ryoga relaxed a bit, then looked over at Tadataka. [color=#DC143C]"Good to know, I'd been meaning to develop my sensing abilities lately. Being able to see your affinities, or rather, my enemies affinities, will prove useful i'm sure. now, what's this tag your talking about?[/color]

OOC: 464/400 words for D rank Affinity sense technique

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

Author: Post

[color=#DC143C]"Okay, i'll take this time to practice my sensing, I want to see if i can see your affinities."[/color] Ryoga was a skilled sensor, Pioneering his own method of sensing people's blood and pulse. He still had much to work on however, and a full list of Empathy techniques to create. He would start today with one that was simple in its application, but could prove useful in many different situations, as knowing an enemies affinities beforehand could prove to be a vital piece of information during a fight.

Being able to see your affinities, or rather, my enemies affinities, will prove useful i'm sure. now, what's this tag your talking about?[/color]

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1900753]Philosophical Discord[/url][/b] » Thu Sep 12, 2013 12:45 pm

			"[b]It's simple[/b]," Tadataka said with a menacing smile on his face. Slowly, at first, Tadataka began to make a few hand signs. Then he formed them faster and faster until he felt they were sufficient for use in a fight. It was then that he reached for the kunai that he had put away after his last maneuver and held it in his right hand. He began to focus his Fuuton chakra back into the kunai akin to the Wind Screw jutsu. This time it was different, however, and Tadataka saw fit to show it before speaking again. "[b]It's more like dodgeball, really, or dodge-kunai. I'm going to work on controlling this projectile here using my Fuuton chakra and I need a target to follow. Are you up for it?"

[/b]New JutsuShow[color=lightgreen]*Wind Element • Guided Projectile[/color]

C-Ranked Ninjutsu

Performing the needed hand-seals, the user can cover an object within three meters that is roughly the same size as a shuriken or kunai with a thin Fuuton shell that allows them to guide the object’s path in flight. With the shell, the user can change the direction of the object three times while it is in the air. The technique lasts for three posts or until all turns are used; in both cases the shell dissipates from around the object. If the object still has the shell when it hits it mark, it will pierce more easily, due to the Fuuton surrounding it. If the user goes more than ten meters away from the object in question, they will lose the ability to guide it.

It should be simple; using the same methods of surrounding the projectile in Fuuton chakra, but at the same time the connection between Tadataka and his own chakra must last long enough to alter the movements of the projectile. It would be a tough predicament--to control something that was out of his hands in such a way with using only Fuuton chakra. There was only one way to get it right--practice. Practice is what makes everything perfect and Tadataka was determined to perfect everything he does.

It didn't take long for the Fuuton chakra bubble to form around the kunai. That had been the easy part considering the recent training with the Wind Screw jutsu. Next was the control; it was by far the more difficult part of the jutsu. This ability to control something in mid-flight would be very handy for change of direction attacks. It was this method that was the core of this game of dodge-kunai.

Tadataka gripped the kunai in his hand before throwing the Fuuton chakra coated kunai at Ryoga. It was obviously not meant to do him any harm, but as Tadataka had suggested, it was simply to tag him after making a few course corrections. The first kunai, however, would not be able to make a single course correction. The power was far too raw to be controlled with the ease that Tadataka had wanted. He would end his first attempt with a curse before retrieving the kunai and starting again. This time he would make a finer Fuuton chakra cocoon around the kunai before throwing it at Ryoga. Perhaps, if he were fast enough, Ryoga could use this opportunity to practice against a moving target as well.

This second attempt came from purse instinct as Tadataka was able to maneuver the course slightly. It was a victory--albeit a small one. It was then when it all came together with a combination of movements that allowed Tadataka to change the straight throw into a spinning kunai--which would easily be knocked to the ground by Ryoga if he deemed fit to stop it before it ran out of gas itself. Success was upon Tadataka yet again. So far this training session had been non-stop perfection for the two.

"[b]I think it's a draw[/b]," Tadataka said with a far less menacing smile. It was obvious that he now expected some sort of chastisement from Ryoga if he was unlucky enough to shock the older man, but in the end it would all be worth it to learn this new jutsu. Just to think what could be accomplished by moving a weapon so unsuspectingly when an opponent thinks they have evaded it. There was obvious sneak attack potential with this new jutsu. Just to think what would happen if the shell was still surrounding the projectile when it made contact--thrilling.

(609/600)

			NameVillageRankMissionsSocials[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5733243/1/][color=dodgerblue]Kashinado Tadataka[/color][/url][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5226160/1/]Kirigakure no Sato[/url]JouninS:0 A:0 B:0 C:0 D:0ThreadsShow[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5235939/2/#new]|A Drop in the Water|[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5737533/1/]|Blind-Sided|[/url]InactiveShowNameVillageRankMissionsSocials[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5243827/1/][color=red]Akamatsu Tai[/color] (Inactive)[/url]Iwagakure no SatoDS:0 A:0 B:0 C:0 D:00[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5281475/1/][color=green]Senju Akashi[/color] (Inactive)[/url]Konohagakure no SatoChuuninS:0 A:0 B:0 C:0 D:00

Author: Post

"[b]It's simple[/b]," Tadataka said with a menacing smile on his face. Slowly, at first, Tadataka began to make a few hand signs. 		[b]Posts:[/b] [url=./search.php?author_id=1869325&sr=posts]7571[/url]		[b]Joined:[/b] Sat Apr 27, 2013 6:00 pm

						[url=#p1609743][Social Training] Power is Everything[/url]

							[url=./posting.php?mode=edit&f=58&p=1609743]
								EDIT

							[url=/forums/app.php/post/1609743/report]
								REPORT

									[url=./viewtopic.php?p=1609743#p1609743]

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Thu Sep 12, 2013 4:16 pm

			[color=#DC143C]"Huh. I think I can manage that. Go ahead, try and hit me."[/color] There was a distinct challenging tone to Ryoga's voice, as he was almost completely sure that he could dodge whatever it was Tadataka planned to do. As he watched the Jounin coat his kunai with fuuton chakra, He was curious what exactly the man planned to do. He had planned to attempt to knock the weapon from the air, but with it being coated in chakra that might prove to be a problem. He wouldn't learn if he didn't try however, so Ryoga would at least attempt the clash draw technique.

Ryoga watched Tadataka very closely, waiting for Tadataka to throw the kunai. When he finally released it, Ryoga waited until it had gotten just within range of Ryoga. In an instant, Ryoga's sword was in the air, but he had missed the kunai somehow, as it went sailing over his head and impaled into the ground behind him. Ryoga was baffled that he had missed the kunai. Maybe he was too fast on the draw, or maybe he was too slow. He chuckled at the thought.

Tadataka walked over and picked back up his kunai to try again, then went once more to charge the weapon with chakra. Ryoga put his right hand once more on his katana, ready to counteract the kunai correctly this time. After a brief delay, once more Tadataka loosed the kunai towards Ryoga. Ryoga was fully prepared for this attack, ready to draw his blade and smack the kunai straight from the air. As it drew near, once again Ryoga slashed at the weapon, but again he missed the kunai. Though this time it wasn't because he missed, it was because the Kunai had changed direction. [color=#DC143C][i]"Heh, so this is what he meant by dodge the kunai, it changed direction. Guess that's what the Fuuton was for. No matter"[/i][/color]

The kunai continued changing direction in a sort of loop, circling around and again putting itself on a path to collide with Ryoga. This time he was sure he could swat it from the sky. As the kunai got within 10 feet of him, He gripped his sword tightly, and in one swift drawing motion, pulled his katana diagonally up, making contact with the kunai and flinging it into the air away from him. Ryoga was happy he finally managed to get that done, the fuuton had thrown him off slightly, but he was sure doing that to normal kunai would probably be easier. [color=#DC143C]"Not bad, i wasn't expecting it to change direction like that. Well, now what?"[/color]

OOC: 436/400 words for spoilered jutsu
Jutsu learnedShow *[color=#8B658B][b]Iaido • Clash Draw[/b][/color]

D-Rank Kenjutsu

Prerequisite: 4 Speed

In this technique, the user assumes a firm stance and then draws their weapon in an upward arc. This sort of draw makes it easy to bat away projectiles moving at a Speed and Strength equal to or lower than the user's Speed and Strength. This also enables the user to cut through advancing techniques or to clash with an opponent's weapon. This movement, however, may leave the user without the ability to sheath his weapon for some time, limiting the effectiveness of their techniques until they can.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

				Top

Author: Post

[color=#DC143C]"Huh. I think I can manage that. Go ahead, try and hit me."[/color] There was a distinct challenging tone to Ryoga's voice, as he was almost completely sure that he could dodge whatever it was Tadataka planned to do. As he watched the Jounin coat his kunai with fuuton chakra, He was curious what exactly the man planned to do. He had planned to attempt to knock the weapon from the air, but with it being coated in chakra that might prove to be a problem. He wouldn't learn if he didn't try however, so Ryoga would at least attempt the clash draw technique.

Ryoga watched Tadataka very closely, waiting for Tadataka to throw the kunai. When he finally released it, Ryoga waited until it had gotten just within range of Ryoga. In an instant, Ryoga's sword was in the air, but he had missed the kunai somehow, as it went sailing over his head and impaled into the ground behind him. Ryoga was baffled that he had missed the kunai. Maybe he was too fast on the draw, or maybe he was too slow. He chuckled at the thought.

Tadataka walked over and picked back up his kunai to try again, then went once more to charge the weapon with chakra. Ryoga put his right hand once more on his katana, ready to counteract the kunai correctly this time. After a brief delay, once more Tadataka loosed the kunai towards Ryoga. Ryoga was fully prepared for this attack, ready to draw his blade and smack the kunai straight from the air. As it drew near, once again Ryoga slashed at the weapon, but again he missed the kunai. Though this time it wasn't because he missed, it was because the Kunai had changed direction. [color=#DC143C][i]"Heh, so this is what he meant by dodge the kunai, it changed direction. Guess that's what the Fuuton was for. No matter"[/i][/color]

The kunai continued changing direction in a sort of loop, circling around and again putting itself on a path to collide with Ryoga. This time he was sure he could swat it from the sky. As the kunai got within 10 feet of him, He gripped his sword tightly, and in one swift drawing motion, pulled his katana diagonally up, making contact with the kunai and flinging it into the air away from him. Ryoga was happy he finally managed to get that done, the fuuton had thrown him off slightly, but he was sure doing that to normal kunai would probably be easier. [color=#DC143C]"Not bad, i wasn't expecting it to change direction like that. Well, now what?"[/color]

OOC: 436/400 words for spoilered jutsu
Jutsu learnedShow *[color=#8B658B][b]Iaido • Clash Draw[/b][/color]

D-Rank Kenjutsu

Prerequisite: 4 Speed

In this technique, the user assumes a firm stance and then draws their weapon in an upward arc. This sort of draw makes it easy to bat away projectiles moving at a Speed and Strength equal to or lower than the user's Speed and Strength. This also enables the user to cut through advancing techniques or to clash with an opponent's weapon. This movement, however, may leave the user without the ability to sheath his weapon for some time, limiting the effectiveness of their techniques until they can.

[url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1900753][i][/url]
								[url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1900753]Philosophical Discord[/url]

		[b]Posts:[/b] [url=./search.php?author_id=1900753&sr=posts]430[/url]		[b]Joined:[/b] Wed Sep 04, 2013 6:00 pm

						[url=#p1609767][Social Training] Power is Everything[/url]

						[/i]Post
					[/url]
								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1900753]Philosophical Discord[/url][/b] » Thu Sep 12, 2013 5:31 pm

			"[b]Next? How about some dummy training... only my clones are the dummies. Think you can kill them as fast as I can make them[/b]," Tadataka asked as he recovered the kunai from the last jutsu. That kunai was pretty durable, but now was its turn to rest while Tadataka did some training that didn't involve any weapons for a change. It was then, as he put the kunai away, that he turned to face Ryoga and settled into a comfortable stance. Quickly he moved his hands in familiar ways at a speed meant for combat. The signs formed one by one until a clone appeared before Ryoga. It was lifeless, but it was a start. The clone was made from nothing but chakra--a failure on Tadataka's part. He wouldn't show his disappointment, however, and would continue making signs as Ryoga would presumably deal with his failures.

In little time at all a second was formed, but its fate was the same as the last. A lifeless projection of chakra that only existed as a failure in the eyes of Tadataka. There was a sliver of hope, however, for when that clone was dealt with it released a slight gust of wind that showed Tadataka some promise through his eyes. He was getting closer and closer to his goal, and yet, there was something missing. Some key ingredient that made everything work. As to what that was? Tadataka would have to find the strength within himself to compose a mixture of his Fuuton chakra with his regular chakra in a perfect balance. The next clone that was created had a spark to him. He moved well enough with a slight spring in his step. It was as if he was gliding around on the grass as he attacked Ryoga.

"[b]It's gettin' there[/b]," Tadataka said after taking a breath of relief. A smile formed on Tadataka's lips. Perhaps he had fully realized his new jutsu so quickly that he would have time for another before lunch. What an enticing thought. However, as soon as the attack had begun, Tadataka realized that he was only half way there. The clone was more sluggish than he had imagined. Nor did it fight very well. The clone was obviously outmatched in every way, shape, and form. There was a glimmer of hope when it was struck down. That hope was a gust of wind with a strength of three within ten feet of the--now vanquished--clone. That was when the smile faded from his face. Instead that smile was replaced by a look of concentration as he took his stance, yet again, before speeding through a series of hand signals that concluded in the creation of a final clone.

"[b]Next up[/b]," stated Tadataka. He was seemingly rolling through the creation of the clones without a second though and now he had a feeling that he would be near completion of the jutsu that he longed to form before a perfectly unbalanced lunch of rice and ramen. Perfection, Tadataka was sure of it. He could feel the balance of chakra within this final clone. The Fuuton was just buzzing around inside of the regular chakra shell of this clone. The clone moved with enough speed for Tadataka to be satisfied. It flew towards Ryoga with that speed and attempted to attack him, but as Tadataka knew, without avail. There was no way that Ryoga would even let that clone touch him, but by now Tadataka was sure that Ryoga would realize what he was trying to do. More specifically, what jutsu he was trying to perfect. It wouldn't be long before that perfect clone met its end, but in doing so it would release a swirl of wind that would affect everything within 15 feet of the dying clone with a strength of six.

Although Tadataka had never used this jutsu fully before; it seemed to him that he knew what to expect when it reach its fruition. He was surprised, nor shocked, when it released the Fuuton chakra from within. It was like he knew what was going to happen before it did. Then again, it was he who created this clone, and he who had harnessed his chakra to accomplish what he had barely thought possible before. Now he had four different clone jutsu--besides the basic jutsu--that he could interchange to throw his enemies off of their game whenever he wished. They could think it would be one clone when it could suddenly explode with the force of the Wind Clone and suddenly the shock and awe would allow him to pounce upon them like a viper in the mist.

"[b]Perfect[/b]," Tadataka said as he took a confident stride towards Ryoga. There was an obvious tone of self pleasure within his single word statement. "[b]The Wind Clone jutsu. I do so enjoy my deceptions. Now I have another option to surprise my enemies with. What do you think[/b]," Tadataka inquired as he clapped his hands--applauding his own success. This was the first of the higher ranked jutsu that the pair had attempted to learn upon the day. It would be expected of Tadataka to take less time than his partner to learn these ninjutsu, but the opposite was true when it concerned taijutsu. Both of these men had their obvious strengths, but not-so-obvious weaknesses. That was what training was for; to eliminate your weaknesses, or at least learn to hide them better.

New JutsuShow[color=lightgreen][b]*Wind Element • Wind Clone Technique[/b][/color]

B-Ranked Ninjutsu

By performing some hand seals and concentrating both Fuuton and regular chakra, the user can create a clone. This clone looks identical to the user in every way, even possessing the same speed and strength. This clone can interact with the environment just like a kage bunshin, and it can go up to a mile away from the user. Once destroyed by any attack that would be lethal to a regular human, the clone bursts into a large gust of wind. This gust pushes back anything in a fifteen foot radius with 6 strength, while also causing minor cuts that would barely draw blood.
Taijutsu: 3
Speed: 5
Strength: 2
Stamina: 2
(913/900)

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5737533/1/]|Blind-Sided|[/url]InactiveShowNameVillageRankMissionsSocials[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5243827/1/][color=red]Akamatsu Tai[/color] (Inactive)[/url]Iwagakure no SatoDS:0 A:0 B:0 C:0 D:00[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5281475/1/][color=green]Senju Akashi[/color] (Inactive)[/url]Konohagakure no SatoChuuninS:0 A:0 B:0 C:0 D:00

"[b]Next? How about some dummy training... only my clones are the dummies. Think you can kill them as fast as I can make them[/b]," Tadataka asked as he recovered the kunai from the last jutsu. [url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325][i][/url]
								[url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url]

		[b]Posts:[/b] [url=./search.php?author_id=1869325&sr=posts]7571[/url]		[b]Joined:[/b] Sat Apr 27, 2013 6:00 pm

											[b]Location:[/b] Moline, IL

				[b]Contact:[/b]

					[url=#]

																	[url=./ucp.php?i=pm&mode=compose&action=quotepost&p=1610019]

						[url=#p1610019][Social Training] Power is Everything[/url]

							[url=./posting.php?mode=edit&f=58&p=1610019]
								EDIT
							[/url]

							[url=/forums/app.php/post/1610019/report]
								REPORT

							[url=./posting.php?mode=quote&f=58&p=1610019]

									[url=./viewtopic.php?p=1610019#p1610019]
						[/i]Post

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Fri Sep 13, 2013 7:15 am

			[color=#DC143C]"Easily. Clones have no substance, it will only take one shot."[/color] Ryoga loved to flaunt his style of swordplay, just the act of drawing his sword from it's sheath made him feel great. The sound it made as it was pulled out in a slashing maneuver was music to his ears. In order to make killing the clones a fair game though, he would have to try something he wasn't used to doing normally. He was capable of building torque within his arms, as was evident by him performing the Iai Beheading Draw, but this technique was slightly different in its application. It was essentially an incredibly fast Iaido strike, beyond the comprehension of most inexperienced shinobi.

Ryoga placed his hand on his sword, and practiced the motion a few times, a simple draw followed by a horizontal slice, leaving the blade out and exposed unlike most normal Iaido techniques, which follow with an immediate resheath. He quickly pulled the sword from its sheath, analyzing the speed at which he drew the blade, then resheathed to try again, wanting to get the feel just right. After he had practiced this about 3 or 4 more times, Ryoga attempted the actual technique, building the torque within his muscles to a peak. All at once, Ryoga unsheathed his sword in a strike so fast that the blade was almost nothing but a blur. It was fast, but not as fast as Ryoga would want. It was time he tried it on a real target.

Ryoga watch Tadataka make his first clone, which was a botched attempt at best, and the second one was no better, as Ryoga simple walked forward and sliced it in two, feeling the wind blow his hair slightly. [color=#DC143C]"Come on, give me something that can move."[/color] As soon as those words left his mouth, another wind clone sprang into existance and sped towards Ryoga in an attack. Ryoga reflexively dodged the first swing, the second however caught him in his leg, as he wasn't paying close attention. He quickly examined the wound, finding it to be a flesh wound at best. Ryoga scoffed, then went back into it with the clone. As the clone went in for another strike, Ryoga weaved to the left while simultaneously drawing his sword, and while the technique was fast enough and powerful enough to slash through the clone effortlessly, it didn't take on the blur effect that he wanted. Ryoga threw his sword back into it's sheath with a scowl, as the clone exploded into a burst of fuuton that blew him backwards a few feet and caused a few minor cuts.

[color=#DC143C]"Hmmm, that was disappointing. I can produce the torque required for my other techniques, but not this? Give me one more go, I think i've got this."[/color] Ryoga was a very skilled swordsman, something like this shouldn't be giving him nearly as much trouble as it was. Perhaps this technique was a bit different in it's application, or the draw was a different sort of maneuver than his other techniques. But he remembered being told that the snap draw was essentially a really fast normal strike, his father told him that long ago. Ryoga had no choice but to keep trying though, he wouldn't admit failure in front of anyone, especially not someone he just met.

Tadataka seemed to have perfected his wind clone technique finally, as a fully formed clone of fuuton chakra now stood before him. Tadataka gave the clone the okay, and it proceeded to rush towards Ryoga. The clone got within mere inches of Ryoga, this one seemed faster and more complete than the previous ones. However, he was still much faster than any clone, and jumped backwards out of the way of the clone's swipe. [color=#DC143C]"This one is much better Tadataka, i'm impressed."[/color] Ryoga was starting to think maybe this man was a bit more skilled than he let on, but for now it wasn't important. The clones speed was enough to be able to dodge should it see a normal strike coming, so the only way to really destroy it was to attack faster than it could see. Ryoga took his stance, Right hand on his blade, and waited for the clone to make another approach. After a few seconds, the clone was after him once more, coming within 10 feet of Ryoga. Ryoga built the torque within his muscles to their peak, and with one fell swoop, his blade was fully extended to the right. It had seemed that Ryoga went straight from a sheathed stance to a fully extended draw, but the movement was so fast the clone hadn't seen the slash. A moment later, the clone exploded with a great force of wind, blowing Ryoga back about 10 feet and causing some good sized gashes on his body. He was bleeding, but to a Chiton user it was nothing serious, as he performed a few hand seals and clotted his wounds so that they might heal. [color=#DC143C]"The draw was a bit different for that technique than my others, it threw me off at first. But that clone caused some good damage for a clone, those winds caused some nice slashes."[/color] Ryoga said as he showed the slashes on his arm and clothing.

896/750 words for C rank iaido tech
Jutsu learnedShow *[color=#8B658B][b]Iaido • Snap Draw[/b][/color]

C-Rank Kenjutsu

Prerequisite: 6 Taijutsu, 6 Speed

With a honed body capable of producing torque within the user's muscles, the user is capable of achieving a 'Blurred Sword' effect in an attack. The user draws their sword with such speed and power, the strike itself goes undetected by opponents lacking Taijutsu greater than a third of the user's Taijutsu stat. While essentially similar to the basic Iaido technique this one is literally beyond the normal capability of the user and as such, it can only be used a number of times per thread equal to the user's stamina and taijutsu divided by 2.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

						[url=#top]
				[/i]
				Top
			[/url]

------------------------------------------------------------
Author: Post

[color=#DC143C]"Easily. Clones have no substance, it will only take one shot."[/color] Ryoga loved to flaunt his style of swordplay, just the act of drawing his sword from it's sheath made him feel great. The sound it made as it was pulled out in a slashing maneuver was music to his ears. In order to make killing the clones a fair game though, he would have to try something he wasn't used to doing normally. He was capable of building torque within his arms, as was evident by him performing the Iai Beheading Draw, but this technique was slightly different in its application. It was essentially an incredibly fast Iaido strike, beyond the comprehension of most inexperienced shinobi.

Ryoga placed his hand on his sword, and practiced the motion a few times, a simple draw followed by a horizontal slice, leaving the blade out and exposed unlike most normal Iaido techniques, which follow with an immediate resheath. He quickly pulled the sword from its sheath, analyzing the speed at which he drew the blade, then resheathed to try again, wanting to get the feel just right. After he had practiced this about 3 or 4 more times, Ryoga attempted the actual technique, building the torque within his muscles to a peak. All at once, Ryoga unsheathed his sword in a strike so fast that the blade was almost nothing but a blur. It was fast, but not as fast as Ryoga would want. It was time he tried it on a real target.

Ryoga watch Tadataka make his first clone, which was a botched attempt at best, and the second one was no better, as Ryoga simple walked forward and sliced it in two, feeling the wind blow his hair slightly. [color=#DC143C]"Come on, give me something that can move."[/color] As soon as those words left his mouth, another wind clone sprang into existance and sped towards Ryoga in an attack. Ryoga reflexively dodged the first swing, the second however caught him in his leg, as he wasn't paying close attention. He quickly examined the wound, finding it to be a flesh wound at best. Ryoga scoffed, then went back into it with the clone. As the clone went in for another strike, Ryoga weaved to the left while simultaneously drawing his sword, and while the technique was fast enough and powerful enough to slash through the clone effortlessly, it didn't take on the blur effect that he wanted. Ryoga threw his sword back into it's sheath with a scowl, as the clone exploded into a burst of fuuton that blew him backwards a few feet and caused a few minor cuts.

[color=#DC143C]"Hmmm, that was disappointing. I can produce the torque required for my other techniques, but not this? Give me one more go, I think i've got this."[/color] Ryoga was a very skilled swordsman, something like this shouldn't be giving him nearly as much trouble as it was. Perhaps this technique was a bit different in it's application, or the draw was a different sort of maneuver than his other techniques. But he remembered being told that the snap draw was essentially a really fast normal strike, his father told him that long ago. Ryoga had no choice but to keep trying though, he wouldn't admit failure in front of anyone, especially not someone he just met.

Tadataka seemed to have perfected his wind clone technique finally, as a fully formed clone of fuuton chakra now stood before him. Tadataka gave the clone the okay, and it proceeded to rush towards Ryoga. The clone got within mere inches of Ryoga, this one seemed faster and more complete than the previous ones. However, he was still much faster than any clone, and jumped backwards out of the way of the clone's swipe. [color=#DC143C]"This one is much better Tadataka, i'm impressed."[/color] Ryoga was starting to think maybe this man was a bit more skilled than he let on, but for now it wasn't important. The clones speed was enough to be able to dodge should it see a normal strike coming, so the only way to really destroy it was to attack faster than it could see. Ryoga took his stance, Right hand on his blade, and waited for the clone to make another approach. After a few seconds, the clone was after him once more, coming within 10 feet of Ryoga. Ryoga built the torque within his muscles to their peak, and with one fell swoop, his blade was fully extended to the right. It had seemed that Ryoga went straight from a sheathed stance to a fully extended draw, but the movement was so fast the clone hadn't seen the slash. A moment later, the clone exploded with a great force of wind, blowing Ryoga back about 10 feet and causing some good sized gashes on his body. He was bleeding, but to a Chiton user it was nothing serious, as he performed a few hand seals and clotted his wounds so that they might heal. [color=#DC143C]"The draw was a bit different for that technique than my others, it threw me off at first. But that clone caused some good damage for a clone, those winds caused some nice slashes."[/color] Ryoga said as he showed the slashes on his arm and clothing.

896/750 words for C rank iaido tech
Jutsu learnedShow *[color=#8B658B][b]Iaido • Snap Draw[/b][/color]

C-Rank Kenjutsu

Prerequisite: 6 Taijutsu, 6 Speed

With a honed body capable of producing torque within the user's muscles, the user is capable of achieving a 'Blurred Sword' effect in an attack. The user draws their sword with such speed and power, the strike itself goes undetected by opponents lacking Taijutsu greater than a third of the user's Taijutsu stat. While essentially similar to the basic Iaido technique this one is literally beyond the normal capability of the user and as such, it can only be used a number of times per thread equal to the user's stamina and taijutsu divided by 2.

								[url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1900753]Philosophical Discord[/url]

		[b]Posts:[/b] [url=./search.php?author_id=1900753&sr=posts]430[/url]		[b]Joined:[/b] Wed Sep 04, 2013 6:00 pm

						[url=#p1610236][Social Training] Power is Everything[/url]

								REPORT

					[/url]
								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1900753]Philosophical Discord[/url][/b] » Fri Sep 13, 2013 2:58 pm

			"[b]Not bad, not bad at all. Well, I think it is time for lunch! I have some rice and ramen. I like to keep it simple--takeout is all I can do. I don't cook much... at all. Unless you count field rations. I hope you brought something for yourself. I'm starved[/b]," Tadataka raved as he sped to his lunch bag and began to eat with the hunger and fury of a traditional Japanese hero. It was time for him to replenish his chakra reserves and nothing helped with that like a good meal and a quick break. It would be a welcome respite before training more upper class jutsu. Next would have to be something... spectacular.

New JutsuShow[color=dodgerblue][b]*Water Dragon Projectile[/b][/color]

B-Rank Suiton Ninjutsu

Water Dragon Projectile is a technique that uses the rushing force of water to cause devastating damage. By performing the required seals, the user will utilize a preexisting body of water in front of them before molding it into the form of a dragon head. Once it has been created, the user can launch the two-meter wide projectile towards a target at a speed equal to the average of their ninjutsu and control, with a maximum of ten. Following the head is a long body and tail, stretching nearly ten meters. This technique is able to travel up to thirty meters and is able to be maneuvered to an extent by the user. Up to three times the user may alter the course of the dragon, allowing it to complete a U-turn per alteration.

After lunch had concluded, and both parties were ready and able to resume their training, Tadataka rose from his seat on the ground. Firstly, he began to stretch his body to limber up after a nice break. He didn't want to pull anything in training. That would not end well with the schedule that he kept. Changing from his hardcore training would be a big black mark on his personal record. Secondly, however, he took his standard ready position. His legs were balanced in firm positions--as if connected to the ground like a root--and his body was open the the stream in front of him. It was time that he upped his game and showed Ryoga what he could do with his Suiton chakra.

Slowly, at first, Tadataka began to formulate signs with his hands. Over and over he repeated until an idea dawned upon him on how to improve this process. As quickly as he could learn a jutsu--it was far easier to enlist some help from his Shadow Clones, but due to the rank of this jutsu he thought it would be prudent only to create one other clone. That clone maneuvered his way to the other side of the stream so he was now facing the real Tadataka.

"[b]You ready[/b]," Tadataka questioned his mirrored counterpart. "[b]On three[/b]," Tadataka stated before beginning his count down. "[b]One... Two... Three[/b]," he finally exclaimed after taking a deep breath between each number that he spoke. When it came to the number three the race was on between the dueling Tatadaka's in order to see who could complete the jutsu first and best.

Each Tadataka maneuvered their hands swiftly and nimbly to form the signs for the jutsu. They each infused Suiton chakra into the jutsu, but at first it was to no avail. They repeated each step over and over until there was finally some movement on the surface of the water. It seemed as if the clone was beating Tadataka at his own game, and Tadataka couldn't allow a copy of himself to beat the real thing. No matter how insignificant the competition was; Tadataka always had to push and strive to be the best. He would not let anyone or anything beat him or keep him down. Tadataka would beat his own clone; of this he was sure.

Slowly, water from each bank of the steam began to rise and form together. Each individual droplet of water became sewn together for not more than an instant before splashing harmlessly back to the steam below. It was not before Tadataka let fly a few curses that both he and his clone continued to create these seals at a frightening pace. With each of their repetitions their individual speeds increased the amount of tries they accumulated for this justu. It was not long, however, until both of the Tadataka's were able to create something from the water. A small dragon-like head had appeared from each of their water formations. They weren't the full power of the jutsu--this was a fact--instead they were a smaller practice size. It wasn't long before both of the Tadataka's had decided that a duel of the Suiton Dragons had to commence.

Each of the heads spun to face each other before flashing towards the other. Each corrected their course around and around until there was a tall spiral that shot into the air with the two heads holding the top of the formation. It wasn't long after, however, that the water dragons exploded above the two Tadataka's. They had succeed at learning the jutsu--at least. There was some sense of satisfaction, but there was no clear winner of this jutsu learning competition. What a pity. This competition had now come to an end as the clone went away in a poof of smoke and thus provided its experience to Tadataka proper. The dragons had been reduced to rain and that rain poured over Tadataka in his gleeful state of success. No matter how you looked at it--he was the winner. It was a battle between Tadataka and himself, after all.

"[b]Well, that was something. I wonder how big I could get it with a lake or something. That would be pretty cool. What do you think, Ryoga[/b]," Tadataka questioned as he lowered himself to a squat on the bank of the steam. He let the water wash over his hands as he stuck them in to cool them down from the friction of creating all of those seals at such a high speed. So far that was the only true spectacle of the jutsu that had been learned on this day. There was no doubt that it was just the beginning!

(909/900)

						[url=#p1610300][Social Training] Power is Everything[/url]

							[url=./posting.php?mode=edit&f=58&p=1610300]

							[url=/forums/app.php/post/1610300/report]
								REPORT
