								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Wed Sep 11, 2013 5:42 am

			Kiyori nodded, [color=slategray]"Yeah, your probably right, but I want to work on some more Taijutsu. I can handle it myself though, i'll just use a clone to practice."[/color] Kiyori wanted to learn some more of her Henrin Taijutsu, going back to the basics of her leg swapping technique. The beauty of the E ranked technique, Swap the film, was that it could be more than just a defensive swap of the leg. If one was skilled enough, it became a way to anticipate and react to attacks with one of their own. This was what Kiyori would be practicing with her clone, as she performed a few hand seals and brought another earth clone from the ground in front of her. The clone stood at attention, ready to begin throwing kicks and punches at her so that she might practice finding her opening.

Kiyori took the Tripod stance once more, lifting her leg and raising her arms into the air. Then, as the thought crossed her mind, her clone began throwing punch after kick in the same stance as Kiyori. Her doujutsu wasn't active, so she couldn't precisely recall every detail of the move in question, but it wouldn't matter too much, Kiyori's clone was so slow she easily had time to react, as she deflected some of the clones weaker punches with her hands and swapped her leg every time she saw a sweep coming. The clone was pretty easy to read, being as slow as it was, but that was the point, she needed to get used to doing this move regularly before she could get it in combat. As she saw another leg sweep coming, Kiyori saw her oppurtunity and, as she switched legs, she stomped her other foot down as hard as possible, attempting to break her clone at the knee. Her first attempt failed as she landed on the ground with a hard thud, and the clone took a readied position once more. Her timing was a bit off, but the actual maneuver was solid, she had a pretty good grasp on the technique itself.

She motioned the clone to continue it's assault, throwing more punches and kicks at the girl for her to dodge and deflect. As Kiyori began swapping her legs again, the clone threw yet another slow leg sweep out. This was her chance, as she stomped down on her clone's kneecap, almost breaking the knee in two, pinning it beneath her foot for a moment before she performed a quick backflip off of her now crippled clone, which then turned back to rocks and dirt. [color=slategray]"Okay, that was pretty easy, what do you have planned next Shigekuni?"[/color]

OOC: 446/400 words for Spoilered Henrin taijutsu
Jutsu LearnedShow ~Tripod - Swap Kick

D Rank Taijutsu

Prerequisite: Swap the Film

Using Swap the Film, the user will perform hop up to avoid the intended leg sweep. However instead of merely switching legs, the clan member will perform a downward kick at the offending leg in an attempt to hinder the opponent’s movement.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

Author: Post

Kiyori nodded, [color=slategray]"Yeah, your probably right, but I want to work on some more Taijutsu. I can handle it myself though, i'll just use a clone to practice."[/color] Kiyori wanted to learn some more of her Henrin Taijutsu, going back to the basics of her leg swapping technique. The beauty of the E ranked technique, Swap the film, was that it could be more than just a defensive swap of the leg. If one was skilled enough, it became a way to anticipate and react to attacks with one of their own. This was what Kiyori would be practicing with her clone, as she performed a few hand seals and brought another earth clone from the ground in front of her. The clone stood at attention, ready to begin throwing kicks and punches at her so that she might practice finding her opening.

Kiyori took the Tripod stance once more, lifting her leg and raising her arms into the air. Then, as the thought crossed her mind, her clone began throwing punch after kick in the same stance as Kiyori. Her doujutsu wasn't active, so she couldn't precisely recall every detail of the move in question, but it wouldn't matter too much, Kiyori's clone was so slow she easily had time to react, as she deflected some of the clones weaker punches with her hands and swapped her leg every time she saw a sweep coming. The clone was pretty easy to read, being as slow as it was, but that was the point, she needed to get used to doing this move regularly before she could get it in combat. As she saw another leg sweep coming, Kiyori saw her oppurtunity and, as she switched legs, she stomped her other foot down as hard as possible, attempting to break her clone at the knee. Her first attempt failed as she landed on the ground with a hard thud, and the clone took a readied position once more. Her timing was a bit off, but the actual maneuver was solid, she had a pretty good grasp on the technique itself.

She motioned the clone to continue it's assault, throwing more punches and kicks at the girl for her to dodge and deflect. As Kiyori began swapping her legs again, the clone threw yet another slow leg sweep out. This was her chance, as she stomped down on her clone's kneecap, almost breaking the knee in two, pinning it beneath her foot for a moment before she performed a quick backflip off of her now crippled clone, which then turned back to rocks and dirt. [color=slategray]"Okay, that was pretty easy, what do you have planned next Shigekuni?"[/color]

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=948882]Tsedas[/url][/b] » Wed Sep 11, 2013 1:17 pm

			As Kiyori went about practicing her own Taijutsu for a bit, Shigekuni was already returning himself to his jutsu training. Going over what he'd seen and done, he found a few things about that might come in hand not just for one technique, but all of his techniques. The last time he'd attempted to create the Raiton Arrow technique, he had swapped out a few hand seals and discovered that not only did the amount of chakra need tweaking, but the configuration of hand seals being altered helped produce a more viable explosion.

"[color=#95BD4F]So graduated techniques don't just use the same seals with a few extra tacked on the end, they can be altered to better improve the creation process and molding of chakra. Interesting, I wonder if this applies to all techniques that have stronger versions of themselves or did I somehow make some kind of breakthrough?[/color]" Shigekuni thought aloud as he he scratched his chin. He doubted he was pioneering some new method, after all chakra and Ninjutsu have been around for longer than the villages. Perhaps he was just stumbling upon it by accident, if anything he'd need to do research on the matter later to cement this theory properly.

Deciding to resume his refinement of his newest C Rank Raiton technique, the young Genin started slipping his fingers into the first seal. Using the last set of seals he'd done for his explosive Raiton, he went through the line up he'd used and on the last one, Shigekuni gripped at the air and sure enough a Raiton arrow burst into existence. Taking aim at the sky, he chucked the Ninjutsu technique into the air and watched it travel upward before it exploded with the strength of three tags like before.

Even with his alteration to the jutsu's seals and such, the range was still a solid 10 meters like he wanted. Now all he had to do was learn how to balance out the chakra usage so he wasn't wasting copious amounts every time he made one. As he stared up at the place the the explosion had once been, thoughts about how to modify and reconfigure his Ninjutsu skills went through his head.

Sure, Shigekuni had above average control to most of his fellow Genin but that didn't mean he was better at much else. He still had much to learn in terms of Ninjutsu and this was the place to start. He closed his eyes and went over everything he'd learned back in the academy about Ninjutsu, recalling the five basic affinities, shape manipulation, nature manipulation, the twelve basic hand seals, chakra molding exercises, application of Ninjutsu into Taijutsu. Opening his eyes slowly, he realized that this was most, if not all, basic knowledge.

"[color=#95BD4F]Base knowledge.... and here I thought I actually knew something for a change. This is all just the ground work, the advanced stuff must get learned at times like this. Alteration of hand seals into a new configuration series in order to properly create a stronger technique.[/color]" Shigekuni lowered his head and rubbed the bridge of his nose, not liking the idea that even after all the stuff he's learned and trained, it was all base knowledge for beginners. There was libraries more that he'd have to sift through it he truly wanted to comprehend Ninjutsu in depth.

As Kiyori asked what he intended to do next, the Genin shrugged. "[color=#95BD4F]I'm good to do more of about anything... You wouldn't happen to have a C rank Defense tech you would happen to need trainign with, would ya?[/color]" If anything, this would be his chance to test his hand seal configuration theory a bit more in depth.

OOC: 615/1000 words for Ninjutsu Training

As Kiyori went about practicing her own Taijutsu for a bit, Shigekuni was already returning himself to his jutsu training. 								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Thu Sep 12, 2013 8:06 am

			[color=slategray]"I don't think i'm quite skilled enough to do something of that power. I'll create a few more boulders for you to destroy, while i practice some more Tai with my clone."[/color] Kiyori quickly went through the seals of her Stone Shield jutsu, creating the same 3 boulders from before, then stepped away about 15 feet. Feeling safe at this distance, She proceeded to create yet another earth clone and begin practice on another Leg swapping Henrin technique

-----------------Training Start----------------------

Kiyori took the base Henrin stance once more, bringing her right leg up and her arms to a fighting position. She then commanded her clone to walk about 20 feet away, and prepare for a charge. Being used to already being in range for combat, Kiyori hadn't really experienced someone coming towards her in such a fashion, but she knew that there would be times when it happened. This technique was her answer for that kind of situation. essentially, Kiyori was to perform a leg swap when her clone came in to attack, bringing up her previously supporting leg in a kick against her enemy's skull before landing on her other leg. It was a simple maneuver to perform, but doing it in a combat situation may prove a bit more difficult.

As she readied herself, the clone began it's approach, moving about as fast as a clone made of heavy rocks could. The path of movement was easy to predict, as Kiyori waited for the clone to come close enough for her attack. As the clone got within about 5 feet, Kiyori lept into the air, and as she brought her left leg up to kick the clone in the head, her clone actually managed to duck the blow, delivering a punch square into her stomach, sending her back a few feet due to her being in the air.

Kiyori let out a quick gasp for breath, having the wind knocked out of you by yourself wasn't a fun experience. As she righted herself, however, she found that she was okay to continue, the damage was minimal at best. She has been caught off guard by the clone's movements, but she would get it right this time. The clone began putting distance between them once more, as Kiyori took her stance again. She watched the clone carefully this time, analyzing it's movements closely. As the clone began it's approach once more, Kiyori tensed her muscles in anticipation for the swap she would perform. She knew exactly what to do, it was all about reading the attack and anticipating where the enemies head would be as she switched legs. The clone once again got within 5 feet, and with a surgeon's precision, Kiyori lept above the leg kick the clone sent out, delivering a snap kick straight across the clone's shoulders, putting a large dent in the clone's skull before it fell to the ground and turned to dirt. [color=slategray]"Alright, thats taken care of now. How comes your technique Shigekuni?[/color]

OOC: 420/400 words for spoilered jutsu
Jutsu learnedShow ~Tripod - Snap Kick

D Rank Taijutsu

Prerequisite: Swap the Film

This attack is a simple in nature, while being approached by the opponent, the clan member will hop up. During the hop they will not only switch legs but bring up the one they were standing in on a snap kick aimed at the opponent's head.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

				Top

Author: Post

[color=slategray]"I don't think i'm quite skilled enough to do something of that power. I'll create a few more boulders for you to destroy, while i practice some more Tai with my clone."[/color] Kiyori quickly went through the seals of her Stone Shield jutsu, creating the same 3 boulders from before, then stepped away about 15 feet. Feeling safe at this distance, She proceeded to create yet another earth clone and begin practice on another Leg swapping Henrin technique

-----------------Training Start----------------------

Kiyori took the base Henrin stance once more, bringing her right leg up and her arms to a fighting position. She then commanded her clone to walk about 20 feet away, and prepare for a charge. Being used to already being in range for combat, Kiyori hadn't really experienced someone coming towards her in such a fashion, but she knew that there would be times when it happened. This technique was her answer for that kind of situation. essentially, Kiyori was to perform a leg swap when her clone came in to attack, bringing up her previously supporting leg in a kick against her enemy's skull before landing on her other leg. It was a simple maneuver to perform, but doing it in a combat situation may prove a bit more difficult.

As she readied herself, the clone began it's approach, moving about as fast as a clone made of heavy rocks could. The path of movement was easy to predict, as Kiyori waited for the clone to come close enough for her attack. As the clone got within about 5 feet, Kiyori lept into the air, and as she brought her left leg up to kick the clone in the head, her clone actually managed to duck the blow, delivering a punch square into her stomach, sending her back a few feet due to her being in the air.

Kiyori let out a quick gasp for breath, having the wind knocked out of you by yourself wasn't a fun experience. As she righted herself, however, she found that she was okay to continue, the damage was minimal at best. She has been caught off guard by the clone's movements, but she would get it right this time. The clone began putting distance between them once more, as Kiyori took her stance again. She watched the clone carefully this time, analyzing it's movements closely. As the clone began it's approach once more, Kiyori tensed her muscles in anticipation for the swap she would perform. She knew exactly what to do, it was all about reading the attack and anticipating where the enemies head would be as she switched legs. The clone once again got within 5 feet, and with a surgeon's precision, Kiyori lept above the leg kick the clone sent out, delivering a snap kick straight across the clone's shoulders, putting a large dent in the clone's skull before it fell to the ground and turned to dirt. [color=slategray]"Alright, thats taken care of now. How comes your technique Shigekuni?[/color]

OOC: 420/400 words for spoilered jutsu
Jutsu learnedShow ~Tripod - Snap Kick

D Rank Taijutsu

Prerequisite: Swap the Film

This attack is a simple in nature, while being approached by the opponent, the clan member will hop up. During the hop they will not only switch legs but bring up the one they were standing in on a snap kick aimed at the opponent's head.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=948882]Tsedas[/url][/b] » Fri Sep 13, 2013 9:30 pm

			As Shigekuni waited for Kiyori to create the boulders again so he would have new targets to aim at. As she worked on making them, the young male Genin felt a tinge in his arms as the numbing technique was beginning to wear off. Deciding to take care of it before his arms got too far out of control, Shigekuni started forming hand seals before touching one of his arms then doing it all over again, save for the fact that he touch his other arm on the second go. Feeling his arms go numb again, he was thankfully he'd decided to try and train that Raiton Iijutsu technique first before moving on to bigger things.

Turning his attention back to Kiyori he saw her working on some kind of Henrin Taijutsu while her boulders were standing at the ready for him to continue practicing the perfection of his Raiton Arrow technique. Shigekuni cracked his knuckles before he started getting back to work, forming the hand seal arrangement he'd been concluded was the best set of seals for the technique. As he went through them at his normal pace, his hands coming together in the Tiger Seal before gripping at the air.

Raiton burst into existence as it shot out from where he was gripping, in the end he was lifting his arm to bring the lightning projectile up level with his eye line. Twisting his upper body and bringing his shoulder back, he brought his free hand up and used it like he'd been taught when hurling something akin to the projectile he was currently holding. In one fluid motion, he twisted his body, loosing the projectile at just the right time in his swing to make it soar at the boulders.

The Ninjutsu technique soared through the air briefly before it embedded itself into the Doton technique of his Henrin partner. The Arrow exploded barely even a moment of time after it sank int the rock, exploding with the strength of three tags while launching rock shrapnel about the surrounding area. "[color=#95BD4F]I think I've done all I can for that my training with this technique, but I've certainly gotten some insight in Ninjutsu. Makes you wonder why they don't hold extended courses that would be optional for us all to take. One handed seals, reconfiguration and rearrangement, and so much more. I'll need to assess all my techniques more closely in the future, this kind of thing makes one ponder how complex the advanced techniques can get.[/color]"

--------Training Ends--------

Shigekuni let out a breath and shook his head as he still couldn't believe how much he still had to learn for Ninjutsu before he'd truly understand it like the more experienced shinobi in the village. "[color=#95BD4F]Right now, there is a handful of things I could train. A Shock Fist technique that I'm capable of performing, some Raiton techniques meant to enhance the body.... I have a few experimental techniques, but they're not even ready for practical testing since they're just ideas. Aside from some standard Ninpou, I'm not entirely certain what else I could try and learn right now.[/color]"

OOC: 1034/1000 words for Ninjutsu Training

As Shigekuni waited for Kiyori to create the boulders again so he would have new targets to aim at. As she worked on making them, the young male Genin felt a tinge in his arms as the numbing technique was beginning to wear off. Deciding to take care of it before his arms got too far out of control, Shigekuni started forming hand seals before touching one of his arms then doing it all over again, save for the fact that he touch his other arm on the second go. Feeling his arms go numb again, he was thankfully he'd decided to try and train that Raiton Iijutsu technique first before moving on to bigger things.

Turning his attention back to Kiyori he saw her working on some kind of Henrin Taijutsu while her boulders were standing at the ready for him to continue practicing the perfection of his Raiton Arrow technique. Shigekuni cracked his knuckles before he started getting back to work, forming the hand seal arrangement he'd been concluded was the best set of seals for the technique. As he went through them at his normal pace, his hands coming together in the Tiger Seal before gripping at the air.

Raiton burst into existence as it shot out from where he was gripping, in the end he was lifting his arm to bring the lightning projectile up level with his eye line. Twisting his upper body and bringing his shoulder back, he brought his free hand up and used it like he'd been taught when hurling something akin to the projectile he was currently holding. In one fluid motion, he twisted his body, loosing the projectile at just the right time in his swing to make it soar at the boulders.

The Ninjutsu technique soared through the air briefly before it embedded itself into the Doton technique of his Henrin partner. The Arrow exploded barely even a moment of time after it sank int the rock, exploding with the strength of three tags while launching rock shrapnel about the surrounding area. "[color=#95BD4F]I think I've done all I can for that my training with this technique, but I've certainly gotten some insight in Ninjutsu. Makes you wonder why they don't hold extended courses that would be optional for us all to take. One handed seals, reconfiguration and rearrangement, and so much more. I'll need to assess all my techniques more closely in the future, this kind of thing makes one ponder how complex the advanced techniques can get.[/color]"

--------Training Ends--------

Shigekuni let out a breath and shook his head as he still couldn't believe how much he still had to learn for Ninjutsu before he'd truly understand it like the more experienced shinobi in the village. "[color=#95BD4F]Right now, there is a handful of things I could train. A Shock Fist technique that I'm capable of performing, some Raiton techniques meant to enhance the body.... I have a few experimental techniques, but they're not even ready for practical testing since they're just ideas. Aside from some standard Ninpou, I'm not entirely certain what else I could try and learn right now.[/color]"

			[color=slategray]"Well, I have no problem calling it for today, we've learned a lot so far. On the other hand, I could always practice more with my Doujutsu."[/color] Kiyori was feeling tired, but she had the drive to continue going if Shigekuni did, there was always more ground to cover and never enough time it seemed. She still had Fuuin she wanted to learn, more Henrin taijutsu, more Doton, and of course her Doujutsu itself to work on. She would leave it to Shigekuni to decide, as she stood patiently awaiting his answer.

Author: Post

[color=slategray]"Well, I have no problem calling it for today, we've learned a lot so far. On the other hand, I could always practice more with my Doujutsu."[/color] Kiyori was feeling tired, but she had the drive to continue going if Shigekuni did, there was always more ground to cover and never enough time it seemed. She still had Fuuin she wanted to learn, more Henrin taijutsu, more Doton, and of course her Doujutsu itself to work on. She would leave it to Shigekuni to decide, as she stood patiently awaiting his answer.

			"[color=#95BD4F]In all honesty, I'm kind of tired. We've made some decent head way in getting ourselves a nice starting point in terms of training, we can pick this up again tomorrow or maybe even the day after.[/color]" Shigekuni remarked, not telling her that it would give him time to brainstorm more ideas for himself in terms of things to train. Snapping his fingers he pointed to the small piles of rubble that were her Doton techniques, "[color=#95BD4F]You should look into Doton stuff, maybe figure out how to form it better so we can practice that next time as well.[/color]"

Author: Post

"[color=#95BD4F]In all honesty, I'm kind of tired. We've made some decent head way in getting ourselves a nice starting point in terms of training, we can pick this up again tomorrow or maybe even the day after.[/color]" Shigekuni remarked, not telling her that it would give him time to brainstorm more ideas for himself in terms of things to train. Snapping his fingers he pointed to the small piles of rubble that were her Doton techniques, "[color=#95BD4F]You should look into Doton stuff, maybe figure out how to form it better so we can practice that next time as well.[/color]"

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Wed Sep 11, 2013 6:32 am

			Kiyori decided today that she would go to a different training ground than normal, usually sticking to the Henrin grounds whenever she decided to train. She wanted to get out of the norm for a little bit and practice in an area where anyone was allowed to train and practice their technique. It would also help her to experience some new terrain for a change, considering today she would be mainly focusing on her Taijutsu, involving some basics, some Henrin specific moves, and possible some custom ambush tactics. As she arrived at the training grounds in question, she took the time to note that there were some training dummies off to the side, as well as a bench to rest if need be. Clad in her Tan Mission outfit, mask and all, Kiyori walked over to the training dummy and began practicing some basic strikes to warm up before she would tackle the new stuff for today.

			[i]

Author: Post

Kiyori decided today that she would go to a different training ground than normal, usually sticking to the Henrin grounds whenever she decided to train. She wanted to get out of the norm for a little bit and practice in an area where anyone was allowed to train and practice their technique. It would also help her to experience some new terrain for a change, considering today she would be mainly focusing on her Taijutsu, involving some basics, some Henrin specific moves, and possible some custom ambush tactics. As she arrived at the training grounds in question, she took the time to note that there were some training dummies off to the side, as well as a bench to rest if need be. Clad in her Tan Mission outfit, mask and all, Kiyori walked over to the training dummy and began practicing some basic strikes to warm up before she would tackle the new stuff for today.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1020724]seiuchiblarg[/url][/b] » Wed Sep 11, 2013 7:04 am

			(Nefarious Training #3: Deftness. 150/1000)

Jiigo had been wandering. he'd failed his chuunin exam, to the surprise of just about everybody, and now was looking for a way to get stronger. His puppets had been outmatched, because Jiigo had been outmatched as a puppeteer, and also as an engineer. He needed to improve himself so that he could improve his puppets. he'd been looking over the fight again and again, trying to find a way he could have improved himself.

If nothing else, it had truly been a humbling experience for the genin. And now he was sitting alone in the training grounds, idly toying with Nefarious' armor, hoping to find something that would make the puppet better, that would make him stronger, hoping for some kind of new innovation. And there he sat, feeling rather glum and down on himself when a stranger approached. He doubted that he had gone unnoticed--she was here to train, and ninja aren't inattentive--but it seemed she was willing to let Jiigo keep to himself, if he wanted.

Jiigo watched her for a little bit, observing her warm-up. She was clearly very skilled with Taijutsu--enough to kick the crap out of Jiigo if she wanted. He actively winced at the thought. He knew he couldn't keep up with this girl. And somehow, that made him angry. Angry at himself, and angry at the stranger, and angry at Nefarious, and angry at himself again. He hadn't earned the prestige he'd gotten as a genin. He wasn't the strongest. He was just some mook who'd gotten lucky one too many times. And it was time people came to know it. Getting his ass kicked by a Taijutsu user seemed to be a good way to start.

And so Jiigo approached. [color=#cc8800]"Hey."[/color] Jiigo's voice sounded defeated already. [color=#cc8800]"I can help, if you felt like training on something that moved."[/color] Nefarious rose from his shoulder, hovering in front of the genin. [color=#cc8800]"Practicing some new moves? Maybe I can help you learn to hit true with them."[/color] From there, he let the girl decide.

Author: Post

(Nefarious Training #3: Deftness. 150/1000)

Jiigo had been wandering. he'd failed his chuunin exam, to the surprise of just about everybody, and now was looking for a way to get stronger. His puppets had been outmatched, because Jiigo had been outmatched as a puppeteer, and also as an engineer. He needed to improve himself so that he could improve his puppets. he'd been looking over the fight again and again, trying to find a way he could have improved himself.

If nothing else, it had truly been a humbling experience for the genin. And now he was sitting alone in the training grounds, idly toying with Nefarious' armor, hoping to find something that would make the puppet better, that would make him stronger, hoping for some kind of new innovation. And there he sat, feeling rather glum and down on himself when a stranger approached. He doubted that he had gone unnoticed--she was here to train, and ninja aren't inattentive--but it seemed she was willing to let Jiigo keep to himself, if he wanted.

Jiigo watched her for a little bit, observing her warm-up. She was clearly very skilled with Taijutsu--enough to kick the crap out of Jiigo if she wanted. He actively winced at the thought. He knew he couldn't keep up with this girl. And somehow, that made him angry. Angry at himself, and angry at the stranger, and angry at Nefarious, and angry at himself again. He hadn't earned the prestige he'd gotten as a genin. He wasn't the strongest. He was just some mook who'd gotten lucky one too many times. And it was time people came to know it. Getting his ass kicked by a Taijutsu user seemed to be a good way to start.

And so Jiigo approached. [color=#cc8800]"Hey."[/color] Jiigo's voice sounded defeated already. [color=#cc8800]"I can help, if you felt like training on something that moved."[/color] Nefarious rose from his shoulder, hovering in front of the genin. [color=#cc8800]"Practicing some new moves? Maybe I can help you learn to hit true with them."[/color] From there, he let the girl decide.

									[url=./viewtopic.php?p=1608816#p1608816]
						[/i]Post
					[/url]
								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Wed Sep 11, 2013 8:03 am

			As Kiyori was in the middle of her warm ups she noticed there was someone else at the training grounds. This wasn't something out of the ordinary of course, but she couldn't help but notice that he was working on what looked to be a puppet, some sort of sphere or something. It was the first time Kiyori had actually seen a puppeteer outside of the academy's basic puppets for demonstration to students. The boy working on the puppet, however, looked to be a bit down on his luck, as though something bad had happened to him. At first Kiyori thought to leave the boy alone so as to give him space, but after some working on his puppet, he got up and walked over to Kiyori, and in a low, almost depressing tone, offered to let her beat up on his puppet, or perhaps even him, in order to train on a moving target.

[color=slategray]"That's nice of you, but why would you want me to hurt you like that? I'm all for it, just as long as you know what taijutsu training entails."[/color] Kiyori's voice was as cold as ever, but showed a hint of sincere concern. Kiyori wanted him to be sure that he was okay with what was about to take place, as she didn't want to break the boy's puppet, or worse, him. [color=slategray]"I'll give you a moment to decide how you want to do this, considering you'll be the one on the defensive and I don't want to hurt you too bad."[/color]

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

						[url=#top]
				[/i]
				Top
			[/url]

------------------------------------------------------------
Author: Post

As Kiyori was in the middle of her warm ups she noticed there was someone else at the training grounds. This wasn't something out of the ordinary of course, but she couldn't help but notice that he was working on what looked to be a puppet, some sort of sphere or something. It was the first time Kiyori had actually seen a puppeteer outside of the academy's basic puppets for demonstration to students. The boy working on the puppet, however, looked to be a bit down on his luck, as though something bad had happened to him. At first Kiyori thought to leave the boy alone so as to give him space, but after some working on his puppet, he got up and walked over to Kiyori, and in a low, almost depressing tone, offered to let her beat up on his puppet, or perhaps even him, in order to train on a moving target.

[color=slategray]"That's nice of you, but why would you want me to hurt you like that? I'm all for it, just as long as you know what taijutsu training entails."[/color] Kiyori's voice was as cold as ever, but showed a hint of sincere concern. Kiyori wanted him to be sure that he was okay with what was about to take place, as she didn't want to break the boy's puppet, or worse, him. [color=slategray]"I'll give you a moment to decide how you want to do this, considering you'll be the one on the defensive and I don't want to hurt you too bad."[/color]

------------------------------------------------------------
Author:

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1020724]seiuchiblarg[/url][/b] » Thu Sep 12, 2013 10:02 am

			[color=#cc8800]"Nah, not me, just Nefarious here."[/color] He tried to smirk, but the arrogance didn't rise higher than his lips, never touched his eyes. [color=#cc8800]"These spikes of his have some nasty surprises, and if you're not deadly accurate with your taijutsu, he can punish you for it. This will be a good way to help you reign yourself in without holding back, right? I know I could use some extra practice anyway."[/color] Jiigo realized that with all the work he'd done with his puppets, he had been all about offense. He'd never really considered defending himself or his puppets. He'd always just arrogantly assumed the opponent wouldn't have a chance to get a hit off, and with the exception of Jiigo's newest puppet, whom the genin was not yet ready to use as anything more than a cape, he had no defensive ability whatsoever. How could he have been so stupid?

It didn't matter. He could work on it now. Maybe working against something actively attacking his puppets would give him some ideas about how to keep them safer from attacks like the ones they'd take. As of now, all of Nefarious' chains were coiled up inside of it. It was a mere ball of spikes. [color=#cc8800]"Name's Jiigo, by the way. Jiigo Samata."[/color]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5147033/1/]Sinister[/url][color=#cc8800][color=#cc8800][/color][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5074670/1/#new][color=#CD4F39]Aoichio, Sensuke[/color][/url]KumogakureChuunin-[color=#CD4F39][color=#CD4F39][/color][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=4138969/1/][color=#0080ab]Shirou, Author: Post

[color=#cc8800]"Nah, not me, just Nefarious here."[/color] He tried to smirk, but the arrogance didn't rise higher than his lips, never touched his eyes. [color=#cc8800]"These spikes of his have some nasty surprises, and if you're not deadly accurate with your taijutsu, he can punish you for it. This will be a good way to help you reign yourself in without holding back, right? I know I could use some extra practice anyway."[/color] Jiigo realized that with all the work he'd done with his puppets, he had been all about offense. He'd never really considered defending himself or his puppets. He'd always just arrogantly assumed the opponent wouldn't have a chance to get a hit off, and with the exception of Jiigo's newest puppet, whom the genin was not yet ready to use as anything more than a cape, he had no defensive ability whatsoever. How could he have been so stupid?

It didn't matter. He could work on it now. Maybe working against something actively attacking his puppets would give him some ideas about how to keep them safer from attacks like the ones they'd take. As of now, all of Nefarious' chains were coiled up inside of it. It was a mere ball of spikes. [color=#cc8800]"Name's Jiigo, by the way. Jiigo Samata."[/color]

		[b]Posts:[/b] [url=./search.php?author_id=1869325&sr=posts]7571[/url]		[b]Joined:[/b] Sat Apr 27, 2013 6:00 pm

					[url=#]
						PM
					[/url]

																	[url=./ucp.php?i=pm&mode=compose&action=quotepost&p=1609646]
										Send private message
									[/url]

						[url=#p1609646][Graded]A new experience[/url]

							[url=./posting.php?mode=edit&f=57&p=1609646]
								EDIT
							[/url]

							[url=/forums/app.php/post/1609646/report]
								REPORT
							[/url]

							[url=./posting.php?mode=quote&f=57&p=1609646]
								QUOTE
							[/url]

									[url=./viewtopic.php?p=1609646#p1609646]
						[/i]Post
					[/url]
								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Thu Sep 12, 2013 12:54 pm

			[color=slategray]"I see. Okay, this gives me a chance to practice my approach, as well as my accuracy. Also, I wasn't aware that people named their puppets, this little ball is named Nefarious? And it's weapons are spikes huh? Okay, I think i can deal with that. And nice to meet you, My name is Kiyori, Kiyori Henrin."[/color] Kiyori had a great interest in Puppetry and the like, but she didn't have anywhere near the kind of control needed to use a puppet. It would be something she had to work on, but for the time being she would continue to train her taijutsu.

----------Training start ---------------

Kiyori warned Jiigo before she started that the technique she would practice was for approaching purposes, unlike most of the Tripod style of moves. [color=slategray]"This technique is all about covering distance while taking my stance at the same time, so be prepared."[/color] With that, Kiyori began walking back a ways, putting about 20 yards of distance between her and Jiigo's puppet, Nefarious. She wasn't used to taking her stance in mid air, nor was she used to fighting outside of her stance, as Kiyori had been using the Henrin's signature fighting style since she was in the academy. But that was the point of this technique, the Tripod style's major weakness was being on one leg, which made approaching enemies difficult. This technique was meant to be used as a gap closer, as the user would run at an enemy, performing a straight kick into the opponents stomach, while maintaining balance by leaning their upper body back to counteract the forward momentum, then land on their supporting leg to assume the Tripod stance.

This was what Kiyori would now attempt, as she began running full speed towards Nefarious. The entire time she was running, she never once took her eyes off the puppet, watching for any sort of spike or chain or something to come at her. As she got within range of the puppet, she lept into the air in a straight kick with her right leg extended to hit the puppet. As she was about to make contact, Kiyori saw one of Nefarious's spikes jut out, and reactively dropped her kick and simply fell to the ground to avoid stabbing her foot. As she got up and dusted herself off, she wasted no time in putting more distance between them, going to the same starting position. [color=slategray]"you weren't kidding when you said i had to be deadly accurate. That was pretty close. I'll give it one more try."[/color] Kiyori prepared herself for the straight kick once more, getting ready to make her dash at Nefarious. She would have to take great care to not kick straight into a spike, but she guessed it would come with practice. As she began running at the puppet once more, Kiyori would try her best to not kick the same area as before, she really didn't want a foot full of spike. Once she was again within range, She jumped into the air and again performed a straight kick at Nefarious. She saw no spike this time, and the kick connected, but it was one of her weakest kicks ever as Nefarious didn't even budge. Kiyori landed on her left leg in a battle ready Tripod stance before returning to normal. [color=slategray]"I hope i didn't hurt your puppet, but thank you for helping me with this technique, it's much more fulfilling to train against a moving target that can fight back."[/color]

OOC: 479/900 words for spoilered Henrin technique
Jutsu to be learnedShow ~Tripod - Straight kick

C Rank Taijutsu

This technique is not performed on one leg like most, instead the clan member can use this while approaching their opponent. The kick is performed when the user gets within range, they will lean their upper body back to counter the act itself thus maintaining their balance. Once they've leaned back the user will bring one leg up and forcefully thrust the bottom of their foot forward into the stomach or lower back of their target.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

Author: Post

[color=slategray]"I see. Okay, this gives me a chance to practice my approach, as well as my accuracy. Also, I wasn't aware that people named their puppets, this little ball is named Nefarious? And it's weapons are spikes huh? Okay, I think i can deal with that. And nice to meet you, My name is Kiyori, Kiyori Henrin."[/color] Kiyori had a great interest in Puppetry and the like, but she didn't have anywhere near the kind of control needed to use a puppet. It would be something she had to work on, but for the time being she would continue to train her taijutsu.

----------Training start ---------------

Kiyori warned Jiigo before she started that the technique she would practice was for approaching purposes, unlike most of the Tripod style of moves. [color=slategray]"This technique is all about covering distance while taking my stance at the same time, so be prepared."[/color] With that, Kiyori began walking back a ways, putting about 20 yards of distance between her and Jiigo's puppet, Nefarious. She wasn't used to taking her stance in mid air, nor was she used to fighting outside of her stance, as Kiyori had been using the Henrin's signature fighting style since she was in the academy. But that was the point of this technique, the Tripod style's major weakness was being on one leg, which made approaching enemies difficult. This technique was meant to be used as a gap closer, as the user would run at an enemy, performing a straight kick into the opponents stomach, while maintaining balance by leaning their upper body back to counteract the forward momentum, then land on their supporting leg to assume the Tripod stance.

This was what Kiyori would now attempt, as she began running full speed towards Nefarious. The entire time she was running, she never once took her eyes off the puppet, watching for any sort of spike or chain or something to come at her. As she got within range of the puppet, she lept into the air in a straight kick with her right leg extended to hit the puppet. As she was about to make contact, Kiyori saw one of Nefarious's spikes jut out, and reactively dropped her kick and simply fell to the ground to avoid stabbing her foot. As she got up and dusted herself off, she wasted no time in putting more distance between them, going to the same starting position. [color=slategray]"you weren't kidding when you said i had to be deadly accurate. That was pretty close. I'll give it one more try."[/color] Kiyori prepared herself for the straight kick once more, getting ready to make her dash at Nefarious. She would have to take great care to not kick straight into a spike, but she guessed it would come with practice. As she began running at the puppet once more, Kiyori would try her best to not kick the same area as before, she really didn't want a foot full of spike. Once she was again within range, She jumped into the air and again performed a straight kick at Nefarious. She saw no spike this time, and the kick connected, but it was one of her weakest kicks ever as Nefarious didn't even budge. Kiyori landed on her left leg in a battle ready Tripod stance before returning to normal. [color=slategray]"I hope i didn't hurt your puppet, but thank you for helping me with this technique, it's much more fulfilling to train against a moving target that can fight back."[/color]

OOC: 479/900 words for spoilered Henrin technique
Jutsu to be learnedShow ~Tripod - Straight kick

C Rank Taijutsu

This technique is not performed on one leg like most, instead the clan member can use this while approaching their opponent. The kick is performed when the user gets within range, they will lean their upper body back to counter the act itself thus maintaining their balance. Once they've leaned back the user will bring one leg up and forcefully thrust the bottom of their foot forward into the stomach or lower back of their target.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=845229]Amy[/url][/b] » Mon Jul 15, 2013 2:18 pm

			The path that the previous had taken was one that was easy to follow, given the map that they had drawn for the Jounin.  They had done their best to mark the spots where they had had interactions with the ninja.  There was no guarantee where he would show up though and they had warned him over and over that he needed to be careful.  His attacks had been well planned and precise, aimed at terrifying them, but e was good enough to top his jutsu from really hurting them.  Someone with that much control was dangerous.

He would need to be on a sharp lookout for signs of the man that was haunting the woods.  Preparation before heading off into the woods would be wise.  There was no telling when danger might arise and without prep work, the fight might be over quicker than the ninja cared for it to be.

SpoilerShowBasically, talk about what you did before entering the woods, and then rp walking through, being wary, blah blah

The path that the previous had taken was one that was easy to follow, given the map that they had drawn for the Jounin.  They had done their best to mark the spots where they had had interactions with the ninja.  There was no guarantee where he would show up though and they had warned him over and over that he needed to be careful.  His attacks had been well planned and precise, aimed at terrifying them, but e was good enough to top his jutsu from really hurting them.  Someone with that much control was dangerous.

He would need to be on a sharp lookout for signs of the man that was haunting the woods.  Preparation before heading off into the woods would be wise.  There was no telling when danger might arise and without prep work, the fight might be over quicker than the ninja cared for it to be.

						[url=#p1569893][Mission] No Parking on the Dance Floor[/url]

							[url=./posting.php?mode=edit&f=54&p=1569893]
								EDIT
							[/url]

							[url=/forums/app.php/post/1569893/report]
								REPORT

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Mon Jul 15, 2013 9:34 pm

			Ha. Ryoga gave little thought to his employers warnings. The fact that these ninja had strength in numbers and still lost was a sign of their weakness. Ryoga was amply prepared for any encounter he may face along the way, his sword at his side the only equipment he ever needed. Without a shred of fear, he would enter the forest a little before noon to begin the hunt.

As he traveled throughout the forest, he would carefully scan every tree top and any possible hiding places he may have noticed, such as tall grass or perhaps a body of water, attempting to leave absolutely no stone unturned. He also kept a close eye on his backside, not wanting to be ambushed from behind by his prey. Ryoga loved being in these situations, it was one of the few things that brought him happiness. His only complaint about his mission was it was to be a non lethal takedown. The thought brought him to a sigh, why not just kill the bastard and end the problem permanently? However, Kirigakure specifically said not to kill, and he would obey his orders as always. He would pause to take a break by a small river, but not before sensing the immediate area for any signs of a pulse. If nothing was felt, he would rest by the river for a few minutes, then continue on.

Jutsu usedShow Feel the Pulse

C-Ranked Ninjutsu

Prerequisite: Control 6

After doing the needed hand seals, the user channels their chakra into the surrounding area, travelling at a speed equal to the user's control, up to 30 yards away. This allows the user to sense nearby blood pulses. At this level, it doesn't allow for pinpoint movements, but it does allow for the user to sense direction and distance.

			[i]

Ha. Ryoga gave little thought to his employers warnings. The fact that these ninja had strength in numbers and still lost was a sign of their weakness. Ryoga was amply prepared for any encounter he may face along the way, his sword at his side the only equipment he ever needed. Without a shred of fear, he would enter the forest a little before noon to begin the hunt.

As he traveled throughout the forest, he would carefully scan every tree top and any possible hiding places he may have noticed, such as tall grass or perhaps a body of water, attempting to leave absolutely no stone unturned. He also kept a close eye on his backside, not wanting to be ambushed from behind by his prey. Ryoga loved being in these situations, it was one of the few things that brought him happiness. His only complaint about his mission was it was to be a non lethal takedown. The thought brought him to a sigh, why not just kill the bastard and end the problem permanently? However, Kirigakure specifically said not to kill, and he would obey his orders as always. He would pause to take a break by a small river, but not before sensing the immediate area for any signs of a pulse. If nothing was felt, he would rest by the river for a few minutes, then continue on.

Jutsu usedShow Feel the Pulse

C-Ranked Ninjutsu

Prerequisite: Control 6

After doing the needed hand seals, the user channels their chakra into the surrounding area, travelling at a speed equal to the user's control, up to 30 yards away. This allows the user to sense nearby blood pulses. At this level, it doesn't allow for pinpoint movements, but it does allow for the user to sense direction and distance.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=845229]Amy[/url][/b] » Fri Jul 19, 2013 1:13 pm

			The immediate would hold no sign of life, aside from the Shinobi.  Due to the nature of the woods, there would be no way to track a random set of footprints and have any luck at all with it.  The chances of following the trail of the hiding ninja was as likely as following the trail of a bear.  He was doing well though and he was heading in the right direction, gaining ground, and getting close to the area that the man had attacked the young ninjas.  At the river, he would be about sixty yards from the location of the attacker.  The man was not a patient one and it would be wise for the Shinobi to be prepared.  The man sat high in a tree, waiting for someone to get close enough to play with.  A very strong, very agile, bored individual was never a safe thing.

			My CharactersShow
[b]B-Rank MN[/b] • [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=8278570/1/?x=15]Katō, Tsubaki[/url] [color=#A32638]#A32638[/color]

Author: Post

The immediate would hold no sign of life, aside from the Shinobi.  Due to the nature of the woods, there would be no way to track a random set of footprints and have any luck at all with it.  The chances of following the trail of the hiding ninja was as likely as following the trail of a bear.  He was doing well though and he was heading in the right direction, gaining ground, and getting close to the area that the man had attacked the young ninjas.  At the river, he would be about sixty yards from the location of the attacker.  The man was not a patient one and it would be wise for the Shinobi to be prepared.  The man sat high in a tree, waiting for someone to get close enough to play with.  A very strong, very agile, bored individual was never a safe thing.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Tue Jul 23, 2013 11:55 pm

			Ryoga was clearly enjoying this hunt as a smile crossed the mans face for a moment. After pausing for a brief moment by the river, he would proceed to check a bigger area with his stronger tracking abilities. If there were still no signs of life, he would proceed deeper into the forest, checking every so often for life in the area with his lower jutsu, so as to not waste chakra before the fight.

Jutsu usedShow Hemopulse

B-Ranked Ninjutsu

Prerequisite: Feel the Pulse, Control 8

After doing the needed hand seals, the user channels their chakra into the surrounding area, travelling at a speed equal to the user's control, up to 60 yards away. This allows the user to sense nearby blood pulses. At this level, it doesn't allow for pinpoint movements, but it does allow for the user to sense direction and distance.

Feel the Pulse

C-Ranked Ninjutsu

Prerequisite: Control 6

After doing the needed hand seals, the user channels their chakra into the surrounding area, travelling at a speed equal to the user's control, up to 30 yards away. This allows the user to sense nearby blood pulses. At this level, it doesn't allow for pinpoint movements, but it does allow for the user to sense direction and distance.

Ryoga was clearly enjoying this hunt as a smile crossed the mans face for a moment. After pausing for a brief moment by the river, he would proceed to check a bigger area with his stronger tracking abilities. If there were still no signs of life, he would proceed deeper into the forest, checking every so often for life in the area with his lower jutsu, so as to not waste chakra before the fight.

Jutsu usedShow Hemopulse

B-Ranked Ninjutsu

Prerequisite: Feel the Pulse, Control 8

After doing the needed hand seals, the user channels their chakra into the surrounding area, travelling at a speed equal to the user's control, up to 60 yards away. This allows the user to sense nearby blood pulses. At this level, it doesn't allow for pinpoint movements, but it does allow for the user to sense direction and distance.

Feel the Pulse

C-Ranked Ninjutsu

Prerequisite: Control 6

After doing the needed hand seals, the user channels their chakra into the surrounding area, travelling at a speed equal to the user's control, up to 30 yards away. This allows the user to sense nearby blood pulses. At this level, it doesn't allow for pinpoint movements, but it does allow for the user to sense direction and distance.
OOC; sorry about being almost late and posting a short post, ive had alot to do for my sick aunt, and we replaced a sewer line, but hopefully it wont prevent me from finishing this. again, sorry XD

			((I'm confused as to why you are using one of your blood techs when you don't have any of his blood?  I do believe that is how that jutsu works.))

The man high in the tree decided that waiting for the ninja to reach him was much too boring.  He slipped out of his tree, his feet making a solid thud on the ground beneath him.  His neck cracking, he stood quietly, knowing that the ninja would be along shortly.  He had several knives visible along his belt and he took two out, tossing them in the air, almost juggling them. He would be quite the sight to come in on, and maybe that was the point.

((I'm confused as to why you are using one of your blood techs when you don't have any of his blood?  I do believe that is how that jutsu works.))

The man high in the tree decided that waiting for the ninja to reach him was much too boring.  He slipped out of his tree, his feet making a solid thud on the ground beneath him.  His neck cracking, he stood quietly, knowing that the ninja would be along shortly.  He had several knives visible along his belt and he took two out, tossing them in the air, almost juggling them. He would be quite the sight to come in on, and maybe that was the point.

			As the man lept from the tree, Ryoga quickly took notice of him, and everything about him. He heard his feet thud against the ground, saw him crack his neck, and witnessed him juggle a few knives as he stood in wait it seemed. Ryoga approached the man, standing about 30 feet in front of him, close enough to close the distance but far enough to dodge throwing weapons, which it appeared the man specialized in. [color=#DC143C]"So you're the one causing trouble in the forest i assume? Is attacking lesser ranked ninja your idea of fun, or are you just too weak to fight someone that matters?"[/color] Ryoga stood, hand on his hilt, ready for it to turn deadly at a moment's notice, but he wouldn't make a move just yet.

As the man lept from the tree, Ryoga quickly took notice of him, and everything about him. He heard his feet thud against the ground, saw him crack his neck, and witnessed him juggle a few knives as he stood in wait it seemed. Ryoga approached the man, standing about 30 feet in front of him, close enough to close the distance but far enough to dodge throwing weapons, which it appeared the man specialized in. [color=#DC143C]"So you're the one causing trouble in the forest i assume? Is attacking lesser ranked ninja your idea of fun, or are you just too weak to fight someone that matters?"[/color] Ryoga stood, hand on his hilt, ready for it to turn deadly at a moment's notice, but he wouldn't make a move just yet.

			The man grinned at his words.  He loved it when they tried to act smart and tough.  His knives stopped and were soon sheathed again, his hands empty.  "[color=peru]You gotta poke the baby bear before the mama bear comes running kid.  You're all they sent though?  I doubt you'll be any more trouble than the team of Genin that were out here.  And they were just pathetic.[/color]"  He turned his head to the side, spitting into the dirt, complete disrespect oozing from him.  He clearly thought nothing of the kid standing in front of him and that became even more clear when he covered his eyes with his hands and stepped his feet wide apart, and grinned again.  "[color=peru]Look, I'll even give you a free hit.  What you got?[/color]"

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Sat Aug 03, 2013 9:36 am

			Ryoga scoffed at the man's disgraceful gestures towards him. As if he cared who he was or what he thought. He was a target in his mission, nothing more. As such, he had nothing more to say to the man. As the man presented himself for a free shot, Ryoga would gladly take that opportunity. His mission stated that he couldn't kill his target, but that wouldn't stop him from crippling him how he saw fit. He quickly dashed towards his target, covering the distance between them in a matter of seconds, but keeping an eye out for a trap of some sort, as he could be luring him into something. if he managed to get to him, he would draw his blade and aim to break the man's kneecap with the side of his blade, placing his palm on one side and pushing forward with the hilt to shatter him at the knee, then resheathing as quickly as possible with his right hand, almost throwing it back into it's sheath.

Jutsu usedShow *Iaido • Beheading Draw

C-Rank Kenjutsu

Prerequisite: 6 Speed

The user draws their katana with one hand and slams their palm into the back of their blade to increase the force behind the swing made in any direction. This works with blunted side of a sword, but it can also draw out their strength and the blade's cutting power in full to quickly slash apart obstacles. Re-sheathing after this technique may take a bit longer; the placement of the hands following this technqiue make it difficult to resheath properly.

*Iaido • Quick Sheath

D-Rank Utility Kenjutsu

Prerequisite: 4 Speed

Through hours of practice the user has learned to quickly sheath their weapon with one hand. This allows the user sheath their weapon as quickly as possible, even if their other hand is not on the sheath.

Ryoga scoffed at the man's disgraceful gestures towards him. As if he cared who he was or what he thought. He was a target in his mission, nothing more. As such, he had nothing more to say to the man. As the man presented himself for a free shot, Ryoga would gladly take that opportunity. His mission stated that he couldn't kill his target, but that wouldn't stop him from crippling him how he saw fit. He quickly dashed towards his target, covering the distance between them in a matter of seconds, but keeping an eye out for a trap of some sort, as he could be luring him into something. if he managed to get to him, he would draw his blade and aim to break the man's kneecap with the side of his blade, placing his palm on one side and pushing forward with the hilt to shatter him at the knee, then resheathing as quickly as possible with his right hand, almost throwing it back into it's sheath.

Jutsu usedShow *Iaido • Beheading Draw

C-Rank Kenjutsu

Prerequisite: 6 Speed

The user draws their katana with one hand and slams their palm into the back of their blade to increase the force behind the swing made in any direction. This works with blunted side of a sword, but it can also draw out their strength and the blade's cutting power in full to quickly slash apart obstacles. Re-sheathing after this technique may take a bit longer; the placement of the hands following this technqiue make it difficult to resheath properly.

*Iaido • Quick Sheath

D-Rank Utility Kenjutsu

Prerequisite: 4 Speed

Through hours of practice the user has learned to quickly sheath their weapon with one hand. This allows the user sheath their weapon as quickly as possible, even if their other hand is not on the sheath.

			The man was expecting the sudden onslaught, expecting the Shinobi to not realize that getting the first move was not as important as getting the first hit.  It was why when Ry drew his sword the man was prepared, turning to the side and pushing himself into a back flip, kicking away the hilt of his blade with the sole of his foot, using Ry's own momentum to push himself further away.  A grin of enjoyment was on his face as he landed, his feet planted firmly.  "[color=peru]That was good, though predictable.  You need to be more...how do you say, discreet.[/color]"  As if to make his point as he finished talking, the man's seals were finished and his foot stomped the ground and he purposefully looked down as his feet as though to wait for his jutsu to take affect.

Whereas, instead, a sudden burst of katon would begin to erupt from the ground where Ryo was currently standing, covering about a 3x3 foot radius.  The fire was hot, enough to cause second degree burns if enough time was spent in the flames.  He was ready to react depending on  what Ryo did in response to the flames, that ever irritating smile still lit on his face.

			My CharactersShow

The man was expecting the sudden onslaught, expecting the Shinobi to not realize that getting the first move was not as important as getting the first hit.  It was why when Ry drew his sword the man was prepared, turning to the side and pushing himself into a back flip, kicking away the hilt of his blade with the sole of his foot, using Ry's own momentum to push himself further away.  A grin of enjoyment was on his face as he landed, his feet planted firmly.  "[color=peru]That was good, though predictable.  You need to be more...how do you say, discreet.[/color]"  As if to make his point as he finished talking, the man's seals were finished and his foot stomped the ground and he purposefully looked down as his feet as though to wait for his jutsu to take affect.

Whereas, instead, a sudden burst of katon would begin to erupt from the ground where Ryo was currently standing, covering about a 3x3 foot radius.  The fire was hot, enough to cause second degree burns if enough time was spent in the flames.  He was ready to react depending on  what Ryo did in response to the flames, that ever irritating smile still lit on his face.

			Ryoga was impressed with the man's ability to avoid his attack. He almost barked at the man out of spite [color=#DC143C]"Discretion is for the weak. You'll bleed like the rest."[/color] As he finished his retort, he saw the man finish some seals and stomp on the ground. [i][color=#DC143C]"Stomping the ground? Seems similar to one of my own techniques"[/color][/i]. No sooner had he completed his thought, He instinctively jumped backwards away from the burst of katon, performing his own seals and after landing and finishing these seals, stomping the ground. Moments after, a fountain of water sprang forth, enveloping a 3 meter area, and hopefully the katon with it. [color=#DC143C]"Your lucky i have to bring you back alive, or this would be so much quicker."[/color] Afterwards, he would move to the side of the fountain to establish line of sight with the man once more, and wait for his reaction.

Jutsu usedShow *Guardian Fountain

C-Rank Suiton Ninjutsu

Prerequisite: Control Stat of 6

Requiring a slightly above average level of control, this technique generates a large amount of water as a defense mechanism. By performing a string of seals, the user will stomp and create a fountain of water from the ground that flows at a speed of five. The fountain is three meters in diameter and four meters in height. This technique lasts for three posts. All in all, this creates just over eight thousand cubic meters of water.

			[i]

Author: Post

Ryoga was impressed with the man's ability to avoid his attack. He almost barked at the man out of spite [color=#DC143C]"Discretion is for the weak. You'll bleed like the rest."[/color] As he finished his retort, he saw the man finish some seals and stomp on the ground. [i][color=#DC143C]"Stomping the ground? Seems similar to one of my own techniques"[/color][/i]. No sooner had he completed his thought, He instinctively jumped backwards away from the burst of katon, performing his own seals and after landing and finishing these seals, stomping the ground. Moments after, a fountain of water sprang forth, enveloping a 3 meter area, and hopefully the katon with it. [color=#DC143C]"Your lucky i have to bring you back alive, or this would be so much quicker."[/color] Afterwards, he would move to the side of the fountain to establish line of sight with the man once more, and wait for his reaction.

Jutsu usedShow *Guardian Fountain

C-Rank Suiton Ninjutsu

Prerequisite: Control Stat of 6

Requiring a slightly above average level of control, this technique generates a large amount of water as a defense mechanism. By performing a string of seals, the user will stomp and create a fountain of water from the ground that flows at a speed of five. The fountain is three meters in diameter and four meters in height. This technique lasts for three posts. All in all, this creates just over eight thousand cubic meters of water.

------------------------------------------------------------

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=845229]Amy[/url][/b] » Fri Aug 23, 2013 1:34 pm

			((Sorry about the wait, been moving, cleaning, unpacking, being siiiicckkk, but I should be all set now but expect ~slow posting for a bit still))

"[color=peru]Oh?  That's a veerrryyyy interesting piece of information that you probably shouldn't have shared.[/color]"  Telling an opponent that you couldn't kill him was essentially giving him the automatic upper hand.  A rookie mistake, and a costly one at that.  It gave the man the knowledge that no attack was going to be of deadly force, it allowed him to know somewhat the level of urgency he would need to move with to avoid an attack.  The look on his face only grew more confident as his mind quickly ran through all of this information.

As the Shinobi finished his seals, the man began running, easily expecting something to come from the ground.  His speed was intense and he was able to avoid the majority of the fountain, though it hit him towards the end of his run but he was able to use the momentum enough to be able to flip into the air and land solidly on his feet and palms, his hair falling around his face, now lightly damp.  He shook his head much like a dog, "[color=peru]Thanks, I needed a bath.[/color]"

Standing relatively close now, the man began threading hand seals, backing up very slightly.  As his seals would complete he would place both hands out in front of him, a large burst of wind blowing from his hands, pushing with a force of seven and cutting with a strength of five.  The man had to concentrate and could not perform any other techniques at the same time, though the wind could be controlled to a certain degree.  Though the jutsu could be canceled easily, the man wouldn't be able to move while he was controlling the wind.

			My CharactersShow
[b]B-Rank MN[/b] • [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=8278570/1/?x=15]Katō, Tsubaki[/url] [color=#A32638]#A32638[/color]

[b]Sp. Jounin[/b] • Kirigakure no Sato • [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5777826/1/?x=90#new]Araki Kiyo[/url] [color=#DDA0DD]#DDA0DD[/color]

"[color=peru]Oh?  That's a veerrryyyy interesting piece of information that you probably shouldn't have shared.[/color]"  Telling an opponent that you couldn't kill him was essentially giving him the automatic upper hand.  A rookie mistake, and a costly one at that.  It gave the man the knowledge that no attack was going to be of deadly force, it allowed him to know somewhat the level of urgency he would need to move with to avoid an attack.  The look on his face only grew more confident as his mind quickly ran through all of this information.

As the Shinobi finished his seals, the man began running, easily expecting something to come from the ground.  His speed was intense and he was able to avoid the majority of the fountain, though it hit him towards the end of his run but he was able to use the momentum enough to be able to flip into the air and land solidly on his feet and palms, his hair falling around his face, now lightly damp.  He shook his head much like a dog, "[color=peru]Thanks, I needed a bath.[/color]"

Standing relatively close now, the man began threading hand seals, backing up very slightly.  As his seals would complete he would place both hands out in front of him, a large burst of wind blowing from his hands, pushing with a force of seven and cutting with a strength of five.  The man had to concentrate and could not perform any other techniques at the same time, though the wind could be controlled to a certain degree.  Though the jutsu could be canceled easily, the man wouldn't be able to move while he was controlling the wind.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Sun Aug 25, 2013 4:32 pm

			((Nah, its all good, i read your thread in the intro area about you having some stuff coming up, i totally understand.))

Ryoga hadn't really thought what telling his target that meant, but in the end he didn't really care. [color=#DC143C]"Believe me, It doesn't change the outcome of this fight. You're nowhere near as skilled as me, This will be over quickly." [/color] Ryoga would do everything in his power to keep himself from killing this man, but if it came down to a life or death scenario, he knew he wouldn't hesitate to off him in an instant.

As the ninja dodged the geyser Ryoga set forth, he was honestly surprised that it had hit him at all. A relatively weak defensive technique meant for producing water in a pinch, the geyser wasn't meant to actually hit the man, but rather engulf the Katon burst he caused. Ryoga made eye contact with the man, watching his every move so that he might counter with the water being produced by the fountain. [color=#DC143C]"I'm shocked that hit you at all, either you're slower than i thought or you're not paying enough attention." [/color]

No sooner had he finished saying "attention" the man made his move, stepping back and performing handseals. As he finished his seals, Ryoga saw the gust of wind leave his palms. He dashed top speed while performing handseals, making a dash to put the fountain between him and his target. at top speed, he was barely faster than the burst of wind following him, but it did still slash as his back a bit, ripping through his clothes and lashing his back with a few small gashes. It stung a bit, but he had experienced far worse.

As he put the fountain between them and finished his seals, He focused on the geyser, still gushing water, and put his hands into the water, morphing it into a large ball of water which then rolled towards the man at a speed of 7. The ball stood 4 meters tall, and had a diameter of 3 meters. Not wanting to waste time, Ryoga would proceed to dash around the other side of the fountain, away from the man's torrent of wind he hoped, and would then react to whether or not his prison engulfed the man as he planned.

Jutsu usedShow *Water Prison

B-Rank Suiton Ninjutsu

By forming a string of seals, the user is able to spew a large ball of water that stands at three meters in diameter. This ball rolls at the target at a speed of seven. Should this strike a target, they will become engulfed within the sphere. However, if this manages to strike multiple targets, it will envelop them as well, up to a total of three prisoners. One can resist being pulled into the ball if they have a strength of seven or higher. The ball will roll thirty meters, regardless of whether or not anyone has been captured. Once inside, the targets will spin with the sphere and may cause dizziness, nausea and disorientation. The technique lasts for a total of five posts, rolling included, before bursting.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]
