								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=948882]Tsedas[/url][/b] » Sat Aug 03, 2013 4:35 am

			Shigekuni watched the other boy go through the motions a few times slowly and he could already see what was wrong. His punches weren't getting enough momentum for one. Also his slashes were being incorporated into the punches which was slowing things down. They were also leaving him vulnerable if he just stood there to deliver both a punch and slash.

"[color=#95BD4F]You're not putting yourself into your punches. You need to use you abs, put your body behind the swing. Also I'd try keeping the punches and slashes separate, they're slowing you down when you combine them. They also leave you open a little too. But that's all I can really see right now.[/color]" Shigekuni pointed out as he walked over to a dummy himself and balled up his fist. Pulling his arm back, he thrust his arm forward, twisting his upper body as he threw himself into a simple yet powerful punch that made a solid BAM! as it hit the dummy. It wasn't the strongest punch the other boy might have seen, but the form was very good for a Genin. Shaking his hand a bit to get rid of the ouchies, Shigekuni looked back to the other boy. "[color=#95BD4F]Kind of like what I just did, but then again I'm sure we'll get better at this crap when we've had more training.[/color]"

Shigekuni watched the other boy go through the motions a few times slowly and he could already see what was wrong. His punches weren't getting enough momentum for one. Also his slashes were being incorporated into the punches which was slowing things down. They were also leaving him vulnerable if he just stood there to deliver both a punch and slash.

"[color=#95BD4F]You're not putting yourself into your punches. You need to use you abs, put your body behind the swing. Also I'd try keeping the punches and slashes separate, they're slowing you down when you combine them. They also leave you open a little too. But that's all I can really see right now.[/color]" Shigekuni pointed out as he walked over to a dummy himself and balled up his fist. Pulling his arm back, he thrust his arm forward, twisting his upper body as he threw himself into a simple yet powerful punch that made a solid BAM! as it hit the dummy. It wasn't the strongest punch the other boy might have seen, but the form was very good for a Genin. Shaking his hand a bit to get rid of the ouchies, Shigekuni looked back to the other boy. 								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Thu Aug 29, 2013 12:29 am

			Sanjuku was about to retort with some snappy remark to make himself seem above this boy, but as he thought about the points he was making, perhaps it was better to focus on punching OR slashing, not both. It would do less damage, but it took less to do and would leave him far less open during strikes. [color=#ee4a2d]"Well, i guess the green behind my ears must be showing huh? Yeah, truth be told, perhaps Tekagi-Shufo would be more practical, but these gauntlets were my graduation gift from my father. He understood what i wanted in a weapon, and i feel i would be letting him down if i just ditched them without even trying to make them work. Besides, some of the best ninja are specifically known by their bizarre weaponry, so why not bladed gauntlets?"[/color] With that, Sanjuku took a seat once more on the bench, but continued talking to this genin whose name he had not even learned yet.

[color=#ee4a2d]"However, what you said is completely correct, I should focus on one or the other when it comes to my punches. Maybe you could help me fix my stance sometime?"[/color] Under normal circumstances, he would never ask for help, but he was starting to see that this boy knew what he was talking about, and to shirk off his help would be a step in the wrong direction for his development. [color=#ee4a2d]"And by the way, I never caught your name Stiffy."[/color] It seemed that "Stiffy" was Sanjuku's nickname for the nameless Genin boy.

			[i]

Author: Post

Sanjuku was about to retort with some snappy remark to make himself seem above this boy, but as he thought about the points he was making, perhaps it was better to focus on punching OR slashing, not both. It would do less damage, but it took less to do and would leave him far less open during strikes. [color=#ee4a2d]"Well, i guess the green behind my ears must be showing huh? Yeah, truth be told, perhaps Tekagi-Shufo would be more practical, but these gauntlets were my graduation gift from my father. He understood what i wanted in a weapon, and i feel i would be letting him down if i just ditched them without even trying to make them work. Besides, some of the best ninja are specifically known by their bizarre weaponry, so why not bladed gauntlets?"[/color] With that, Sanjuku took a seat once more on the bench, but continued talking to this genin whose name he had not even learned yet.

[color=#ee4a2d]"However, what you said is completely correct, I should focus on one or the other when it comes to my punches. Maybe you could help me fix my stance sometime?"[/color] Under normal circumstances, he would never ask for help, but he was starting to see that this boy knew what he was talking about, and to shirk off his help would be a step in the wrong direction for his development. [color=#ee4a2d]"And by the way, I never caught your name Stiffy."[/color] It seemed that "Stiffy" was Sanjuku's nickname for the nameless Genin boy.

			Are you wanting to remove the ability itself and a jutsu or just the ability? 'Cause you're using Empathy which'll require the ability.

			[color=#9300C4][b]"Tch,"[/b][/color] Arsenal sucked his teeth. [color=#9300C4][b]"The sun isn't even up yet. How insane. Who knew waking up this early was even possible?"[/b][/color]

It was almost five AM and a youth was walking in Kumo. The youthful genin, Arsenal, rose much early. He usually woke at eleven or twelve, but not today, he had training his sensei, Tokaido, assigned. Tokaido-sensei said to come prepared so he did. He wore his usual grabs, a silver jumpsuit with a shorten sleeve and pant leg, a shuriken design on the chest, and traditional gray shinobi sandals. He was armed with twenty shuriken in a holster strapped to his leg and ten kunai, two smoke pellets, and eight explosion notes in a round rear pouch.

The kid had not the slightest inkling of what his sensei had planned, but he knew Modoka was invited. He looked forward to learning some type of medical jutsu from him.

Arsenal leaped down the side of a mountain, rock to rock until reaching an island-like base. At the bottom of the mountain was mainly sea. Where the genin landed was a patch of land with earth and grass by the mountain, then sand, then the sea. The patch was large enough to be compared to the average training ground. The area was where he met his cell. It was relaxing like a tropical vacation there, too bad it was cold, fairly dark, and on top of that, had to train.

[color=#9300C4][b]"Here!"[/b][/color] Shouted Arsenal from the last leap down. [color=#9300C4][b]"Anyone miss the witty zinger?"[/b][/color]

			[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5145651/1/?x=0#post1539790][color=saddlebrown][b]To Create an Arsenal[/b][/color][/url]

			Tokaido awaited his genin underling at the training ground, hidden by a sort of makeshift ghili suit in the grass simply watching and waiting for him to arrive. He wore his usual black vest and sleeveless shirt, but instead wore a dark green camo version of his usual pants, to aid him in camouflaging himself in the grass. He had been awake since 3AM, as he was used to doing this kind of thing whenever he went hunting. He held a single kunai in his right hand as well, in case he wanted to take a shot at something, or someone.

He didn't expect Dememaru to land near his hiding spot, though he believed his camouflage to be adequate to hide him, as the boy hadn't noticed him laying on the ground no more than 10 feet away. Tokaido wouldn't flex a muscle, as a single movement could alert Dememaru if his eyes were good enough. If Dememaru didn't notice Tokaido, he would simply lay there until Madoka arrived, at which point he would make his presence known.

			[i]

Author: Post

Tokaido awaited his genin underling at the training ground, hidden by a sort of makeshift ghili suit in the grass simply watching and waiting for him to arrive. He wore his usual black vest and sleeveless shirt, but instead wore a dark green camo version of his usual pants, to aid him in camouflaging himself in the grass. He had been awake since 3AM, as he was used to doing this kind of thing whenever he went hunting. He held a single kunai in his right hand as well, in case he wanted to take a shot at something, or someone.

He didn't expect Dememaru to land near his hiding spot, though he believed his camouflage to be adequate to hide him, as the boy hadn't noticed him laying on the ground no more than 10 feet away. Tokaido wouldn't flex a muscle, as a single movement could alert Dememaru if his eyes were good enough. If Dememaru didn't notice Tokaido, he would simply lay there until Madoka arrived, at which point he would make his presence known.

=== THREAD: -Mission- Deliverance - Naruto Saigen Roleplay ===
Forum: Home Board index Role Play Wind Country Sunagakure no Sato > Home Board index

------------------------------------------------------------
Author: (unknown)

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/][/url]
				Naruto Saigen Roleplay
				Naruto Saigen RP is a text-based roleplay forum set in an alternate universe of the Naruto series.

[url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1471985][i][/url]
								[url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1471985]Jeff[/url]

		[b]Posts:[/b] [url=./search.php?author_id=1471985&sr=posts]4169[/url]		[b]Joined:[/b] Wed Dec 08, 2010 6:00 pm

				[b]Contact:[/b]

								REPORT
							[/url]

							[url=./posting.php?mode=quote&f=57&p=1549370]
								QUOTE
							[/url]

			[url=./viewtopic.php?f=57&p=1549370&thanks=1549370&to_id=1471985&from_id=1869325]

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1471985]Jeff[/url][/b] » Mon Jun 10, 2013 9:01 pm

			MissionShow
[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5147912/1/]viewtopic.php?&t=5147912/1/[/url]

Sunagakure no Sato is a village of mighty warriors and even the mightier of clans. Ninja that walk in and out of the village hold many rights and duties that they must perform in order to become better and better; missions being one of those duties.

The day was dry and hot. The sun was shining directly over the village and it wasn't even past noon yet. The villagers were all wandering around the streets taking in their daily lives, working, and doing menial things that were apart of their routines. The merchants were selling their supplies, the florists selling their flowers, and the restaurants selling their food to the public. It was just a busy day like all other.

One man in particular, a chubby one, stood outside his mail office waiting for the genin that had hired to deliver some paper work for him, as well as fix a few other problems if he so wished. He swept in a red and blue checkered shirt and white khakis. He wore brown sandals on his feet and had a red visor on his head and round glasses over his eyes. His hair was a dark brown and he had a full grown beard that looked wild and untamed. If that seemed okay, his raunchy smell would make any who walk near him want to cover their noses and get away as quickly as possible.

Was it worth the try.. who knew, but a mission is a mission.

			[i]
CharactersShow

			MissionShow
[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5147912/1/]viewtopic.php?&t=5147912/1/[/url]

Sunagakure no Sato is a village of mighty warriors and even the mightier of clans. Ninja that walk in and out of the village hold many rights and duties that they must perform in order to become better and better; missions being one of those duties.

The day was dry and hot. The sun was shining directly over the village and it wasn't even past noon yet. The villagers were all wandering around the streets taking in their daily lives, working, and doing menial things that were apart of their routines. The merchants were selling their supplies, the florists selling their flowers, and the restaurants selling their food to the public. It was just a busy day like all other.

One man in particular, a chubby one, stood outside his mail office waiting for the genin that had hired to deliver some paper work for him, as well as fix a few other problems if he so wished. He swept in a red and blue checkered shirt and white khakis. He wore brown sandals on his feet and had a red visor on his head and round glasses over his eyes. His hair was a dark brown and he had a full grown beard that looked wild and untamed. If that seemed okay, his raunchy smell would make any who walk near him want to cover their noses and get away as quickly as possible.

Was it worth the try.. who knew, but a mission is a mission.

			[i]

MissionShow
[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5147912/1/]viewtopic.php?&t=5147912/1/[/url]

Sunagakure no Sato is a village of mighty warriors and even the mightier of clans. Ninja that walk in and out of the village hold many rights and duties that they must perform in order to become better and better; missions being one of those duties.

The day was dry and hot. The sun was shining directly over the village and it wasn't even past noon yet. The villagers were all wandering around the streets taking in their daily lives, working, and doing menial things that were apart of their routines. The merchants were selling their supplies, the florists selling their flowers, and the restaurants selling their food to the public. It was just a busy day like all other.

One man in particular, a chubby one, stood outside his mail office waiting for the genin that had hired to deliver some paper work for him, as well as fix a few other problems if he so wished. He swept in a red and blue checkered shirt and white khakis. He wore brown sandals on his feet and had a red visor on his head and round glasses over his eyes. His hair was a dark brown and he had a full grown beard that looked wild and untamed. If that seemed okay, his raunchy smell would make any who walk near him want to cover their noses and get away as quickly as possible.

Was it worth the try.. who knew, but a mission is a mission.

			Sanjuku raced to the mail office he was called to. He wasn't too thrilled about being someone's lackey, but every Genin has to start somewhere. He turned the corner and before he knew it, he was in front of the mail office, looking at a man with absolutely terribly fashion sense. His shirt was repulsive, and as he approached he caught hint of a foul odor that he hoped wasn't his client. [color=#ee4a2d]"So, it seems your the one who hired me. My name is Sanjuku Ouji. It is my mission to help you today."[/color] His voice held a bit of reluctance, but it wasn't as though he could turn tail now. He waited patiently for the man to speak.

			[i]

Author: Post

Sanjuku raced to the mail office he was called to. He wasn't too thrilled about being someone's lackey, but every Genin has to start somewhere. He turned the corner and before he knew it, he was in front of the mail office, looking at a man with absolutely terribly fashion sense. His shirt was repulsive, and as he approached he caught hint of a foul odor that he hoped wasn't his client. [color=#ee4a2d]"So, it seems your the one who hired me. My name is Sanjuku Ouji. It is my mission to help you today."[/color] His voice held a bit of reluctance, but it wasn't as though he could turn tail now. He waited patiently for the man to speak.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1471985]Jeff[/url][/b] » Fri Jun 28, 2013 4:07 am

			The man looked down as if trying to identify the boy that he was going to give all of his precious cargo to. He kept staring up and down the boys body to check and see if this kid was really going to be the one to do all of the work but nevertheless he could not be mad because the kazekage himself was the one to elect the genin to do the mission anyway.

Even before saying a word the man turned his back to the boy and started to walk inside the post office. [b]"Coming along now boy?"[/b] his raspy voice would speak as his swinging front door moved back and forth after his foot steps would move on through.

Everything would even be fine and dandy for the genin until he walked into the office to see stacks and stacks of packages towering all four walls of the main room. It was surely going to be a busy day as the man was caught walking toward behind a counter with a clipboard, paper and a pen. [b]"We start here with the list and we move all these packages a day!"[/b]

			[i]

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Mon Jul 01, 2013 4:28 am

			As the man stared him down, Sanjuku felt his eyes look him over from top to bottom, like an examination. He was about to tell him off, but as he started the man simply turned around and walked inside, uttering for him to follow. Sanjuku followed the man inside the post office, pushing the swinging front door out of his way as he walked into the building with his employer.

As he walked in, he was immediately overcome with hate for this man. There were more packages in this room then he could count, all four walls covered almost from top to bottom in packages. [color=#ee4a2d]"Woah, so ALL of these need to be delivered today? How am i supposed to do that by myself?"[/color] Sanjuku was dreading this day even more, as the sea of packages overwhelmed him. He silently wished the Kazekage had chosen something different for him, but all that could be done about it now was to grin and bear it.

			[i]

Author: Post

As the man stared him down, Sanjuku felt his eyes look him over from top to bottom, like an examination. He was about to tell him off, but as he started the man simply turned around and walked inside, uttering for him to follow. Sanjuku followed the man inside the post office, pushing the swinging front door out of his way as he walked into the building with his employer.

As he walked in, he was immediately overcome with hate for this man. There were more packages in this room then he could count, all four walls covered almost from top to bottom in packages. [color=#ee4a2d]"Woah, so ALL of these need to be delivered today? How am i supposed to do that by myself?"[/color] Sanjuku was dreading this day even more, as the sea of packages overwhelmed him. He silently wished the Kazekage had chosen something different for him, but all that could be done about it now was to grin and bear it.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1471985]Jeff[/url][/b] » Tue Jul 02, 2013 4:39 am

			Hearing the complaints from the boy made the old man feel a bit over the top and heated as he looked down at him, eyes beading back and forth. [b]"Well now if you don't want to be here for the job that you were hired for than go home so I can report back to your superiors. If you continue to act like a little brat I will have you off of the ninja in a heart beat and forced to work labor with me forever!"[/b] he began to rant as he rambled on and on for a good five minutes.

It was strange hearing the man scream like that when he was only soft voiced and kind only moments before. Talk about a terrible person to be paired up with as he paced over to a corner before grabbing a big box and throwing it to the genin. [b]"Take this to the address on top and report back in no less than five minutes!"[/b] he yelled angrily, as the box read an address that was only three blocks over.

When the boy would walk outside, he would see traffic of people running in and around the streets.

			[i]

Author: Post

Hearing the complaints from the boy made the old man feel a bit over the top and heated as he looked down at him, eyes beading back and forth. [b]"Well now if you don't want to be here for the job that you were hired for than go home so I can report back to your superiors. If you continue to act like a little brat I will have you off of the ninja in a heart beat and forced to work labor with me forever!"[/b] he began to rant as he rambled on and on for a good five minutes.

It was strange hearing the man scream like that when he was only soft voiced and kind only moments before. Talk about a terrible person to be paired up with as he paced over to a corner before grabbing a big box and throwing it to the genin. [b]"Take this to the address on top and report back in no less than five minutes!"[/b] he yelled angrily, as the box read an address that was only three blocks over.

When the boy would walk outside, he would see traffic of people running in and around the streets.

						[/i]Post
					[/url]
								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Thu Jul 04, 2013 1:53 pm

			As the man started onto his rant about Sanjuku's work ethic and how he could get him working with the man forever, Sanjuku merely stood silently and let the man let off his steam. Perhaps he was a bit quick to call the man out, but regardless, his job was apparent, and for the time being he would comply. In the midst of the man rant, he threw a box to Sanjuku, which he reactively caught, knocking him out of the trance he was in to tune the man's anger out. [color=#ee4a2d]"Yes sir, i'll be back shortly."[/color] Sanjuku said before he rushed out the door into the crowded street.

As he walked into the street, he immediately realized that the streets were not an option, the people around made it simply too hard to get around quickly. He decided to quickly run up the side of the building and start jumping along the rooftops to quickly get to the address marked on the top of the package.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

						[url=#top]
				[/i]
				Top
			[/url]

------------------------------------------------------------
Author: Post

As the man started onto his rant about Sanjuku's work ethic and how he could get him working with the man forever, Sanjuku merely stood silently and let the man let off his steam. Perhaps he was a bit quick to call the man out, but regardless, his job was apparent, and for the time being he would comply. In the midst of the man rant, he threw a box to Sanjuku, which he reactively caught, knocking him out of the trance he was in to tune the man's anger out. [color=#ee4a2d]"Yes sir, i'll be back shortly."[/color] Sanjuku said before he rushed out the door into the crowded street.

As he walked into the street, he immediately realized that the streets were not an option, the people around made it simply too hard to get around quickly. He decided to quickly run up the side of the building and start jumping along the rooftops to quickly get to the address marked on the top of the package.

------------------------------------------------------------

			Hitting the roofs was the smartest thing to do for the ninja as the people were no longer in his way. If he continued to stay walking within the roads he might have never made it back in time and might have failed but nevertheless the right options were taken into consideration for the genin.

Upon arrival of his several block endeavor, he would notice a beautiful white house with a white picket fence and a red door. The window sills were all painted a darker shade of blue and a beautiful woman stood outside it watering her flower garden. She was even humming a nice tune to herself as she tended to her small field.

Her hair was red, face tanned, and a beautiful white dress was on her back.

			[i]

Hitting the roofs was the smartest thing to do for the ninja as the people were no longer in his way. If he continued to stay walking within the roads he might have never made it back in time and might have failed but nevertheless the right options were taken into consideration for the genin.

Upon arrival of his several block endeavor, he would notice a beautiful white house with a white picket fence and a red door. 			Sanjuku lept from rooftop to rooftop as quickly as possible, trying to save as much time as he could. He finally reached the address he was told to deliver to, and noticed the women tending to her flowers. He would've liked to stay and make a little smalltalk, as the woman seemed very sweet at first glance, but he was on a schedule and he had to stick to it. He walked over and got the woman's attention by lightly tapping her on the shoulder, saying [color=#090]"Excuse me miss, I was instructed to deliver this package to your address, could you please take this?"[/color] as he handed her the package. If the woman would accept the package, he would give a quick smile and nod, then rush back to the office as fast as possible.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

Author: Post

Sanjuku lept from rooftop to rooftop as quickly as possible, trying to save as much time as he could. He finally reached the address he was told to deliver to, and noticed the women tending to her flowers. He would've liked to stay and make a little smalltalk, as the woman seemed very sweet at first glance, but he was on a schedule and he had to stick to it. He walked over and got the woman's attention by lightly tapping her on the shoulder, saying [color=#090]"Excuse me miss, I was instructed to deliver this package to your address, could you please take this?"[/color] as he handed her the package. If the woman would accept the package, he would give a quick smile and nod, then rush back to the office as fast as possible.

------------------------------------------------------------

			The woman would feel a bit surprised and shocked as she was interrupted by a small ninja boy and handing her a brown package. She could only smile happily as she held the box tightly against her chest before thanking the boy and running as quickly as she could into the front door of her house. The door would slam shut behind her and the sounds of her voice screaming within the house could be heard outside of it.

Back at the office, the employer waited for the ninja with ten letters. Five of the ten were in brown envelopes and were all needed to be shipped to the same address. The other five were all destined to go to different houses that had addresses next to each other. The destination seemed to be a bit far. Almost a mile out.

[b]"If you wanna be a super star you can carry those five packages too because they are a block away from the other houses for the envelopes!"[/b] he would point to 5 large boxes that were roughly 4x4x4 each in feet. [b]"They are heavy and very breakable! Its your head if any of them break!"[/b] he waited for the decision of the boy before handing him the paperwork for directions.

			[i]

Author: Post

The woman would feel a bit surprised and shocked as she was interrupted by a small ninja boy and handing her a brown package. She could only smile happily as she held the box tightly against her chest before thanking the boy and running as quickly as she could into the front door of her house. The door would slam shut behind her and the sounds of her voice screaming within the house could be heard outside of it.

Back at the office, the employer waited for the ninja with ten letters. Five of the ten were in brown envelopes and were all needed to be shipped to the same address. The other five were all destined to go to different houses that had addresses next to each other. The destination seemed to be a bit far. Almost a mile out.

[b]"If you wanna be a super star you can carry those five packages too because they are a block away from the other houses for the envelopes!"[/b] he would point to 5 large boxes that were roughly 4x4x4 each in feet. [b]"They are heavy and very breakable! Its your head if any of them break!"[/b] he waited for the decision of the boy before handing him the paperwork for directions.

			As much as Sanjuku wanted to be the best there is, he was no fool, and without a proper method of transportation, he would be at a loss for how to carry those packages without the fear of breaking them. [color=#ee4a2d]"It's not that i don't want to take them, but how would i guarantee they won't break? Do you have something i could use to ensure their safe delivery?"[/color] Sanjuku would be gathering the letters into his pouch as he asked this question, and based on his employer's answer, may or may not take the packages with him.

			The owner of the mail store was somewhat enlightened that the boy was starting to use his head It was showing some sort of promise that he wasn't all just some loser with a not so great attitude as he let out a smile before tossing a ring of keys to the boy. [b]"If you go out toward the back you will see a large red wagon! If you think your smart enough to use it than I would not mind you going ahead and taking it on!"[/b] he would let out a smirk as the keys would have about twenty of them on the ring.

The room in the back was guarded by a large black door, hopefully matching a black key. It was actually a garage, and there was a giant red wagon with dust just chilling in the dead center of the room.

The owner of the mail store was somewhat enlightened that the boy was starting to use his head It was showing some sort of promise that he wasn't all just some loser with a not so great attitude as he let out a smile before tossing a ring of keys to the boy. [b]"If you go out toward the back you will see a large red wagon! If you think your smart enough to use it than I would not mind you going ahead and taking it on!"[/b] he would let out a smirk as the keys would have about twenty of them on the ring.

The room in the back was guarded by a large black door, hopefully matching a black key. It was actually a garage, and there was a giant red wagon with dust just chilling in the dead center of the room.

			MissionShow
[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5154645/1/]viewtopic.php?&t=5154645/1/[/url]

The rainy skies cast down on the village as the sounds of thunder clapping and the bright flashes of white lightning was the only source of light that came across the sky. This was known as the village of Kumogakure no Sato. The sad fact is that all people who lived in this area were all used to these types of things and situations happening and could care less about the matter.

A farmer stood in his trench coat waiting for a ninja to appear as his eyes shifted back and forth around the area. It was obvious there was something bothering him and why wouldn't their be when his farm, that was normally filled with bulls and calfs, was nearly empty except for a few shuriken and kunai that were lying in the pits.

His coat was yellow, and his boots were black. His hair was red and his skin was paled and freckled. He waited for his rescuer.

			[i]

This was known as the village of Kumogakure no Sato. The sad fact is that all people who lived in this area were all used to these types of things and situations happening and could care less about the matter.

A farmer stood in his trench coat waiting for a ninja to appear as his eyes shifted back and forth around the area. It was obvious there was something bothering him and why wouldn't their be when his farm, that was normally filled with bulls and calfs, was nearly empty except for a few shuriken and kunai that were lying in the pits.

His coat was yellow, and his boots were black. His hair was red and his skin was paled and freckled. He waited for his rescuer.

MissionShow
[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5154645/1/]viewtopic.php?&t=5154645/1/[/url]

The rainy skies cast down on the village as the sounds of thunder clapping and the bright flashes of white lightning was the only source of light that came across the sky. This was known as the village of Kumogakure no Sato. The sad fact is that all people who lived in this area were all used to these types of things and situations happening and could care less about the matter.

A farmer stood in his trench coat waiting for a ninja to appear as his eyes shifted back and forth around the area. It was obvious there was something bothering him and why wouldn't their be when his farm, that was normally filled with bulls and calfs, was nearly empty except for a few shuriken and kunai that were lying in the pits.

His coat was yellow, and his boots were black. His hair was red and his skin was paled and freckled. He waited for his rescuer.

			Tokaido arrived at the farm he was told to go to in order to meet the person who hired him. From the looks of things, the man was a farmer of some sorts. He saw no crops in the man's fields, instead seeing signs of grazing. however, he saw no cattle, and noticed a few stray kunai laying in the dirt. As he approached the man wearing the yellow coat, he spoke with a serious tone. [color=#090]"Hello, my name is Tokaido. I was told to meet you here, and that i would be told my mission upon arrival. What seems to be the problem?"[/color] Tokaido stood about 5 feet away from the man, keeping a hand near his shuriken holster.

			[i]

Author: Post

Tokaido arrived at the farm he was told to go to in order to meet the person who hired him. From the looks of things, the man was a farmer of some sorts. He saw no crops in the man's fields, instead seeing signs of grazing. however, he saw no cattle, and noticed a few stray kunai laying in the dirt. As he approached the man wearing the yellow coat, he spoke with a serious tone. [color=#090]"Hello, my name is Tokaido. I was told to meet you here, and that i would be told my mission upon arrival. What seems to be the problem?"[/color] Tokaido stood about 5 feet away from the man, keeping a hand near his shuriken holster.

------------------------------------------------------------

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1471985]Jeff[/url][/b] » Fri Jun 28, 2013 4:19 am

			The ginger farmer looked down at the chuunin and realized that he was going to have a real hard time leaving all of his precious cattle to one person. It was almost like a suicide mission but if the raikage was able to let that go within his head than it was obvious that the man would have to trust him as well. Nevertheless there was more important things to worry about like his precious bulls, the village, and those evil genin that have been tormenting his animals for the longest time now.

[b]"Well now, yes there is a problem sir! You see there are these three genin and they have been terrorizing my bulls for the longest time! They made them all escape and they are now on a four mile run toward the village which is dangerous!"[/b] he started to speak frantically. [b]"Questions?!"[/b] he would shout.

It was obvious which way the bulls went as tracks and falling down trees were all headed north.

			[i]

Author: Post

The ginger farmer looked down at the chuunin and realized that he was going to have a real hard time leaving all of his precious cattle to one person. It was almost like a suicide mission but if the raikage was able to let that go within his head than it was obvious that the man would have to trust him as well. Nevertheless there was more important things to worry about like his precious bulls, the village, and those evil genin that have been tormenting his animals for the longest time now.

[b]"Well now, yes there is a problem sir! You see there are these three genin and they have been terrorizing my bulls for the longest time! They made them all escape and they are now on a four mile run toward the village which is dangerous!"[/b] he started to speak frantically. [b]"Questions?!"[/b] he would shout.

It was obvious which way the bulls went as tracks and falling down trees were all headed north.

------------------------------------------------------------

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Mon Jul 01, 2013 4:38 am

			Tokaido had no idea who these genin were, but hopefully this man could tell him something about them. [color=#090]"So, you want me to bring back your bulls, which are currently on a warpath to Kumo, and take care of the genin terrorizing your fields. Can you give me any information about the Genin, like their weapons, affinities, specialties? And the bulls, is there anything special I should know about them that might help me bring them back?"[/color]

After the man had said everything he could, Tokaido would leave without a word, following the tracks laid by the bulls going north. He would attempt to stay somewhat hidden, ducking behind any trees still standing whenever possible, as he didn't want any genin getting the drop on him. He did however keep a good pace, as the bulls heading for Kumo had a good lead on him, and he needed to catch up.

			[i]

Author: Post

Tokaido had no idea who these genin were, but hopefully this man could tell him something about them. [color=#090]"So, you want me to bring back your bulls, which are currently on a warpath to Kumo, and take care of the genin terrorizing your fields. Can you give me any information about the Genin, like their weapons, affinities, specialties? And the bulls, is there anything special I should know about them that might help me bring them back?"[/color]

After the man had said everything he could, Tokaido would leave without a word, following the tracks laid by the bulls going north. He would attempt to stay somewhat hidden, ducking behind any trees still standing whenever possible, as he didn't want any genin getting the drop on him. He did however keep a good pace, as the bulls heading for Kumo had a good lead on him, and he needed to catch up.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1471985]Jeff[/url][/b] » Tue Jul 02, 2013 4:46 am

			The old man put his hand to his mouth as he started to think about what exactly it was that the genin used. [b]"Well erm. for starters, there is this one that used a little fire cracker explosion that actually made the bulls go all running about. It wasn't a very fun time and well the others were all using them ninja weapons that are sharp to get them to run in the directions that they wanted. I think there was another using special magic powers but I forgot exactly it was what he was doing."[/b] he shrugged as he would look up to see the ninja walk away.

While walking down the path he would see trees broken down, and would continue to see ninja tools along the ground. If he were open minded he would hear very loud panting coming from no more than 10 meters to his east. If he went to go look he would see a bull resting behind a bush, almost sleeping as it were still.

			[i]
CharactersShow
[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=8113987/1/]Aburame, Akki[/url]Village: [color=green]Konohagakure no Sato[/color]Rank: GeninThread: [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=8114828/1/]Insects Guide Me[/url] [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=8122165/1/]Genkouyoushi, Koutaishi[/url]Village: [color=tan]Iwagakure no Sato[/color]Rank: C-RankThread: [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=4702738/1/#new]Paper Guide the Way[/url]
[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5946554/1/]Ouji, Tatsumi[/url]Village: [color=yellow]Sunagakure no Sato[/color]Rank: D-RankThread: [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5943179/1/#new]Artist's Move[/url]

						[url=#top]

------------------------------------------------------------
Author: Post

The old man put his hand to his mouth as he started to think about what exactly it was that the genin used. [b]"Well erm. for starters, there is this one that used a little fire cracker explosion that actually made the bulls go all running about. It wasn't a very fun time and well the others were all using them ninja weapons that are sharp to get them to run in the directions that they wanted. I think there was another using special magic powers but I forgot exactly it was what he was doing."[/b] he shrugged as he would look up to see the ninja walk away.

While walking down the path he would see trees broken down, and would continue to see ninja tools along the ground. If he were open minded he would hear very loud panting coming from no more than 10 meters to his east. If he went to go look he would see a bull resting behind a bush, almost sleeping as it were still.

------------------------------------------------------------
Author:

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Thu Jul 04, 2013 1:38 pm

			As Tokaido walked along the path of destruction left by the bulls, he took close notice of the ninja toole saw scattered along the ground. Kunai and Shuriken being his weapon of choice, he took note of the amount of tools he saw. He continued to follow the path a bit farther when he heard panting coming from a bush to his right. Upon closer examination, he found a bull, seemingly asleep. He approached the bull, and after performing a few quick handseals, pressed his hands to the bulls head to jolt it awake. After waking the bull, he would take a quick step away from the animal, in case of spooking it. if it wasn't spooked, he would try to send it back down the path to its owner, then continue in pursuit of the stampede.

Jutsu usedShow *[Lightning Element• Shock Treatment]

D-Rank Ninjutsu

After performing the proper hand seals, the user's hands become electrically charged and they are able to use small currents of electricity to wake up someone who was knocked out. To add to this, these charges can stimulate the brain of someone who's conscious. This stimulation can wake those drifting to sleep or momentarily get rid of any grogginess caused by fatigue for four posts. This jutsu can’t bring targets out of genjutsu, however nor can it add wit.

			[i]

Author: Post

As Tokaido walked along the path of destruction left by the bulls, he took close notice of the ninja toole saw scattered along the ground. Kunai and Shuriken being his weapon of choice, he took note of the amount of tools he saw. He continued to follow the path a bit farther when he heard panting coming from a bush to his right. Upon closer examination, he found a bull, seemingly asleep. He approached the bull, and after performing a few quick handseals, pressed his hands to the bulls head to jolt it awake. After waking the bull, he would take a quick step away from the animal, in case of spooking it. if it wasn't spooked, he would try to send it back down the path to its owner, then continue in pursuit of the stampede.

Jutsu usedShow *[Lightning Element• Shock Treatment]

D-Rank Ninjutsu

After performing the proper hand seals, the user's hands become electrically charged and they are able to use small currents of electricity to wake up someone who was knocked out. To add to this, these charges can stimulate the brain of someone who's conscious. This stimulation can wake those drifting to sleep or momentarily get rid of any grogginess caused by fatigue for four posts. This jutsu can’t bring targets out of genjutsu, however nor can it add wit.

			It probably wasn't the smartest thing to do to wake a sleeping bull as its eyes jolted open and started to buck around the space it laid in frantically. It was scared from teh feeling and started to hit its horns against the trees before it would catch your eye, rubbing its hooves against the ground as it looked as it if it was going to charge you with full force.

OOC; sory short post. tired.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Sun Jul 07, 2013 9:46 am

			heheh. Tokaido should've thought a bit more about that move, as the bull went ballistic, Tokaido quickly thought of a way to stop the bull from goring his insides out. He would find a couple trees close enough together for his technique, then after forming his handseals, he would create a thin electric wire between the two trees, and taunt the bull to attack. If the bull would run into the wire, it would buy Tokaido enough time to make his escape from the bull, and continue along the warpath left by the other bulls.

Jutsu usedShow *[Lightning Element • Electric Wire Technique]

C-Rank Ninjutsu

The user creates a wire of electricity between their hands. This wire can be placed between two objects, like two trees or two rocks that are up to 10 meters apart. The user has to touch one of the objects and then drag the Raiton wire to the other object and attach it there. Upon being touched, the wire can trip targets while also delivering a painful shock to the limb that touched it, followed by paralysis to said limb. The paralysis lasts for one post, and the wire can sustain itself for up to 4 posts or until dismissed.

OOC; yeah, maybe i shouldn't have woken him up. bad move.

			[i]

Author: Post

heheh. Tokaido should've thought a bit more about that move, as the bull went ballistic, Tokaido quickly thought of a way to stop the bull from goring his insides out. He would find a couple trees close enough together for his technique, then after forming his handseals, he would create a thin electric wire between the two trees, and taunt the bull to attack. If the bull would run into the wire, it would buy Tokaido enough time to make his escape from the bull, and continue along the warpath left by the other bulls.

Jutsu usedShow *[Lightning Element • Electric Wire Technique]

C-Rank Ninjutsu

The user creates a wire of electricity between their hands. This wire can be placed between two objects, like two trees or two rocks that are up to 10 meters apart. The user has to touch one of the objects and then drag the Raiton wire to the other object and attach it there. Upon being touched, the wire can trip targets while also delivering a painful shock to the limb that touched it, followed by paralysis to said limb. The paralysis lasts for one post, and the wire can sustain itself for up to 4 posts or until dismissed.

OOC; yeah, maybe i shouldn't have woken him up. bad move.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1471985]Jeff[/url][/b] » Tue Jul 09, 2013 7:03 pm

			The bull began to franti more and more as it was starting to be taunted. ITs hooves were kicking into every bush and its horns were plowing into every tree. It was definitely not having a good time as it watched some kind of static come from the human, its eyes destined for killing as i ran straight forward into a trap that it did not even see coming, tripping onto its head and laying stiffly on the ground. It couldn't stop itself or even better try to make itself get off the ground because it was stuck, but for how long?

It stared at you angrily, though sad at the same time as it sensed death coming near. On a side note, the path to destruction was still headed a long ways out and only hoof marks were on the road, all except for a thin web that was starting to show along the trees next to some kunai.

			[i]

Author: Post

The bull began to franti more and more as it was starting to be taunted. ITs hooves were kicking into every bush and its horns were plowing into every tree. It was definitely not having a good time as it watched some kind of static come from the human, its eyes destined for killing as i ran straight forward into a trap that it did not even see coming, tripping onto its head and laying stiffly on the ground. It couldn't stop itself or even better try to make itself get off the ground because it was stuck, but for how long?

It stared at you angrily, though sad at the same time as it sensed death coming near. On a side note, the path to destruction was still headed a long ways out and only hoof marks were on the road, all except for a thin web that was starting to show along the trees next to some kunai.

------------------------------------------------------------

			Tokaido's technique shouldn't be enough to kill the poor thing, as it was only meant to paralyze it for his escape. That knowledge in mind, Tokaido would leave the bull to its own end in favor of his pursuit of the rampage. as he followed the path of destruction, he took notice of the web that was strung along the treeline. he would not get close enough to touch them, for fear of a trap of some sort, but he would give them some closer inspection so as to find the nature of their creation.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

------------------------------------------------------------
Author: Post

Tokaido's technique shouldn't be enough to kill the poor thing, as it was only meant to paralyze it for his escape. That knowledge in mind, Tokaido would leave the bull to its own end in favor of his pursuit of the rampage. as he followed the path of destruction, he took notice of the web that was strung along the treeline. he would not get close enough to touch them, for fear of a trap of some sort, but he would give them some closer inspection so as to find the nature of their creation.

			Taking a deep look into the webbing that was found on the ground would prove to be fruitful. AFter much close examination of it, a source of chakra would emanate from it, though the feeling would not be all that great. The webbing would also be much more sticky than that of a normal web that no small spider could ever produce. It was surely something strange that was coming from it.

Author: Post

Taking a deep look into the webbing that was found on the ground would prove to be fruitful. AFter much close examination of it, a source of chakra would emanate from it, though the feeling would not be all that great. The webbing would also be much more sticky than that of a normal web that no small spider could ever produce. It was surely something strange that was coming from it.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1875459]Demenyx[/url][/b] » Wed May 29, 2013 8:50 am

			Arsenal sat on a large mountain ledge identical in height to him. He was at the base of the village mountains, in the exact gathering address from the letter his father gave him. Beside the genin was a river that flowed down the mountain like a weak waterfall. It lead into the sea that surrounded the training ground's edge. The air was nice and cool with some slight breeze. Skyward at the mountain's pinnacle, it was cloudy. The sky itself was a baby blue hue. Arsenal was dressed in his usual shinobi garbs, his silver short/long jumpsuit, armed with his tool pouch and holster, with his fresh and undamaged forehead protector strapped around his upper left thigh. He was in the cultivation to meet up with his new comrades.

"Cells already?" stated Arsenal, stunned when his father handed him a letter earlier in the morning. "I only been a genin for a day."

His father went on to tell the boy how proud he was of him. He had a bad tendency for doing that. It annoyed the teen yet still brought a smile to his face every time. He ended it with more: Not to worries! And to do your bests!

Heh, Arsenal laughed at the memory while closing his eyes.

I wont let you down, he thought while crossing his legs and leaning back against the mountain, relaxing with his hands behind his head. He nonchalantly waited for his unknown allies.

			[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5145651/1/?x=0#post1539790][color=saddlebrown][b]To Create an Arsenal[/b][/color][/url]

Author: Post

Arsenal sat on a large mountain ledge identical in height to him. He was at the base of the village mountains, in the exact gathering address from the letter his father gave him. Beside the genin was a river that flowed down the mountain like a weak waterfall. It lead into the sea that surrounded the training ground's edge. The air was nice and cool with some slight breeze. Skyward at the mountain's pinnacle, it was cloudy. The sky itself was a baby blue hue. Arsenal was dressed in his usual shinobi garbs, his silver short/long jumpsuit, armed with his tool pouch and holster, with his fresh and undamaged forehead protector strapped around his upper left thigh. He was in the cultivation to meet up with his new comrades.

"Cells already?" stated Arsenal, stunned when his father handed him a letter earlier in the morning. "I only been a genin for a day."

His father went on to tell the boy how proud he was of him. He had a bad tendency for doing that. It annoyed the teen yet still brought a smile to his face every time. He ended it with more: Not to worries! And to do your bests!

Heh, Arsenal laughed at the memory while closing his eyes.

I wont let you down, he thought while crossing his legs and leaning back against the mountain, relaxing with his hands behind his head. He nonchalantly waited for his unknown allies.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1852564]Izanagi[/url][/b] » Wed May 29, 2013 9:38 am

			Madoka couldn’t contain his beaming smile as he bounded down the mountainside. This month he had been promoted to Chunin, turned 15 and now was about to be placed on a new specialty squad. His shaggy hair was rustled into a state of complete disarray from the momentum of his hasty movements coupled with the familiar breeze that travelled through the rugged mountainside. As he neared his destination the boy slowed himself, taking deep breaths of the crisp invigorating air in order to quell his racing heartbeat.

He had never been very physical fit and he didn’t want to appear disheveled and out of breath on his first meeting. His hands ran through his hair, combing it in place with his fingers. The motion reminded him of his mothers chastising and nagging him to cut his hair, which brought a rebellious smirk to his face. He had grown it out longer than usual in the last few weeks, a symbol of growing independence since being promoted to Chunin.

He wore his newly aquired vest proudly, the vivid white material complimenting his black and white attire perfectly. Everything about his attire was balanced perfectly between black and white, he even wore opposite colored gloves and carried a pole intertwined with both shades. Some might deem his garb odd but Madoka had always been one to stand out.

Not too far ahead he noticed a boy about his own age, waiting on a ledge. He picked up his speed once more to come within range, [color=#fff]“Hiya, I’m Yamamoto Madoka! I guess we’re teammates!” [/color]he greeted somewhat loudly with a boyish grin plastered across his face. His excitement was welling up within him and it was hard to contain, he looked around anxiously for the rest of his squad mates.

			[i]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5956015/1/#new][color=dodgerblue]Natsuki Takeo[/color][/url] - 17th Hokage, former Anbu Commander [DEAD]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=6144753/1/#new][color=#008000]Karagata Shinjiro[/color][/url] - Kiri Bannin; Jinchuuriki, Overseer of the [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8340199][color=#4080FF]Seven Swordsmen of the Mist[/color][/url], [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=88&t=8340060][color=gold]Kintsugi[/color][/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8343035][color=#8040FF]Hyuuga Takeshi[/color][/url] - Konoha Jounin; [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8099609][color=#004000]Anbu[/color][/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=6063869/1/][color=#5a70b3]Takeda Ichiro[/color][/url] - A-Rank Waterfall Country; [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=88&t=8234960][color=#000000]Black Wake[/color][/url], [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=88&t=8099611][color=#404080]Chishiki[/color][/url], [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=88&t=8106328][color=#400040]Setsuzoku[/color][/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=8105145/1/#new][color=#BF0000]Haziwara Youji[/color][/url]- Iwagakure Special Jounin

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8344946][color=lightcyan]Jouchaku Shigeko[/color][/url] - Kiri Genin; [url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8113982][color=#800000]HHD[/color][/url]

Author: Post

Madoka couldn’t contain his beaming smile as he bounded down the mountainside. This month he had been promoted to Chunin, turned 15 and now was about to be placed on a new specialty squad. His shaggy hair was rustled into a state of complete disarray from the momentum of his hasty movements coupled with the familiar breeze that travelled through the rugged mountainside. As he neared his destination the boy slowed himself, taking deep breaths of the crisp invigorating air in order to quell his racing heartbeat.

He had never been very physical fit and he didn’t want to appear disheveled and out of breath on his first meeting. His hands ran through his hair, combing it in place with his fingers. The motion reminded him of his mothers chastising and nagging him to cut his hair, which brought a rebellious smirk to his face. He had grown it out longer than usual in the last few weeks, a symbol of growing independence since being promoted to Chunin.

He wore his newly aquired vest proudly, the vivid white material complimenting his black and white attire perfectly. Everything about his attire was balanced perfectly between black and white, he even wore opposite colored gloves and carried a pole intertwined with both shades. Some might deem his garb odd but Madoka had always been one to stand out.

Not too far ahead he noticed a boy about his own age, waiting on a ledge. He picked up his speed once more to come within range, [color=#fff]“Hiya, I’m Yamamoto Madoka! I guess we’re teammates!” [/color]he greeted somewhat loudly with a boyish grin plastered across his face. His excitement was welling up within him and it was hard to contain, he looked around anxiously for the rest of his squad mates.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=948882]Tsedas[/url][/b] » Wed May 29, 2013 11:41 am

			Nui had managed to get a decent nights sleep for a change, probably from having left the bar early last night after some asshole attempted to feel her up. She had left him with black eye, a gash from a broken bottle, and lump on his noggin from where she had rammed his head into the bar. As she slipped out of her bed she scratched her head and yawned before standing up and making her way toward the bathroom.

She was showered and a helluva lot more agreeable person but the minute she saw a reminder to meet the rest of the new team she swore loudly and multiple times as she blamed the village for cutting into a perfect time to go back to sleep. After she had a beer from her fridge, she dried herself off and started to get ready to meet this team.

She tied her hair back and saw she had forgotten to do laundry, again, leaving her with her mission attire. She normally wouldn't mind wearing it, but she knew that [i]he[/i] was gonna be there and make all sorts of stupid passes at her. Normally she didn't mind passes, but this guy was trying to hard. Grabbing her mission clothes, Nui started to get dressed as she slide into her tight body suit and fastened the collar around her neck to keep it in place.

Her jacket contrasted well with her body suit and after presented some kind of assumption Nui had fashion sense. Making sure her knife was in its sheath on the shoulder of the jacket, the woman donned the fingerless gloves and sandals that would top off her attire before reaching for her belt. She was walking out her door as she fastened around her waist and then let it hang diagonally across her hips as she walked outside.

Needless to say a few peopel were already noticing her as she made her way through the village. Yet the closer she got to the meeting point, the more she felt a foul presence in the air. "[color=brown]Crap, he must be nearby.[/color]" She muttered to herself before she started descending toward the designated location. She saw a pair of people there already and as she approached she saw they were both young. She had heard there was only one genin on the team and was about to ask who when she noticed the vest on one as she got closer.

"[color=brown]You two must be the rest of the team I heard about. Now all we need is Mr. Testosterone and we can get down to business.[/color]" She said flatly as she approached the two younger members. '[i][color=brown]Fuck, they better not have made me the only woman in this sausage fest. I'm starting to think this is punishment more than anything.[/color][/i]'

[url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_Oqmby3igoUKiR_pd4sGiA]Red Buster Gaming Youtube[/url] ||| [url=https://www.twitch.tv/redbustergaming]Red Buster Gaming Twitch[/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5955759/1/]Kojima Nao[/url] - Kumogakure -Genin - [color=#A0522D][color=#A0522D][/color]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=6209842/1/]Matsudaira Tokoha[/url] - Sunagakure - Jounin - [color=#ED2939][color=#ED2939][/color]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5635886/1/]Ishiguro Nui[/url] - Kumogakure Chuunin -  [color=brown][color=brown][/color]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5648698/1/]Awai Mariko[/url] - Konohagakure Chuunin - [color=#B2397F][color=#B2397F][/color]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5802714/1/]Jinrai Setsuko[/url] - Kumogakure Chuunin - [color=#D60270][color=#D60270][/color]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5639545/1/]Toukai Mukade[/url] - Kirigakure Chuunin - [color=#8B7765][color=#8B7765][/color]

						[url=#top]
				[i][/i]
				Top
			[/url]

------------------------------------------------------------
Author: Post

Nui had managed to get a decent nights sleep for a change, probably from having left the bar early last night after some asshole attempted to feel her up. She had left him with black eye, a gash from a broken bottle, and lump on his noggin from where she had rammed his head into the bar. As she slipped out of her bed she scratched her head and yawned before standing up and making her way toward the bathroom.

She was showered and a helluva lot more agreeable person but the minute she saw a reminder to meet the rest of the new team she swore loudly and multiple times as she blamed the village for cutting into a perfect time to go back to sleep. After she had a beer from her fridge, she dried herself off and started to get ready to meet this team.

She tied her hair back and saw she had forgotten to do laundry, again, leaving her with her mission attire. She normally wouldn't mind wearing it, but she knew that [i]he[/i] was gonna be there and make all sorts of stupid passes at her. Normally she didn't mind passes, but this guy was trying to hard. Grabbing her mission clothes, Nui started to get dressed as she slide into her tight body suit and fastened the collar around her neck to keep it in place.

Her jacket contrasted well with her body suit and after presented some kind of assumption Nui had fashion sense. Making sure her knife was in its sheath on the shoulder of the jacket, the woman donned the fingerless gloves and sandals that would top off her attire before reaching for her belt. She was walking out her door as she fastened around her waist and then let it hang diagonally across her hips as she walked outside.

Needless to say a few peopel were already noticing her as she made her way through the village. Yet the closer she got to the meeting point, the more she felt a foul presence in the air. "[color=brown]Crap, he must be nearby.[/color]" She muttered to herself before she started descending toward the designated location. She saw a pair of people there already and as she approached she saw they were both young. She had heard there was only one genin on the team and was about to ask who when she noticed the vest on one as she got closer.

"[color=brown]You two must be the rest of the team I heard about. Now all we need is Mr. Testosterone and we can get down to business.[/color]" She said flatly as she approached the two younger members. '[i][color=brown]Fuck, they better not have made me the only woman in this sausage fest. I'm starting to think this is punishment more than anything.[/color][/i]'

------------------------------------------------------------

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1869325]Jin the Sugar Glider[/url][/b] » Thu May 30, 2013 10:11 am

			Today was the day. The day Tokaido was to meet the team he would be working with, according to the village's orders. He still wasn't particularly thrilled with being forced onto a team, but that girl, Nui Ishiguro, helped to keep him interested. He had been practicing a bit more then often lately, mainly due to having to take this team seriously, other people's lives were on the line on a team, and everyone has to be at the top of their game. Because of this, he still had his mission outfit on, complete with black vest, red pants, Shuriken holster belt, Boots and pouches carrying his weapons. This was his normal training attire as well, though he did clean himself up before heading to the meeting place.

As he Neared the training ground near the bottom of the mountain, he could see from a pretty far distance the 3 people now gathered around talking. Upon closer inspection, he realized one of them was definitely Nui. [color=#090]"Well, looks like I made it on time. It looks like Nui is already getting to know our team... guess i better get down there then."[/color] Tokaido said aloud to himself as he continued his approach to the training ground. As he got closer, he realized that it looked like there were 2 Genin at first, until he noticed the vest one of them had on.[color=#090][i]"interesting...Must be a new Chuunin, i've never seen this guy before."[/i][/color]

Tokaido, Now within about 30 ft of the group, Noticed Nui was already starting in on him with the boys, no doubt making some comment at his expense. She really didn't like him it seemed... But he wasn't about to quit just because of that little detail. [color=#090]"Hey there, looks like were all gathered together. I'm Hideyoshi Tokaido, Expert ranged combatant and long range spotter."[/color] He stood over by Nui as he spoke, mainly speaking to the two that he didn't yet know. [color=#090]According to the villages orders, it appears we will be working together on a team. Let's try not to rip each other's heads off... either of them."[/color] His last comment was specifically targeted at Nui, as he looked straight at her when he said it.

			[i]
Active Characters[b]Village of Origin[/b][b]Character Name & Link[/b][b]Rank[/b][b]Color[/b][b]Sunagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=87&t=8344128]Henrin Emi[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=darkgoldenrod][b][/b][/color][/b][b]Konohagakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=85&t=8342815]Ibakuro Aiya[/url][/b][b]Chuunin[/b][b][color=#8CD600][/color][/b][b]Kumogakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=86&t=8346848]Jinrai Shizune[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#de2c9b][/color][/b][b]Kirigakure no Sato[/b][b][url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=84&t=8346175]Tsukino Kazushige[/url][/b][b]Genin[/b][b][color=#FCA311][b][/b][/color][/b]

Author: Post

Today was the day. The day Tokaido was to meet the team he would be working with, according to the village's orders. He still wasn't particularly thrilled with being forced onto a team, but that girl, Nui Ishiguro, helped to keep him interested. He had been practicing a bit more then often lately, mainly due to having to take this team seriously, other people's lives were on the line on a team, and everyone has to be at the top of their game. Because of this, he still had his mission outfit on, complete with black vest, red pants, Shuriken holster belt, Boots and pouches carrying his weapons. This was his normal training attire as well, though he did clean himself up before heading to the meeting place.

As he Neared the training ground near the bottom of the mountain, he could see from a pretty far distance the 3 people now gathered around talking. Upon closer inspection, he realized one of them was definitely Nui. [color=#090]"Well, looks like I made it on time. It looks like Nui is already getting to know our team... guess i better get down there then."[/color] Tokaido said aloud to himself as he continued his approach to the training ground. As he got closer, he realized that it looked like there were 2 Genin at first, until he noticed the vest one of them had on.[color=#090][i]"interesting...Must be a new Chuunin, i've never seen this guy before."[/i][/color]

Tokaido, Now within about 30 ft of the group, Noticed Nui was already starting in on him with the boys, no doubt making some comment at his expense. She really didn't like him it seemed... But he wasn't about to quit just because of that little detail. [color=#090]"Hey there, looks like were all gathered together. I'm Hideyoshi Tokaido, Expert ranged combatant and long range spotter."[/color] He stood over by Nui as he spoke, mainly speaking to the two that he didn't yet know. [color=#090]According to the villages orders, it appears we will be working together on a team. Let's try not to rip each other's heads off... either of them."[/color] His last comment was specifically targeted at Nui, as he looked straight at her when he said it.

								by [b][url=./memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1875459]Demenyx[/url][/b] » Thu May 30, 2013 11:31 am

			Arsenal's eyes shot open. He managed to fall asleep within the short time he laid on the mountain ledge. Which wasn't a surprise. He wasn't lazy . . . well not [i]that lazy.[/i] The genin just wasn't a morning person. More of the sleep in type, ya know? He was especially tired this morning considering the day before. It was his first day as a genin and his father interrupted his free day by making him train at 7 AM, then his mother tried to stop him from being a shinobi, afterwards his sister annoyed him, and lastly his hangout session with his all time crush was interrupted by her brother/his rival. Now this morning some dude woke him up with all this loud talking around him. Arsenal observed him before rising his torso and knee to lean on. The male looked around the same age as him. But his personality was a bit, childish. It reminded him of his sister who brought the genin great annoyance. His agitation was probably sensible in the air. He prepared to say something to the comrade but at that moment he realized a woman arrived.

"Mister Testosterone?" Reiterated Arsenal with an utter and raised brow.

The woman's voice felt firm to him, therefor coming off somewhat strict. Arsenal already didn't like that. He didn't like the idea of two mothers. Then another, Mister Testosterone he supposed, appeared. So far Testosterone-Sensei was the only one of the cell he liked. Expert ranged combatant and long range spotter? So bauss.

"So," Arsenal stood up on the ledge, he's gaze rolling from shinobi to shinobi. "Two genin, a chuunin, and a jounin? Wait--"

His father told him about how cells work. Genin like himself were put together with chuunin like his old man and super cool jounin like the Raikage. As he mentioned the two genin he pointed a thumb to himself and tried to causally place a hand on Madoka's shoulder. The two were exactly the same height from what Arsenal could tell, he figured the dude was a genin like him. He then pointed at the girl when addressing the chuunin. She was older, and a [i]girl.[/i] If there were chuunin and jounin, she would have to be chuunin. Though her being a genin wouldn't be surprising. Maybe that's why she gave that sour taste to the atmosphere? Mad she hasn't ranked up yet? Meh . . . And of course, Testies-Sensei had to be the jounin. He described himself as Arsenal's ideal shinobi. After that thought and mentioning the jounin, the boy's jaw dropped, humorously dripping drool as his eyes wided into stars.

"--you're not Raikage-sama, are you?" he asked of Tokaido with astonishment.

			[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5145651/1/?x=0#post1539790][color=saddlebrown][b]To Create an Arsenal[/b][/color][/url]

[url=https://www.narutosaigen.com/forums/viewtopic.php?&t=5145426/1/][color=#9300C4][b]Fuuma, Dememaru;[/b][/color][/url] [color=gold][i]The Walking Armory[/i][/color]

Author: Post

Arsenal's eyes shot open. He managed to fall asleep within the short time he laid on the mountain ledge. Which wasn't a surprise. He wasn't lazy . . . well not [i]that lazy.[/i] The genin just wasn't a morning person. More of the sleep in type, ya know? He was especially tired this morning considering the day before. It was his first day as a genin and his father interrupted his free day by making him train at 7 AM, then his mother tried to stop him from being a shinobi, afterwards his sister annoyed him, and lastly his hangout session with his all time crush was interrupted by her brother/his rival. Now this morning some dude woke him up with all this loud talking around him. Arsenal observed him before rising his torso and knee to lean on. The male looked around the same age as him. But his personality was a bit, childish. It reminded him of his sister who brought the genin great annoyance. His agitation was probably sensible in the air. He prepared to say something to the comrade but at that moment he realized a woman arrived.

"Mister Testosterone?" Reiterated Arsenal with an utter and raised brow.

The woman's voice felt firm to him, therefor coming off somewhat strict. Arsenal already didn't like that. He didn't like the idea of two mothers. Then another, Mister Testosterone he supposed, appeared. So far Testosterone-Sensei was the only one of the cell he liked. Expert ranged combatant and long range spotter? So bauss.

"So," Arsenal stood up on the ledge, he's gaze rolling from shinobi to shinobi. "Two genin, a chuunin, and a jounin? Wait--"

His father told him about how cells work. Genin like himself were put together with chuunin like his old man and super cool jounin like the Raikage. As he mentioned the two genin he pointed a thumb to himself and tried to causally place a hand on Madoka's shoulder. The two were exactly the same height from what Arsenal could tell, he figured the dude was a genin like him. He then pointed at the girl when addressing the chuunin. She was older, and a [i]girl.[/i] If there were chuunin and jounin, she would have to be chuunin. Though her being a genin wouldn't be surprising. Maybe that's why she gave that sour taste to the atmosphere? Mad she hasn't ranked up yet? Meh . . . And of course, Testies-Sensei had to be the jounin. He described himself as Arsenal's ideal shinobi. After that thought and mentioning the jounin, the boy's jaw dropped, humorously dripping drool as his eyes wided into stars.

"--you're not Raikage-sama, are you?" he asked of Tokaido with astonishment.
